This significant event comprises 21 major tracks, featuring 112 technical, research, and panel sessions, and is recognized as one of the top five largest annual gatherings for researchers in computer science, computer engineering, data science, artificial intelligence, STEM, and applied computing. The congress offers both in-person and online presentation options.
callForPapers:
# CSCE 2025: Call for Papers

The 2025 World Congress in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, and Applied Computing (CSCE'25) is a major event, including 21 major tracks with 112 technical, research, and panel sessions. It is scheduled to be held simultaneously from **July 21-24, 2025**, in **Las Vegas, USA**.

This year's Congress will be held **in person (face-to-face)**; however, **online presentation options** will also be available for authors and speakers who are unable to attend physically.

## Publication

All accepted papers will be published by **Springer Nature** (https://www.springernature.com/) in the proceedings (Research Books) and indexed in major Science Citation Indexation databases, including Scopus, DBLP, EI Engineering Index (Compendex, Inspec databases), Springer Link, Google Scholar, CPCI (part of Clarivate Analytics' Web of Science), ACM Digital Library, IO-Port, MathSciNet, and Zentralblatt MATH.

## Joint Conferences

The Congress is composed of a number of tracks (joint-conferences) held simultaneously:

*   ACC'25: 9th International Conference on Applied Cognitive Computing
*   BIOCOMP'25: 26th International Conference on Bioinformatics & Computational Biology
*   BIOENG'25: 11th International Conference on Biomedical Engineering & Sciences
*   CSC'25: 23rd International Conference on Scientific Computing
*   EEE'25: 24th International Conference on e-Learning, e-Business, Enterprise Information Systems, & e-Government
*   ESCS'25: 23rd International Conference on Embedded Systems, Cyber-physical Systems, & Applications
*   FCS'25: 21st International Conference on Foundations of Computer Science
*   FECS'25: 21st International Conference on Frontiers in Education: Computer Science & Computer Engineering
*   GCC'25: 21st International Conference on Grid, Cloud, & Cluster Computing
*   HIMS'25: 11th International Conference on Health Informatics & Medical Systems
*   ICAI'25: 27th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence
*   ICDATA'25: 21st International Conference on Data Science
*   ICEQT'25: 4th International Conference on Emergent Quantum Technologies
*   ICOMP'25: 26th International Conference on Internet Computing & IoT
*   ICWN'25: 24th International Conference on Wireless Networks
*   IKE'25: 24th International Conference on Information & Knowledge Engineering
*   IPCV'25: 29th International Conference on Image Processing, Computer Vision, & Pattern Recognition
*   MSV'25: 22nd International Conference on Modeling, Simulation & Visualization Methods
*   PDPTA'25: 31st International Conference on Parallel & Distributed Processing Techniques & Applications
*   SAM'25: 24th International Conference on Security & Management
*   SERP'25: 23rd International Conference on Software Engineering Research & Practice

## Submission Instructions

*   **Submission Portal:** Papers are submitted via the evaluation website: [https://american-cse.org/cgi-bin/submit/index.cgi?xprint_submit](https://american-cse.org/cgi-bin/submit/index.cgi?xprint_submit)
*   **Paper Categories and Page Limitations:** Refer to: [https://american-cse.org/csce2025/paper_categories](https://american-cse.org/csce2025/paper_categories)
*   **Formatting:** For draft submissions, all reasonable formatting/typesetting is acceptable. Authors of accepted papers will receive specific instructions to prepare final versions using the standard Springer Nature typesetting format (available at https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines). MS WORD and LaTeX templates are available.
*   **Submission Format:** Submissions must be in either PDF or MS WORD formats.
*   **First Page Requirements:** The first page must include:
    *   Title of the paper
    *   Name, affiliation, City, Country, and email address of each author (identify the Contact Author).
    *   Abstract (between 100 and 120 words).
    *   A maximum of 6 topical keywords.
    *   The type of submission (e.g., "Regular Research Paper", "Short Research Paper", or "Extended Abstract/Poster Research Paper").

## Important Dates

*   **Conference Dates:** July 21-24, 2025
*   Submission deadlines are available via: [https://american-cse.org/csce2025/deadlines](https://american-cse.org/csce2025/deadlines)

## Contact

Questions and inquiries should be sent to: CSCE'25 Conference Secretariat: cs@american-cse.org

callForPapers:
# CAADRIA 2025: Call for Papers - Architectural Informatics

The Association for Computer-Aided Architectural Design Research in Asia (CAADRIA) presents CAADRIA 2025, themed **"Architectural Informatics"**, from **March 22-29, 2025** in **Tokyo**.

## Conference Theme

CAADRIA 2025 invites contributions that reexamine the fundamental existence of architecture in the age of information technology, viewing architecture and cities as information systems. The conference encourages original, high-quality papers presenting current computer-aided architectural design research across various approaches.

## Topics of Interest

*   Artificial intelligence, neural networks and machine learning
*   Building Information Modeling (BIM)
*   City Information Modeling (CIM)
*   Collective, collaborative & interdisciplinary design
*   Computational design research & education
*   Design cognition and human-computer interaction
*   Disrupted practices, resilience, and social sustainability
*   Environmental and ecological performance
*   Generative, algorithmic & evolutionary design
*   Digital Heritage
*   Interactive environments
*   Material systems, processes and assembly
*   Practice-based design research
*   Robotics, digital fabrication and construction
*   Simulation, visualisation and impact projection
*   Theory, philosophy & methodology of computational design research
*   Urban analytics, big data analysis and smart cities
*   AR / VR / XR
*   Application of technology in the context of the Asia-Pacific Region

## Submission Process & Guidelines

*   **Submission Portal:** Access OpenConf at [https://caadria.org/openconf25/openconf.php](https://caadria.org/openconf25/openconf.php)
*   **Review Process:** A two-stage reviewing process, based on an initial abstract review and a later double-blind peer review of full-length manuscripts.
*   **Paper Template:** Adherence to the template is mandatory for publication. Download the template [here](https://www.caadria2025.org/_files/ugd/027792_636b230dacc24533a511a76894b8cf4b.docx?dn=CAADRIA2025_TEMPLATE.docx).
*   **Submission Format:** Papers must be uploaded as a single zip folder containing both the revised Word document and the PDF file.
*   **First Author Requirement:** Each paper must have a unique first author.
*   **Presentation Requirement:** CAADRIA 2025 is an **in-person-only event**. For each accepted paper, at least one author is required to register and present on-site.
*   **Registration:** Conference registration is open. Early-bird participants can enjoy reduced rates until **January 27, 2025**.

## Additional Participation Opportunities

*   **Project Exhibition (Posters):** Submit a poster to showcase your work. Submission deadline: **January 15, 2025**.
*   **Postgraduate Student Consortium (PGSC):** Master’s and PhD students can apply to present their research and receive feedback. Submission deadline: **January 15, 2025**.
*   **Young CAADRIA Award (YCA):** Open to all registered students (undergraduate and postgraduate) with an accepted paper. Awardees receive a waiver for their conference registration fee.
*   **Workshops:** Applications are open until **January 20, 2025**. Seats are limited and allocated on a first-come, first-served basis.

## Important Dates

*   **August 27, 2024:** Abstract submission deadline
*   **October 1, 2024:** Abstract acceptance notification
*   **November 7, 2024:** Deadline of workshop proposals
*   **November 24, 2024:** Full paper submission deadline
*   **Early January, 2025:** Full paper acceptance notification
*   **January 8, 2025 (noon JST):** WS application opening for participants
*   **January 15, 2025:** Project Exhibition submission deadline
*   **January 15, 2025:** PGSC candidature submission
*   **January 20, 2025:** Deadline for WS application for participants
*   **January 20, 2025:** Camera-ready Full paper submission deadline
*   **January 27, 2025:** Early-bird registration deadline
*   **January 31, 2025 (AoE):** Project Exhibition notification of acceptance
*   **March 20-21, 2025:** Student Review of Architectural Informatics Society
*   **March 22-25, 2025:** Workshop (Co-hosted by AIS)
*   **March 26-28, 2025:** Keynote speeches and paper presentations
*   **March 28, 2025:** Conference Dinner
*   **March 29, 2025:** Post Conference Tour

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ICIAP 2025

The **23rd International Conference on Computer Analysis of Images and Patterns (ICIAP 2025)** is organized biennially by CVPL, the Italian Member Society of the International Association for Pattern Recognition (IAPR).

The conference will take place in **Rome, Italy**, from **September 15-19, 2025**. The Workshops and Tutorials will be held on September 15-16, 2025, and the Main Conference from September 17-19, 2025.

ICIAP 2025 focuses on both traditional and emerging trends in computer vision, pattern recognition, and image processing, addressing both theoretical and practical aspects. The conference aims to serve as a stimulating discussion forum for researchers to meet, present their work, and exchange ideas, including oral and poster sessions, and offering invited keynote talks by distinguished speakers. The conference will also include satellite workshops and tutorials.

## Topics of Interest

The conference covers the following topics, with particular emphasis on:

*   Video Analysis and Understanding
*   Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning
*   Deep Learning
*   Multiview Geometry and 3D Computer Vision
*   Image Analysis, Detection, and Recognition
*   Multimedia
*   Biomedical and Assistive Technology
*   Digital Forensics and Biometrics
*   Image Processing for Cultural Heritage
*   Robot and Vision
*   Brave New Ideas
*   AI and science
*   X-Realities
*   Embedded Vision

## Submission Instructions

All submissions will be handled electronically via the conference’s CMT Website: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025)

*   **Templates and Instructions:** Authors can download the template and instructions from the provided link or use the [Overleaf Template](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025).
*   **Page Limit:** The maximum number of pages is **12 including references**.
*   **Review Process:** Papers will be selected through a **double-blind review process**, taking into account originality, significance, clarity, soundness, relevance, and technical content. Each submission will be managed by two Area Chairs and reviewed by at least three reviewers.
*   **Publication:** Accepted papers will be included in the ICIAP 2025 Conference Proceedings, which will be published by **Springer in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)** series.

## Additional Author Guidelines

*   **Double-blind review:** ICIAP25 reviewing is double blind. Authors must not provide information that may identify them in the acknowledgments or any other part of the paper. Violation of these guidelines may lead to rejection without review.
*   **Dual submissions:** Submissions must not have been previously published or accepted for publication in substantially similar form. Furthermore, no publication substantially similar in content (defined as having 20 percent or more overlap) should be submitted to another venue during the review period. Violation of these conditions will lead to rejection.
*   **arXiv preprints:** arXiv preprints and university technical reports are not considered publications and do not need to be cited.

## Important Dates

*   **First round paper submission:** 14 February 2025
*   **First round notification to Authors:** 31 March 2025

*   **Second round paper submission:** 15 April 2025 (extended to 29 April 2025 AoE)
*   **Second round notification to Authors:** 15 June 2025

*   **Workshop and Tutorials:** 15 - 16 September 2025
*   **Main conference:** 17 - 19 September 2025

*   **Early Bird registration deadline:** 30 June 2025
*   **Authors’ Registration deadline:** 30 June 2025

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering (CASE 2025)

The **2025 IEEE 21st International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering (CASE 2025)** is the flagship automation conference of the IEEE Robotics and Automation Society (RAS) and constitutes the primary forum for cross-industry and multidisciplinary research in automation.

**Conference Dates:** August 17 – August 21, 2025
**Location:** Los Angeles, California, USA
**Venue:** Millennium Biltmore Downtown Los Angeles, California, USA

## About CASE 2025

The conference will focus on **Secured and Trustworthy Automation**, exploring advancements in areas like collaborative robotics, self-operating systems, smart manufacturing, healthcare, farming, transportation, and smart cities. Research is sought to address vulnerabilities and biases in automation systems.

## Topics of Interest

The conference covers a wide range of topics, including but not limited to:

*   Foundation of Automation
*   Human-centered automation
*   Automation in life science and healthcare
*   Sustainability and green automation
*   Automation in agriculture and horticulture
*   Automation in meso, micro and nano-scale
*   Smart building and construction
*   Knowledge-based automation
*   Manufacturing automation
*   Cloud-based automation
*   Big data, data mining and machine learning
*   Privacy and security in automation

## Submission Categories

CASE 2025 invites proposals for special sessions, workshops/tutorials, and submissions for:

### Regular Papers
*   **Page Limit:** Up to 6 pages (including text, figures, tables, acknowledgements, and references). Two additional pages are permitted at an extra charge. Papers exceeding 8 pages will be returned without review.
*   **Format:** PDF, standard IEEE double-column format. Templates available on the website.
*   **Publication:** Included in the conference program and published in IEEE Xplore.
*   **Submission Deadline:** March 15, 2025 (Final)
*   **Submission Portal:** [RAS Papercept submission portal](https://ras.papercept.net/)

### Special Session Papers
*   Papers tailored to specific special session topics.
*   **Page Limit:** Up to 6 pages (with two additional pages permitted at an extra charge). Papers exceeding 8 pages will be returned without review.
*   **Format:** PDF, standard IEEE double-column format.
*   **Publication:** Included in the conference program and published in IEEE Xplore.
*   **Submission Deadline:** March 15, 2025 (Final)
*   **Submission Portal:** [RAS Papercept submission portal](https://ras.papercept.net/)

### Special Session Abstracts
*   **Page Limit:** Two pages.
*   **Format:** PDF.
*   **Publication:** Accepted abstracts will have oral presentations but will NOT appear in IEEE Xplore.
*   **Submission Deadline:** April 15, 2025

### Work-in-progress and Industry Presentation-only Papers
*   **Page Limit:** Up to 4 pages.
*   **Focus:** Late-breaking results or industry submissions. For Industrial Papers, at least one author must be from industry.
*   **Format:** PDF, standard IEEE double-column format.
*   **Publication:** Presentation-only papers will make oral presentations but will NOT appear in IEEE Xplore.
*   **Submission Deadline:** April 15, 2025

### Work-in-progress and Industry Presentation-only Papers for Special Sessions
*   Similar to the above, but tailored to specific special session topics.
*   **Page Limit:** Up to 4 pages.
*   **Submission Deadline:** April 1, 2025

### T-ASE, T-RO, RA-L and RAM Presentation
*   Possibility for authors of eligible IEEE Robotics & Automation Society journal papers to present their work at CASE 2025.
*   **Submission:** As a "Presentation-only paper" with no further review.
*   **Publication:** Will make oral presentations but will NOT appear in IEEE Xplore.
*   **Eligibility:** Papers published (authored or co-authored) in eligible IEEE RAS journals between December 1, 2024, and May 2, 2025.
*   **Submission Deadline:** April 30, 2025

## Important Dates

*   **Special session proposal submission:** February 15, 2025
*   **Regular and special session full paper submission:** March 15, 2025 (Final)
*   **Industry paper and work-in-progress paper submission:** April 15, 2025
*   **Workshop/tutorial proposal submission & T-ASE, T-RO, RA-L and RAM presentation submission:** April 30, 2025
*   **Paper acceptance notification:** May 30, 2025
*   **Early bird registration:** June 13, 2025
*   **Final paper submission and author registration:** June 27, 2025

## Review Process

*   **System:** Single-blinded review system.
*   **Authors:** Do not need to anonymize their papers.

## Templates and Guidelines

*   **Templates:** Available for LaTeX and Microsoft Word. Please use the official templates and adhere to the specified requirements.
    *   [LATEX TEMPLATE](https://2025.ieeecase.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/643/ieeeconf.zip)
    *   [MS WORD TEMPLATE](https://2025.ieeecase.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/643/Template-for-Preparation-of-Papers-for-IEEE-Sponsored-Conferences.docx)
*   **Language:** All papers must be written in English.

## Contact Information

*   **Official Contact Email:** case2025@usc.edu

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: COLING 2025

The 31st International Conference on Computational Linguistics (COLING 2025) invites submissions of long and short papers featuring substantial, original, and unpublished research in all aspects of Computational Linguistics and Natural Language Processing.

**Conference Dates:** January 19 – 24, 2025 (Main Conference, In-Person Only) and January 27 – 28, 2025 (Virtual Presentation Sessions).

**Location:** Abu Dhabi, UAE.

## Topics of Interest

Relevant topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Dialogue and Interactive Systems
*   Discourse and Pragmatics
*   Document Classification and Topic Modeling
*   Ethics, Bias, and Fairness
*   Information Extraction
*   Information Retrieval and Text Mining
*   Interpretability and Analysis of Models for NLP
*   Language Modeling
*   Language Resources and Evaluation
*   Linguistic Insights Derived using Computational Techniques
*   Linguistic Theories, Cognitive Modeling and Psycholinguistics
*   Low-Resource and Efficient Methods for NLP
*   Machine Learning for Computational Linguistics and NLP
*   Machine Translation and Translation Aids
*   Multilingualism and Language Diversity
*   Multimodal and Grounded Language Acquisition
*   NLP and LLM Applications (such as Education, Healthcare, Finance, Legal NLP, Computational Social Science, etc.)
*   Natural Language Generation
*   Offensive Speech Detection and Analysis
*   Phonology, Morphology and Word Segmentation
*   Question Answering
*   Lexical Semantics
*   Sentence-level Semantics (Textual Inference, Paraphrasing, etc)
*   Sentiment Analysis, Stylistic Analysis, Opinion and Argument Mining
*   Speech Recognition and Synthesis, and Spoken Language Understanding
*   Summarization and Simplification
*   Syntactic analysis (Tagging, Chunking, Parsing)
*   Vision and Robotics

Papers targeting any of these topics from the perspective of the Sustainability Goals of the UN are especially welcome.

## Submission Details

COLING 2025 invites the submission of:

*   **Long papers:** up to **eight pages** for the main body.
*   **Short papers:** up to **four pages** for the main body.

These page limits apply only to the main body of the paper. Papers must include a mandatory section discussing the limitations of the work and, optionally, a section discussing ethical considerations. Papers can include unlimited pages of references and an unlimited appendix.

Authors must follow the [general instructions for COLING 2025 proceedings](https://coling2025.org/downloads/coling-2025.pdf), which are an adaptation of the general instructions for *ACL proceedings.

**Style Files:**

*   [LaTeX](https://coling2025.org/downloads/coling-2025.zip)
*   [Word](https://coling2025.org/downloads/coling-2025.docx)
*   [Overleaf](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/templates/instructions-for-coling-2025-proceedings/hfhcytgpqmzf)

Papers deviating from the provided style files will be rejected without review.

COLING 2025 adopts the [ACL Ethics Policy](https://www.aclweb.org/portal/about/ethics).

## Submission Routes

1.  **Direct Submission:**
    *   Submit through Softconf/START using the link: [https://softconf.com/coling2025/papers/](https://softconf.com/coling2025/papers/)
    *   Each paper will receive a minimum of three reviews.
    *   Authors will have the opportunity to provide a short rebuttal.
    *   The review process will be **double-blind**.

2.  **ACL Rolling Review (ARR) Papers:**
    *   Papers reviewed through the ARR system can be committed to COLING 2025.
    *   These papers will not be re-reviewed. Decisions will be based on ARR reviews and meta-reviews.
    *   Commit ARR papers using [Softconf/START](https://softconf.com/coling2025/papers/).

For additional information, please see the [FAQ for submissions](https://coling2025.org/faqs/submission/).

## Optional Supplementary Materials: Appendices, Software and Data

Each submission can be accompanied by a single .tgz or .zip archive containing supplementary materials (e.g., program code, datasets). COLING 2025 encourages the submission of such materials to improve reproducibility. For the main track, supplementary materials must be fully anonymized.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are 11:59 PM UTC-12:00 (“anywhere on Earth”).

*   **Direct Submission Deadline:** September 16, 2024
*   **ARR Commitment Deadline:** October 20, 2024
*   **Author Rebuttal Phase (Direct Submissions):** October 30 - November 1, 2024
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** November 29, 2024
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** December 15, 2024
*   **Arabic NLP Winter School:** January 18 - 19, 2025
*   **Workshops and Tutorials:** January 19 - 20, 2025
*   **Main Conference (In-Person):** January 21 - 24, 2025
*   **Main Conference (Virtual):** January 27 - 28, 2025

## Anonymity Policy

COLING 2025 follows the ACL Anonymity Policy. Submissions must be fully anonymized. Authors are cautioned against extensive advertising.

## Multiple Submission Policy

Papers submitted to COLING 2025 cannot be under review for other conferences or journals simultaneously. Committing a paper through ARR is treated as being under review. Papers committed to COLING 2025 via ARR cannot be submitted directly. Submissions that significantly overlap in content or results with published work will be desk-rejected.

## Contact Information

For questions about submissions, please contact: [coling2025-programchairs@googlegroups.com](mailto:coling2025-programchairs@googlegroups.com)

callForPapers:
# CLOSER 2026: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Cloud Computing and Services Science (CLOSER) focuses on the highly important area of Cloud Computing, inspired by latest advances in infrastructure, operations, and services, with a strong link to Services Science. The conference explores how Cloud Computing can catalyze creativity and produce competitive advantage, covering topics related to 'Externalization of IT', such as anything as a service (SaaS, IaaS, PaaS), On Demand delivery, outsourcing, and edge cloud.

## Conference Areas

1.  **CLOUD COMPUTING ENABLING TECHNOLOGY**
    *   API Management
    *   Virtualization Technologies
    *   Containers, Containerization and Enablement
    *   Container Composition and Orchestration
    *   Container Performance
    *   Microservices
    *   Multi-Cloud Solutions Enablement
    *   Cloud Quality and Performance
    *   Cloud Optimization and Automation
    *   Cloud Management and Operations
    *   High Performance Cloud Computing
    *   Cloud Migration
    *   Monitoring of Services, Quality of Service, Service Level Agreements
    *   Function-as-a-Service and Serverless Computing

2.  **CLOUD COMPUTING FUNDAMENTALS**
    *   Cloud Application Portability
    *   Federated Cloud
    *   Cloud Computing Architecture
    *   Cloud Delivery Models
    *   Cloud Deployment Models: Public/Private/Hybrid Cloud
    *   Cloud Interoperability
    *   Cloud Risk, Challenges and Governance
    *   Cloud Standards
    *   QoS for Applications on Clouds
    *   Resource Management
    *   Energy Efficient Cloud Computing

3.  **CLOUD COMPUTING PLATFORMS AND APPLICATIONS**
    *   Development Methods for Cloud Applications
    *   XaaS
    *   Cloud Services
    *   Cloud Data Centers, Storage and Networking Technologies
    *   Cloud Workflow Management Systems
    *   Cloud Solution Design Patterns
    *   Native Cloud Applications
    *   Cloud Application Architectures
    *   Cloud Application Scalability and Availability
    *   Cloud Applications Performance and Monitoring
    *   Cloud Middleware Frameworks
    *   Digital Twinning
    *   Blockchains
    *   Metaverse, Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality
    *   Web 3.0 / Spatial Web
    *   Mobile Cloud Architectures and Models
    *   Mobile Cloud Networking
    *   Cloud Cost Analysis

4.  **EDGE CLOUD AND FOG COMPUTING**
    *   Edge Cloud Orchestration
    *   Cluster Management
    *   Edge Cloud Network Management
    *   Edge Cloud Data Management
    *   IoT-Cloud Integration
    *   AI-enabled Edge Cloud
    *   Multi-access Edge Cloud
    *   Cloud Continuum

5.  **SERVICES**
    *   Service Modeling and Specification
    *   Service Monitoring and Control
    *   Service Ecosystems
    *   Service Simulation
    *   Service Performance Analytics
    *   Analytics and Services
    *   Business Process Management and Web Services
    *   Service Innovation
    *   Service Lifecycle Management
    *   Service-Oriented Architecture
    *   Service Management
    *   Service Platforms
    *   Enterprise Architectures and Services
    *   Industrial Applications of Services Science
    *   Internet of Services
    *   Microservices: Automation, Deployment and Management, Resource Allocation Elasticity, Service State and Resilience

6.  **CLOUD SECURITY AND PRIVACY**
    *   Container Security and Isolation
    *   Security, Privacy and Compliance Management
    *   Privacy, Security and Trust
    *   Access Control
    *   Services Security and Reliability
    *   (Multi Factor) Authorization
    *   Privacy and Privacy Assurance
    *   (Decentralized) Trust
    *   Intrusion Detection

## Keynote Speakers

*   Aaron Ding, TU Delft, Netherlands
*   Sonia Ben Mokhtar, LIRIS CNRS, France
*   Philipp Leitner, Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work as a **complete paper** (Regular Paper or Position Paper) or an **abstract**. Accepted abstracts are presented but not published in the proceedings.

*   **Regular Paper:** Represents completed and validated research.
*   **Position Paper:** Portrays a short report of work in progress or an arguable opinion.
*   Submissions must be in English, carefully checked for grammar and spelling.
*   Papers should clearly indicate their technical/scientific contribution and applicability.
*   **Double-blind paper evaluation method:** Authors must NOT include author details, acknowledgments, or any reference that may disclose identity.
*   Only original papers should be submitted. Adhere to INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism.
*   All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform **PRIMORIS**.
*   Follow instructions and templates found under Guidelines and Templates.

## Publications

*   All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings with an ISBN reference, on paper and digital support.
*   SCITEPRESS is a member of CrossRef, and papers are given a DOI.
*   Proceedings will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science / Conference Proceedings Citation Index.
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.
*   Revised and extended versions of presented papers are planned for publication with Springer in a CCIS Series book (final approval pending).

## Important Dates (2026)

*   **Regular Paper Submission:** January 5, 2026
*   **Position/Regular Paper Submission:** February 17, 2026
*   **Workshop Proposal:** January 20, 2026
*   **Special Session Proposal:** January 20, 2026
*   **Tutorial Proposal:** April 10, 2026
*   **Demo Proposal:** April 10, 2026
*   **Panel Proposal:** April 10, 2026

*Note: All dates refer to AOE time, i.e. "Anywhere on Earth".*

## Secretariat

*   **Address:** Avenida de S. Francisco Xavier, Lote 7 Cv. C, 2900-616 Setúbal - Portugal
*   **Tel.:** +351 265 520 185
*   **Fax:** +351 265 520 186
*   **Email:** [closer.secretariat@insticc.org](mailto:closer.secretariat@insticc.org)
*   **Web:** [https://closer.scitevents.org](https://closer.scitevents.org)

## Venue

*   **Location:** Vila Galé Porto hotel, Porto, Portugal

## Chairs

*   **Conference Chair:** Maarten van Steen, Digital Society Institute, University of Twente, Netherlands
*   **Program Chair:** Valeria Cardellini, University of Rome Tor Vergata, Italy

## Program Committee Members

*   Luca Abeni, Scuola Superiore Sant'Anna, Italy

callForPapers:
# CHIRA 2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Computer-Human Interaction Research and Applications (CHIRA) is dedicated to bringing together professionals, academics, and students interested in the advancement of research and practical applications in Computer-Human Interaction. This includes various aspects such as Human Factors and Information Systems, Interactive Devices, Interaction Design, and Adaptive and Intelligent Systems.

## Conference Details

*   **Conference Dates:** May 18, 2025 - May 22, 2025
*   **Venue:** Nice, France
*   **Affiliated Conferences:** CHIRA 2025 is held in conjunction with ICINCO 2025, WEBIST 2025, icSPORTS 2025, and CoopIS 2025. Registration for CHIRA allows free access to the other co-located conferences as a non-speaker.
*   **Participation Options:** While the conference is primarily in-person, remote presentations are allowed for speakers unable to travel to the venue (hybrid support).

## Conference Areas

1.  **Human Factors for Interactive Systems, Research, and Applications**
2.  **Interactive Devices**
3.  **Interaction Design**
4.  **Adaptive and Intelligent Systems**

## Key Personnel

*   **Conference Chair:** Pietro Cipresso, Department of Psychology, University of Turin, Italy
*   **Program Co-Chairs:** Josef F. Krems (Cognitive and Engineering Psychology, Chemnitz University of Technology, Germany), Hugo Plácido da Silva (IT- Instituto de Telecomunicações, Portugal)
*   **Keynote Speaker:** Alice Chirico, Catholic University of Sacred Hearth, Italy

## Submission Information

*   **Submit Paper:** [Author's Login Information](http://www.insticc.org/primoris/DirectLink.aspx?idEvent=GPGpL420I4M=&roleName=C7zJAFslO/0=&type=382rcNLtAGk=)
*   **Submit Abstract:** Accepted for the Abstracts Track.
*   **Guidelines:** [Guidelines](https://www.scitepress.org/PublishedPapers/2025) for submission are available.
*   **Templates:** Templates for submission are available.

## Important Dates (All times AOE - "Anywhere on Earth")

### Regular Papers

*   Paper Submission: June 6, 2025 (expired)
*   Authors Notification: July 17, 2025
*   Camera Ready and Registration: July 31, 2025

### Position Papers / Regular Papers

*   Paper Submission: July 3, 2025 (expired)
*   Authors Notification: July 31, 2025
*   Camera Ready and Registration: September 5, 2025

### Late-Breaking Submission

*   Paper Submission: July 24, 2025
*   Authors Notification: September 3, 2025
*   Camera Ready and Registration: September 11, 2025

### Abstracts Track

*   Abstract Submission: July 31, 2025
*   Authors Notification: September 8, 2025
*   Camera Ready and Registration: September 17, 2025

### Other Deadlines

*   Workshop Proposal: May 27, 2025 (expired)
*   Special Session Proposal: May 27, 2025 (expired)
*   Tutorial Proposal: September 11, 2025
*   Demo Proposal: September 11, 2025
*   Panel Proposal: September 11, 2025

## Publication

*   The proceedings will be published by Springer in a CCIS Series book.
*   Proceedings will be submitted for evaluation for indexing by Web of Science/Conference Proceedings Citation Index.
*   Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit extended versions to an INSTICC Journal.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IEEE International Conference on Cybernetics and Intelligent Systems (CIS) 2025

The 2025 IEEE International Conference on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics (SMC) is the flagship conference of the IEEE Systems, Man, and Cybernetics Society. It provides an international forum for researchers, educators, and practitioners to learn, share knowledge, report most recent innovations and developments, and exchange ideas and advances in all aspects of systems science and engineering, human-machine systems, and cybernetics. The theme of the IEEE SMC 2025 conference is **“Navigating Frontiers: Smart Systems for a Dynamic World”**.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Authors must adhere to the IEEE conference written paper format (including paper title, authors and affiliations, figures, and references).
*   Submit the draft version of the paper for review before the due submission deadlines through the PaperCept submission system.
*   Use the provided IEEE templates in MS Word and LaTeX format. Letter page size should be used. Do not modify the style or format.
*   Submit only original work, not previously published or copyrighted (including not submitted elsewhere).
*   The conference utilizes a **single-blind review process**.
*   Accepted papers must be presented at the conference, either by the authors themselves or via proxy. Unpresented papers will be removed from post-conference distribution and the IEEE Xplore® Digital Library.
*   Accepted and presented papers will be copyrighted to IEEE and published in conference proceedings, eligible for inclusion in the IEEE Xplore® Digital Library after meeting IEEE quality review.

## Submission Templates

*   [IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-Word.doc](https://www.ieeesmc2025.org/call-for-papers.html?file=files/content/test-files/IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-Word.doc&cid=541)
*   [IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-LaTeX.zip](https://www.ieeesmc2025.org/call-for-papers.html?file=files/content/test-files/IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-LaTeX.zip&cid=541)

## Paper Types

*   **Regular Papers:** Full-length papers (up to 6 pages) with a maximum of 2 overlength pages (additional fee applies). Concise but containing sufficient details and references for critical review.
*   **Special Sessions Papers:** Focused discussions on new and innovative topics. Organizers should collect at least six papers. All papers undergo the same review process as regular papers.
*   **Work-in-Progress and Industrial Papers:** Intended to showcase work-in-progress and promote contributions from industries. Limited to four (4) pages (total length including references).
*   **Workshop Papers:** Contributions from applied research and applications, including work in progress.

## Topics

Contributions to theory and practice are invited in areas including, but not limited to:

**Cybernetics (CYB)**

callForPapers:
# IEEE International Conference on Cloud Engineering (IC2E) 2025: Call for Papers

The IEEE International Conference on Cloud Engineering (IC2E) is a premier conference on Cloud Computing, offering a high-quality and comprehensive forum for researchers and practitioners.

## Focus Areas

This year, IC2E 2025 will place a special focus on **cloud systems for sustainability** and **sustainability of cloud systems**, while other topics related to cloud engineering remain welcome.

## Submission Tracks

Authors can choose to submit their papers under either the **Research and Vision Track** or the **Industry and Experience Track**.

## Topics of Interest (Non-Exhaustive List)

*   Sustainability concerns on all levels of the Cloud stack and on all parts of Cloud systems
*   Cloud systems for sustainability, e.g., sustainable Cloud systems for environment modeling and monitoring
*   Cloud management and engineering, from single (micro-)services to complete system landscapes
*   Cloud applications, ranging from the Internet of Things (IoT) over Big Data to Machine Learning
*   Cloud systems, including storage, data distribution, and serverless computing
*   Cloud security and privacy concerns on all levels of the Cloud stack
*   Fog and Edge Computing, and all other system types in the Cloud-Edge Compute Continuum
*   Everything as a Service
*   Non-technical aspects of Cloud Computing, e.g., Cloud governance or cloud economics

## Paper Types

*   **Research papers:** Describe original well-evaluated research. Novelty is a key criterion.
*   **Vision papers:** Describe speculative but well-reasoned and inspiring papers. Focus is on insights and clarity of vision.
*   **Industry and experience papers:** Describe how existing research has been transferred into practice. Focus is on lessons learned.

*Note: Vision papers should have "(Vision Paper)" as a subtitle on the first page.*

## Submission Instructions

*   Paper submissions are **single-blind**.
*   Submit full and short papers in **PDF format** via the Web submission form: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ic2e2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ic2e2025)
*   Select either the **Research Track** or **Industry Track** option.
*   Use the **IEEE Manuscript Template for Conference Proceedings** for formatting.
    *   **LaTeX users:** Use \documentclass[10pt,conference]{IEEEtran}, without including the compsoc or compsocconf options.
*   **Formatting for Reviewing vs. Final Version:**
    *   **Full papers:** Max 9 double-column pages (excluding references) for reviewing; max 12 double-column pages (including everything) for the final version.
    *   **Short papers:** Max 5 pages (excluding references) for reviewing; max 8 pages (including everything) for the final version. Clearly mark as short papers in the title.

IC2E supports Open Science practices; authors are strongly encouraged to publish software and data sets as open-source/data.

## Review Process and Publication

*   All submitted manuscripts will be peer-reviewed based on correctness, originality, technical strength, significance, quality of presentation, and relevance.
*   Submitted manuscripts must contain original contributions and must not be under consideration elsewhere.
*   Accepted papers will be published by the IEEE Computer Society Conference Publishing Services (EI indexed).
*   The author list registered in Easychair at the time of submission **cannot be changed** in the final manuscript.
*   Papers with AI-generated text/images (e.g., from ChatGPT) are prohibited unless explicitly identified.
*   IC2E 2025 is planned as an **in-person event**. Authors of accepted papers are expected to present their papers in person.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract submission deadline:** May 1st, 2025 (AoE, firm deadline)
*   **Full and short paper submission deadline:** May 8th, 2025 (AoE, firm deadline)
*   **Author notification and start of shepherding phase:** June 23rd, 2025
*   **Camera-ready copies:** July 31th, 2025

callForPapers:
# Health Informatics Conference (HIC) 2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Health Informatics (HIC) 2025 aims to bring together researchers and practitioners interested in the specification, design, development, and application of Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) to healthcare and medicine, with a particular focus on supporting persons with special needs. Key technologies and research areas include big data, networking, graphical interfaces, data mining, machine learning, pattern recognition, and intelligent decision support systems.

### Hybrid Support

Although the conference is returning to its normal in-person mode, speakers are allowed to present remotely if unable to travel to the venue.

### Scope

The conference covers mobility and ubiquity in healthcare systems, physiological and behavioral modeling, standardization of health records and technologies, certification, integration, scaling-up, privacy, and security. Research in ICT for medical rehabilitation and assistive technologies contributes to enhancing quality of life and social integration.

## Conference Topics

*   Assistive Technologies
*   Home monitoring and Smart Homes
*   Telehealth
*   Human-Machine Interaction in Healthcare IT
*   Usability and UX of Healthcare IT
*   Integration and Scaling-up of Healthcare IT in Real Care Settings
*   eHealth
*   eHealth Applications
*   Electronic Health Records and Standards
*   Evaluation and Use of Healthcare IT
*   Healthcare Management Systems
*   Human-Machine Interfaces
*   ICT, Aging and Disability
*   Interoperability and Data Integration
*   Application of Health Informatics in Clinical Cases
*   Medical Informatics
*   Mobile Technologies for Healthcare Applications
*   Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning
*   Physiological and Behavioral Modeling
*   Software Systems in Medicine
*   Cognitive Informatics
*   Wearable Health Informatics
*   Big Data in Healthcare
*   Wellbeing Informatics
*   Confidentiality and Data Security
*   Data Mining and Data Analysis
*   Data Visualization
*   Databases and Datawarehousing
*   Decision Support Systems
*   Design and Development of Methodologies for Healthcare IT
*   Medical Artificial Intelligence
*   Large Language Models in Medicine

## Keynote Speakers

*   Antonio Lanatà, Department of Information Engineering, University of Florence, Italy
*   He Huacheng, Oujiang Laboratory, China
*   Kavitha Anandan, SSN College of Engineering, India

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work as a **complete paper** or an **abstract**. Accepted abstracts are presented but not published in the conference proceedings. Complete papers can be submitted as a **Regular Paper** (completed and validated research) or a **Position Paper** (work in progress or arguable opinion).

*   Papers must be in English, carefully checked for grammar and spelling.
*   Submissions must adhere to a **double-blind paper evaluation method**, meaning authors should not include any reference to authors' personal details, acknowledgments, or any other identifying information.
*   Only original papers should be submitted. Submissions must not substantially overlap with previously published work or work submitted elsewhere.
*   All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform **PRIMORIS**.
*   Follow the instructions and templates found under Guidelines and Templates.

### Contribution Types:

*   **Regular Papers:** (Completed and validated research)
    *   Submission Deadline: **October 2, 2025**
    *   Authors Notification: **December 4, 2025**
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: **December 19, 2025**
*   **Position Papers / Regular Papers:** (Work in progress or arguable opinion)
    *   Submission Deadline: **November 13, 2025**
    *   Authors Notification: **December 19, 2025**
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: **January 13, 2026**
*   **Abstracts Track:**
    *   Abstract Submission: **December 17, 2025**
    *   Authors Notification: **January 14, 2026**
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: **January 22, 2026**

*Note: All dates refer to AOE time, i.e. "Anywhere on Earth".*

## Workshops, Special Sessions, Tutorials, Demos, Panels

*   **Workshop Proposal:** October 29, 2025
*   **Special Session Proposal:** October 29, 2025
*   **Tutorial Proposal:** January 23, 2026
*   **Demo Proposal:** January 23, 2026
*   **Panel Proposal:** January 23, 2026

## Publications

*   All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings, with an ISBN reference, on paper and digital support.
*   SCITEPRESS is a member of CrossRef, and each paper will receive a DOI.
*   The proceedings will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science/Conference Proceedings Citation Index.
*   A short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers is planned for publication with **Springer** in a CCIS Series book (final approval pending).
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the **Springer Nature Computer Science Journal**.

summary: The IEEE International Conference on E-health Networking, Application & Services (HealthCom) will take place from October 21-23, 2025 in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates. The conference theme is "AI and Digital Health: Innovations, Challenges, and Future Perspectives," focusing on the impact of AI and digital health in revolutionizing healthcare delivery, improving services, and enhancing communication systems.
callForPapers:
# IEEE HealthCom 2025: Call for Papers

The IEEE International Conference on E-health Networking, Application & Services (HealthCom) will be held in **Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates** from **October 21–23, 2025**.

## Conference Theme

"AI and Digital Health: Innovations, Challenges, and Future Perspectives"

## About the Conference

IEEE HealthCom aims to bring together interested parties from around the world working in the healthcare field to exchange ideas, discuss solutions, and develop collaborations. The conference will explore cutting-edge innovations in AI-driven healthcare communication technologies, address the challenges of integrating digital health solutions, and explore the future of a connected, data-driven health ecosystem.

## Topics of Interest

Authors are invited to submit original papers within the eHealth area. Topics include, but are not limited to:

### Signal/Data Processing and Computing For Health Systems

*   AI and machine learning for eHealth
*   Machine and deep learning approaches for Health Data
*   Generative AI for eHealth
*   Fog/Edge/Cloud computing for wearable medical devices
*   Virtual tele-rehabilitation
*   Biometric analysis (gait analysis, eye-tracking, falls, mHealth)
*   Signal processing for virus early detection
*   Bioinformatics
*   AI for precision medicine
*   AI-driven drug discovery and development processes
*   Federated learning for privacy-preserving health data analysis

### Communications and Networking

*   Network coding and error detection/correction
*   Delay-tolerant, fault-tolerant, and reliable communication
*   Quality of Service (QoS) and Quality of Experience (QoE)
*   In-hospital networking, body area and cloud-integrated networking
*   B5G-based eHealth solutions
*   Future network designs and deterministic networking for eHealth
*   Semantic communications for eHealth
*   Network security for eHealth

### Medical, Biomedical & Health Communication Systems

*   Medical imaging, image compression and detection
*   Signal processing, data cleansing, management and mining
*   Smart health and big data
*   IoT for eHealth and telemedicine
*   eHealth platforms
*   Digital platforms for biopharmaceutical clinical trials

### Devices

*   Integration of medical devices with eHealth platforms
*   Medical device interoperability
*   Wearable and implantable devices
*   Device Security & Safety
*   Wearable devices against virus infection
*   eDrugs: nano-devices in blood stream
*   Healthcare devices and circuits for AI

### Service & Applications

*   eHealth services/applications for physical and mental health
*   eHealth services/applications for sports and exercise
*   eHealth services/applications for public health (disease prevention, pandemic preparedness)
*   eHealth services/applications for extreme environments
*   mHealth applications and software
*   Quality of experience (QoE) for eHealth services/applications
*   Security, privacy and trust for e-Health services/applications
*   Metaverse and digital twin applications for eHealth
*   Decision support systems for eHealth
*   Real-time genomic counseling and testing
*   Telemedicine services that incorporate genetic counseling and testing

### Medical Studies

*   eHealth case studies & applications
*   eHealth for neurological diseases
*   EEG/MEG in brain network analysis
*   Telehealth in Obstetrician & Gynecology
*   Cardiology tele-health
*   Integration of transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) with EEG/functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI)

## Publication

Accepted and presented technical papers will be published in the IEEE HEALTHCOM 2025 Conference Proceedings and submitted to IEEE Xplore®. Conference proceedings are indexed by Scopus and Web of Science.

Selected papers will have the opportunity to submit extended works to related Special Issues at IEEE IoT Magazine, IEEE E-JES, and IEEE Transactions on Molecular, Biological and Multi-scale Communications.

## Important Dates

*   **Paper Submission:** 08 June 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** 01 August 2025
*   **Final Manuscript (Camera Ready):** 30 August 2025

## Additional Information

*   [Author Guidelines](/authors/author-guidelines)
*   [Call for Workshop Papers](/authors/call-workshop-papers)
*   [Contact Us](https://www.comsoc.org/conferences-contact-form?conference=HEALTHCOM&conference_year=2025&_ga=2.205862740.617594255.1745843657-1783826641.1737724084)

It has a history of over 26 years and features technical sessions, invited sessions, panel sessions, and keynote addresses. ICARCV is technically co-sponsored by the IEEE Robotics and Automation Society, the IEEE Beijing (Guangzhou) Section CS Chapter, and the IEEE Control Systems Society.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: International Conference on Control, Automation, Robotics and Vision (ICARCV)

ICARCV focuses on both theory and applications covering the topics of **control, automation, robotics, and computer vision**. The conference invites contributions that explore advancements and innovations in these fields.

## Topics of Interest

### Control
*   Adaptive control
*   Robust control
*   Process control
*   Complex systems
*   Co-operative control
*   Identification and estimation
*   Nonlinear systems
*   Intelligent systems
*   Discrete event systems
*   Hybrid systems
*   Networked control systems
*   Sensor networks
*   Multi-agent systems
*   Delay systems
*   Neural networks
*   Fuzzy systems
*   Control of biological systems
*   Precision motion control
*   Control applications
*   Control engineering education
*   Marine systems
*   Data analytics

### Automation
*   Man-machine interactions
*   Process automation
*   Intelligent automation
*   Factory modeling and simulation
*   Home, laboratory and service automation
*   Network-based systems
*   Planning, scheduling and coordination
*   Nano-scale automation and assembly
*   Instrumentation systems
*   Biomedical instrumentation and applications
*   Building energy efficiency

### Robotics
*   Modeling and identification
*   Robot control
*   Mobile robotics
*   Mobile sensor networks
*   Perception systems
*   Micro robots and micro-manipulation
*   Visual servoing
*   Search, rescue and field robotics
*   Robot sensing and data fusion
*   Localization, navigation and mapping
*   Dexterous manipulation
*   Medical robots and bio-robotics
*   Human centered systems
*   Space and underwater robots
*   Tele-robotics
*   Mechanism design and applications

### Vision
*   Image/video analysis
*   Image-based modeling
*   Stereo and Structure from motion
*   Feature extraction, grouping and segmentation
*   Scene analysis
*   Object recognition
*   Learning and Statistical methods
*   Human-computer interaction
*   Tracking and surveillance
*   Biometrics
*   Vision for robots
*   Activity/behavior recognition
*   Medical Image Analysis
*   Face and Gesture

## Submission Details

Authors are invited to submit contributions covering both theory and applications. In addition to the technical sessions, the conference features invited sessions, panel sessions, and keynote addresses.

## Co-Sponsorship

ICARCV is technically co-sponsored by the **IEEE Robotics and Automation Society**, the **IEEE Beijing (Guangzhou) Section CS Chapter**, and the **IEEE Control Systems Society**.

The symposium focuses on all aspects of parameterized and exact algorithms and complexity, featuring invited talks by Martin Koutecky and an EATCS-IPEC Nerode Prize winner.
callForPapers:
# IPEC 2025: Call for Papers

The 20th International Symposium on Parameterized and Exact Computation (IPEC 2025) invites papers presenting original research in the area of parameterized and exact algorithms and complexity.

IPEC 2025 is part of ALGO 2025, which also hosts ESA 2025 and other specialized conferences and workshops. The event is planned as an in-person conference.

## Topics

The topics include but are not limited to:

*   new techniques for the design and analysis of parameterized and exact algorithms;
*   fixed-parameter tractability and kernelization results;
*   parameterized complexity theory;
*   parameterized (in)approximability results;
*   relationships between parameterized complexity and traditional complexity classifications;
*   applications of parameterized and exact computation;
*   engineering and experimentation of exact, parameterized, and kernelization algorithms.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Submissions are required to be in the [LIPIcs format](https://drops.dagstuhl.de/entities/series/LIPIcs#author). No changes to font size, page margins, etc., are permitted. Line numbers must be activated.
*   Submissions of the full version of the paper are welcome. The first 12 pages (excluding the title page) should be sufficient for assessment and contain a summary of the main results, their motivation and importance, and evidence of their correctness.
*   Results previously published or under simultaneous submission will not be considered.
*   PC members (outside the PC chairs) are allowed to author or coauthor submissions.
*   **Double-blind reviewing:** IPEC 2025 employs a lightweight double-blind reviewing process. Submissions should not reveal the identity of the authors. Ensure that references to your own work are in the third person. Authors may post drafts online or submit to arXiv, and may mention the existence of publicly available versions without providing links.

## Conflicts of Interest

Authors are responsible for declaring conflicts of interest with any of the PC members, including family members, close friends, advisors/advisees, people with the same affiliation, and frequent collaborators.

## Submission Link

Submissions via EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ipec2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ipec2025)

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract submission / paper registration:** June 27th (23:59 AoE)
*   **Submission deadline:** June 30th (23:59 AoE)
*   **Notification:** August 7th
*   **IPEC dates:** Sept. 17—19 (Wed-Fri)
*   **Camera-ready version:** October 10th (23:59 AoE)

(AoE = Anywhere on Earth (UTC-12))

## Conference and Paper Publication

Authors of accepted papers are expected to present their work at the symposium. The conference proceedings will be published in the Leibniz International Proceedings in Informatics (LIPIcs) series after the conference (post-proceedings).

The final submission will be made in LIPIcs format, with a higher page limit of 15 pages plus bibliography (no appendix).

## Awards

*   **Best Paper Award** and **Best Student Paper Award** may be conferred.
*   The **IPEC Nerode Prize** will be conferred during the conference by a separate award committee.

## PACE 2025

The Parameterized Algorithms and Computational Experiments Challenge (PACE) is focused on Dominating Set and Hitting Set problems. For more details, visit the [PACE website](https://pacechallenge.org/2025/).

## Committees

### Program Committee

*   Akanksha Agrawal (IIT Madras, India) (co-chair)
*   Matthias Bentert (University of Bergen, Norway)
*   Fedor V. Fomin (University of Bergen, Norway)

summary: The International Conference on Agents and Artificial Intelligence (ICAART 2026) aims to gather researchers, engineers, and practitioners interested in the theory and applications of Agents and Artificial Intelligence. The conference will cover various topics including Agents, Multi-Agent Systems, Software Platforms, Distributed Problem Solving, Artificial Intelligence, Knowledge Representation, Planning, Learning, Scheduling, and Perception. It also highlights applications using Natural Language Processing (NLP), Large Language Models (LLMs), Legal Technologies, and Quantum Computing. ICAART 2026, offering both in-person and remote presentation options, will be held from March 5-7, 2026, in Nice, France, and is co-located with MODELSWARD 2026, ICISSP 2026, and PHOTOPTICS 2026.
callForPapers:
# ICAART 2026: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Agents and Artificial Intelligence (ICAART 2026) aims to bring together researchers, engineers, and practitioners interested in the theory and applications in the areas of Agents and Artificial Intelligence. The scientific goal is to stimulate the development of new ideas for further progress.

### Onsite and Online Options

To accommodate various situations, ICAART 2026 is offering the option for either physical presence at the venue or virtual participation (via PDF slides or pre-recorded videos).

### Co-located Events

ICAART 2026 will be held in conjunction with **MODELSWARD 2026**, **ICISSP 2026**, and **PHOTOPTICS 2026**. Registration for ICAART allows free access to these co-located conferences (as a non-speaker).

## Scope

On one side, the conference focuses on Agents, Multi-Agent Systems, Software Platforms, and Distributed Problem Solving. On the other side, it focuses on Artificial Intelligence, Knowledge Representation, Planning, Learning, Scheduling, and Perception. Applications using Natural Language Processing (NLP), Large Language Models (LLMs), Legal Technologies, and Quantum Computing are also highlighted.

Papers describing original work are invited in any of the areas listed below. Accepted papers, presented at the conference by one of the authors, will be published in the Proceedings of ICAART with an ISBN. Acceptance will be based on quality, relevance, and originality. Both full research reports and work-in-progress reports are welcome. There will be both oral and poster sessions.

Special sessions dedicated to case-studies and commercial presentations, as well as tutorials dedicated to technical/scientific topics, are also envisaged. Companies interested in presenting their products/methodologies or researchers interested in holding a tutorial, workshop, or special session are invited to contact the conference secretariat or visit the conference website.

## Conference Areas

The following list of sub-topics is not exhaustive. Papers may address one or more of the listed sub-topics, although authors should not feel limited by them. Unlisted but related sub-topics are also acceptable, provided they fit in one of the main topic areas.

### AREA 1: AGENTS

*   Agent Communication and Languages
*   Agent Models and Architectures
*   Agent Models in Economics and Finance
*   Agent Oriented Software Engineering
*   Artificial Life
*   Legal Technologies
*   Bias
*   Cognitive Robotics
*   Conversational Agents
*   Distributed Problem Solving
*   Emotional Intelligence
*   Fairness and Reliability
*   Group Decision Making (with cooperation, coordination, negotiation, interaction protocols)
*   Intelligent Auctions and Markets
*   Mobile Agents
*   Multi-Agent Systems
*   Programming Environments and Agent Platforms
*   Robot and Multi-Robot Systems
*   Self Organizing Systems
*   Simulation
*   Swarm Intelligence and Collective Intelligence
*   Task Planning and Execution
*   Web Intelligence and Semantic Web

### AREA 2: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE

*   AI and Creativity
*   Ambient Intelligence
*   Bayesian Networks
*   Big Data
*   Case-Based Reasoning
*   Cognitive Systems
*   Constraint Satisfaction
*   Data Mining
*   Data Science
*   Deep Learning
*   e-Discovery
*   Evolutionary Computing
*   Explainable Artificial Intelligence
*   Fuzzy Systems
*   Hybrid Intelligent Systems
*   Industrial and Societal Applications of AI
*   Intelligence and Cybersecurity
*   Intelligent User Interfaces
*   Interpretable Artificial Intelligence
*   Knowledge Representation and Reasoning
*   Knowledge-Based Systems
*   Large Language Models (LLMs)
*   Legal Technologies
*   Machine Learning
*   Model-Based Reasoning
*   Natural Language Processing
*   Neural Networks
*   Ontologies
*   Planning and Scheduling
*   Privacy, Safety, Security, and Ethical Issues
*   Quantum Artificial Intelligence
*   Social Network Analysis
*   Soft Computing
*   State Space Search
*   Transparency
*   Uncertainty in AI
*   Validity
*   Valorisation
*   Vision and Perception
*   Visualization

## Keynote Speakers

ICAART 2026 will feature several invited keynote speakers, who are internationally recognized experts in their areas. Their names are not yet confirmed.

## Submission Guidelines

Authors can submit their work as a **complete paper** (Regular Paper or Position Paper) or an **abstract**. Please note that accepted abstracts are presented but *not* published in the proceedings.

*   **Regular Papers** represent completed and validated research.
*   **Position Papers** portray a short report of work in progress or an arguable opinion about an issue.

All papers must be submitted in **English**, carefully checked for correct grammar and spelling, and address one or several of the conference areas or topics. Each paper should clearly indicate the nature of its technical/scientific contribution and its applicability.

### Double-Blind Review

To facilitate the double-blind paper evaluation method, authors are kindly requested to produce and provide the paper **WITHOUT any reference to any of the authors**, including personal details, acknowledgments, or any other reference that may disclose the authors’ identity.

### Plagiarism Policy

Only **original papers** should be submitted. Authors are advised to read INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism thoroughly. Submissions must not substantially overlap with work published elsewhere or simultaneously submitted to another journal or conference with proceedings. Papers containing any form of plagiarism will be rejected without reviews. Authors should also avoid using an excessive number of self-citations.

### Submission Platform and Formatting

All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform **PRIMORIS** and should follow the instructions and templates found under Guidelines and Templates (available via the conference website).

*   Only `.pdf` or `.doc` files will be accepted for paper submission.
*   Final author manuscripts will be **8.5" x 11"**, not exceeding **6 pages**; a maximum of **4 extra pages** is allowed at additional cost.
*   **LaTeX Template:** A community-provided LaTeX template (the CTAN package `iaria` or `iaria-lite`) and an Overleaf template example are available. Ensure adherence to additional editorial rules.
*   **MS Word Template:** Helpful information for paper formatting for MS Word is available.
*   Slides-based contributions can use corporate/university formats and styles.

### Contribution Types and Suggested Presentation Slides

*   **Regular Papers:** (up to 6-10 pages) - **12-14 presentation slides suggested.** These can be academic or industrial research, survey, white, implementation-oriented, architecture-oriented papers, etc. They will be included in the proceedings, posted in the free-access ThinkMind digital library, and sent for indexing.
*   **Short Papers (work in progress):** (up to 4 pages) - **12-14 presentation slides suggested.** These represent partial achievements of longer-term projects. They will be published in the conference proceedings, posted in the free-access ThinkMind digital library, and sent for indexing.
*   **Ideas Contributions:** (2 pages) - **12-14 presentation slides suggested.** Dedicated to new ideas in their very early stage for debate and audience feedback. Will be published in proceedings, ThinkMind digital library, and sent for indexing.
*   **Extended Abstracts:** (2 pages) - **12-14 presentation slides suggested.** Summarize potential long publications with noticeable results, intended for sharing or future journal publication. Will be published in proceedings, ThinkMind digital library, and sent for indexing.
*   **Posters (Paper-based):** (2 pages) - **8-10 presentation slides suggested.** Intended for ongoing research, concrete realizations, or industrial applications/projects. The paper will be published in proceedings, ThinkMind digital library, and sent for indexing. A physical poster is also suitable for live discussions.
*   **Posters (Slide-based, only):** (8-10 slide-deck) - **8-10 presentation slides suggested.** For ongoing projects, realizations, or industrial presentations. The slide-deck will be posted post-event on [www.iaria.org](http://www.iaria.org/). A physical poster is also suitable.
*   **Presentations (Slide-based, only):** (12-14 slide-deck) - **12-14 presentation slides suggested.** These are technical marketing/industrial/business/positioning presentations. The slide-deck will be posted post-event on [www.iaria.org](http://www.iaria.org/).
*   **Demos:** (2 pages summary) - Scheduled in special time slots for maximum attendance. The two-page summary will be posted post-event on [www.iaria.org](http://www.iaria.org/).
*   **Tutorial Proposals:** (2-3 hours long) - Proposals must contain the title, content summary, and presenter(s) biography. Tutorial slide decks will be posted on the IARIA site. Please send your proposals to the secretariat.
*   **Panel Proposals:** Moderators must submit a formal proposal including background, panelist names, affiliations, topic, and short biographies. Panel slide decks will be posted on the IARIA site. Please send your proposals to the secretariat.

## Important Dates

Conference Dates: **March 5 - 7, 2026**

All dates refer to **AOE time** ("Anywhere on Earth").

| Submission Type           | Paper Submission | Authors Notification | Camera Ready & Registration |
| :------------------------ | :--------------- | :------------------- | :-------------------------- |
| **Regular Papers**        | **Oct 2, 2025**  | **Dec 4, 2025**      | **Dec 19, 2025**            |
| **Position Papers**       | **Nov 13, 2025** | **Dec 19, 2025**     | **Jan 13, 2026**            |
| **Abstracts Track**       | **Dec 17, 2025** | **Jan 14, 2026**     | **Jan 22, 2026**            |

*   **Workshop Proposal:** **October 29, 2025**
*   **Special Session Proposal:** **October 29, 2025**
*   **Tutorial Proposal:** **January 23, 2026**
*   **Demo Proposal:** **January 23, 2026**
*   **Panel Proposal:** **January 23, 2026**

> Deadlines may differ for special tracks. Please consult the conference home page for special tracks Call for Papers (if any).

## Publications

All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings, under an ISBN reference, on paper and on digital support. SCITEPRESS is a member of CrossRef and every paper in their digital library is given a DOI (Digital Object Identifier).

The proceedings will be submitted for indexation by **SCOPUS**, **Google Scholar**, **DBLP**, **Semantic Scholar**, **EI**, and **Web of Science / Conference Proceedings Citation Index**.

*   A short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers is planned to be published with **Springer in a LNAI Series book** (final approval pending).
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the **Springer Nature Computer Science Journal**.

## Keynote Lectures

ICAART 2026 will feature several invited keynote speakers, who are internationally recognized experts in their areas. Their names are not yet confirmed.

## Conference Chairs

*   **Conference Chair:** H. Jaap van den Herik, Faculty of Computer Science and Faculty of Law, Leiden University, Netherlands
*   **Program Co-Chairs:**
    *   Ana Paula Rocha, LIACC / FEUP, University of Porto, Portugal
    *   Mattias Wahde, Department of Applied Mechanics, Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden

## Secretariat

*   **ICAART Secretariat**
*   **Address:** Avenida de S. Francisco Xavier, Lote 7 Cv. C, 2900-616 Setúbal - Portugal
*   **Tel.:** +351 265 520 185
*   **Fax:** +351 265 520 186
*   **E-mail:** [icaart.secretariat@insticc.org](mailto:icaart.secretariat@insticc.org)
*   **Web:** [https://icaart.scitevents.org](https://icaart.scitevents.org)

## Venue

Venue details will be available soon.

callForPapers:
# ISC High Performance 2025: Call for Papers

## General Information

The **ISC High Performance 2025** conference and exhibition will take place from **June 10-12, 2025**, with tutorials and workshops on **June 13, 2025**, in **Hamburg, Germany**. ISC 2025 is the 40th anniversary of the world's leading forum for advancing the application of high performance computing in academia, government, and the private sector. The theme for ISC 2025 is **"Connecting the Dots"**, aiming to unite HPC, AI, quantum computing, and cloud technologies.

## Submission Types and Deadlines

ISC 2025 invites contributions across various formats. Please note that the submission deadlines for many categories have passed.

### Research Paper
*   **Status:** Call for Research Paper is **closed**.
*   **Full Submission Deadline:** ~~February 28, 2025~~
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** ~~June 10-12, 2025~~
*   **Research Paper Sessions:** June 10-12, 2025

### Poster Submissions
*   **ISC Research Poster Session:** Welcomes proposals from scientists in industry and academia to share latest research findings.
    *   **Submission Deadline:** **January 22, 2026**
    *   **Notification of Acceptance:** **March 3, 2026**
*   **ISC Project Poster Session:** For fundamental ideas, methodology, and initial work.
    *   **Submission Deadline:** **January 22, 2026**
    *   **Notification of Acceptance:** **March 3, 2026**
*   **Women in HPC Poster Session:** Spotlights women and underrepresented individuals in early stages of their HPC careers.
    *   **Submission Deadline:** **January 24, 2025 (extended)**

### Birds of a Feather (BoF)
*   **Status:** **Closed**.
*   **Full Submission Deadline:** ~~February 24, 2025~~
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** ~~June 10-12, 2025~~

### Tutorials
*   **Status:** **Closed**.
*   **Full Submission Deadline:** ~~February 14, 2025~~
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** ~~June 13, 2025~~

### Workshops
*   **Status:** **Closed**.
*   **Submission Deadline Workshops with Proceedings:** ~~October 20, 2025~~
*   **Submission Deadline Regular Workshops:** ~~December 10, 2025~~
*   **Notification of Acceptance (Workshops with proceedings):** ~~December 5, 2025~~
*   **Notification of Acceptance (Regular Workshops):** ~~February 4, 2026~~

## Program Chairs and Keynote Speakers

### Program Chairs
*   **Program Chair:** Torsten Hoefler (ETH Zurich, Switzerland)
*   **Program Deputy Chair:** Rosa M. Badia (Barcelona Supercomputing Center (BSC), Spain)

### Keynote Speakers
*   **Opening Keynote:** Mark Papermaster (AMD Chief Technology Officer & Executive Vice President, USA)
*   **Midweek Keynote:** Bjorn Stevens (Director of Climate Physics Department, Max Planck Institute for Meteorology Hamburg, Germany)
*   **Closing Keynote:** Yutong Lu (Director, National Supercomputing Center, Guangzhou & Shenzhen, China)

## Awards

*   **Jack Dongarra Early Career Award:** Recognizes outstanding contributions to HPC, includes a certificate and 5,000 Euros prize.
*   **Hans Meuer Award:** Honors the best research paper submitted to the conference's Research Papers Committee, includes a cash prize of 3,000 Euros and a certificate.
*   **Research Poster Award:** Recognizes three outstanding research posters, with cash prizes of 500 Euros (first place), 300 Euros (second place), and 200 Euros (third place).

## Become a Reviewer!

ISC invites experienced reviewers to express interest in evaluating submissions for its contributed program. Apply via: [https://ssl.linklings.net/conferences/isc_hpc/?page=Submit&id=ApplicationFormtoReviewSubmissionsforISCHighPerformanceApplication&site=ischpc2025](https://ssl.linklings.net/conferences/isc_hpc/?page=Submit&id=ApplicationFormtoReviewSubmissionsforISCHighPerformanceApplication&site=ischpc2025)

## Contact Information

*   **Conference Program Managers:**
    *   Ms. Isabel Gräbner
    *   Ms. Tanja GrüNter
*   **General Inquiries:** [https://isc-hpc.com/contact-general-request/](https://isc-hpc.com/contact-general-request/)

## Publication

All accepted ISC 2025 Research Papers are published in the **IEEE Xplore®** as open-access proceedings.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ICAIIC 2026

The 8th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Information and Communication (ICAIIC 2026) aims to facilitate the transfer of AI technologies into practical applications, developing intelligent ICT systems, and exploring AI applications for content, platforms, networks, and devices.

The conference will take place in **Tokyo, Japan & as a Virtual Conference**.

ICAIIC 2026 invites original, unpublished contributions in all aspects of AI in information and communication. Submitted articles must not be under consideration for publication elsewhere. The conference also welcomes submissions of short papers on early-stage research or development in progress, position papers on new ideas, and industry papers.

## Publication

Accepted and presented papers will be published in the **ICAIIC Conference Proceedings** with an assigned ISBN number and submitted to IEEE Xplore, Scopus, and EI Compendex. Additionally, extended versions of selected papers will be published in international journals as a special issue for ICAIIC 2026, including:

*   **ICT Express (SCIE)**
*   **Wireless Personal Communications (SCIE)**
*   **Wireless Communications and Mobile Computing (SCIE)**

## Topics of Interest

The topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Information and Communications Technology
*   AI for Image Processing and Multimedia
*   AI Applications for Networking and IoT
*   AI for Control and Decision Systems
*   AI Applications for Mobile Communication
*   AI for Energy, Computer Systems and Semiconductor Device
*   AI for Data Analysis, Big Data and Cloud
*   AI for Neuroscience and Neuroengineering
*   AI for eHealth
*   AI for Industrial Applications
*   AI Mobility
*   AI for Security and Privacy in Blockchain
*   AI for Services Applications and Emerging Topics
*   AI Foundation

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Format:** All papers must be submitted electronically in **PDF format** via EDAS.
*   **Link:** [https://edas.info/N32555](https://edas.info/N32555)
*   **Formatting:** Submissions should be formatted with single-spaced, double-column pages using at least **10-point font** on A4 or letter-sized pages in IEEE style.
*   **Length:** The maximum length for full papers is **6 pages**. Full papers must be at least 3 pages long.
*   Detailed formatting and submission instructions will be available on the conference website.

## Call for Workshop Proposals

Proposals are invited for half-day or full-day workshops on communication and networking topics. Please contact the chairs, Sungrae Cho and Howon Kim, at [srcho@cau.ac.kr](mailto:srcho@cau.ac.kr) and [howonkim@pusan.ac.kr](mailto:howonkim@pusan.ac.kr).

## Best Paper Awards

The best papers will be selected by the technical program committee members from among the regular papers presented at ICAIIC 2026.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline:** Sept. 1, 2025
*   **Acceptance Notification:** Dec. 1, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Paper:** Dec. 15, 2025

## Committees

*   **International Advisory Committee**
*   **Steering Committee**
*   **Organizing Committee**
*   **Technical Program Committee**

# ISGC 2025: Call for Abstracts

The **International Symposium on Grids & Clouds (ISGC) 2025** is accepting abstracts for its upcoming event.

## Key Dates

*   **Opening day:** October 21, 2024
*   **Submission deadline:** December 19, 2024

**Note:** The call for abstracts is now closed.

## Themes

The conference will focus on:

*   **AI and Hybrid Quantum - Shaping Tomorrow’s Scientific Breakthroughs**
*   Practical deployment of AI technologies, including machine learning models and large language models (LLMs).
*   The emerging field of hybrid quantum computing and its integration with traditional supercomputers.

## Co-located Events

ISGC 2025 is co-located with several other events as part of a larger congress.

## Contact Information

For inquiries, please contact: [vhuang@gate.sinica.edu.tw](mailto:vhuang@gate.sinica.edu.tw)
