summary: The 2025 International Conference on Computer, Information, and Telecommunication Systems (CITS 2025) will be held in Colmar, France, from July 16-18, 2025. It is an international forum for scientists, engineers, and practitioners to present their latest research and development results in all areas of Computer, Information, and Telecommunication Systems. The conference will feature tutorials, technical paper presentations, and distinguished keynote speeches. Accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore.
callForPapers:
# CITS 2025: Call for Papers

The 2025 International Conference on Computer, Information, and Telecommunication Systems (CITS 2025) will be held in **Colmar, France, from July 16-18, 2025.**

It is an international forum for scientists, engineers, and practitioners to present their latest research and development results in all areas of Computer, Information, and Telecommunication Systems.

## Important Dates

*   Invited sessions, workshops, tutorials proposals: Extended to **May 30, 2025**
*   Paper submission: Extended to **May 30, 2025**
*   Author notification: **June 30, 2025**
*   Camera-ready paper submission: **July 9, 2025**

## Paper Submission

Please, follow instructions given in the detailed final paper preparation and submission instructions available for authors (also in [PDF format](CITS2025_final_instructions/CITS2025_final_instructions.pdf)).

Papers should be written in English with a maximum paper length of **8 printed pages** (10-point font, A4 size paper) including figures. For your submission you can use the standard IEEE Transactions templates for Microsoft Word or LaTeX formats found at: [https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html) (Remember: A4 size)

Papers must be submitted in Portable Document Format (PDF) format, using the following EDAS link: [https://edas.info/N33103](https://edas.info/N33103)

**Important Notice:** Papers are reviewed on the basis that they do not contain plagiarized material and have not been submitted to any other conference at the same time (multiple submission). To learn more about this matter; visit:

*   [IEEE Policy on Plagiarism](http://www.ieee.org/publications_standards/publications/rights/Multi_Sub_Guidelines_Intro.html)
*   [IEEE Policy on Multiple Submission](http://www.ieee.org/publications_standards/publications/rights/Multi_Sub_Guidelines_Intro.html)

## Conference Registration

CITS 2025 will be held as a hybrid conference in the period **July 16-18, 2025, Colmar, France.**

Authors can only register with two payment options: credit card and bank wire (through EDAS). Registration covers: Access to all technical sessions, keynote speeches, e-program, e-proceedings, and coffee breaks.

**Please read CANCELLATION POLICY first before you pay for the registration.**

### Registration Fees:

| Category                                                                        | IEEE Member | Non-member | Deadline                                 |
| :------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | :---------- | :--------- | :--------------------------------------- |
| **Author Registration** (for Student or Non-Student until June 25th, 2025) | **€590**    | **€690**   | Until June 25th, 2025                     |
| **No-paper Early Registration** (until June 25th, 2025)                       | **€590**    | **€690**   | Until June 25th, 2025                     |
| **No-paper Late** (from June 26th, 2025)/On Site Registration                | **€690**    | **€790**   | From June 26th, 2025                      |
| **No-paper Student Registration** (from June 26th, 2025)                      | **€250**    | **€250**   | From June 26th, 2025                      |
| **Extra Page Charge** (for each page beyond 8 pages/paper)                    | **€60**     | **€60**    |                                          |

**FOR AUTHORS:** All attendees at CITS 2025 should make the registration. To be published in the CITS 2025 Conference Proceedings and to be eligible for publication in IEEE Xplore, at least one author of an accepted paper is required to register for the conference at the **FULL** registration rate.

One **FULL REGISTRATION** allows the author to upload **ONE** paper (up to 8 pages) and the Non-refundable registration fees must be paid by **June 26th, 2025**.

### CANCELLATION POLICY:

> For Author Refunds: Authors who have registered their accepted paper are not eligible for refund if decided to withdraw their paper.
> For Non-authors, from June 26th, 2025 onwards, there will be No Refund for cancellation.

### How to register for CITS 2025

1.  Go to the [CITS 2025 Registration at EDAS](https://edas.info/r33103) (sign in or, if you do not have an EDAS account, sign up)
2.  Members of IEEE must keep updated their society membership in EDAS (check the "update your society memberships" link) in order to register with reduced charges
3.  Click "Icon" of Payment by Credit Cards or Bank Wire
4.  Enter necessary card details as well as VAT numbers or other details for your invoice; then click the button of "PAY"
5.  For Bank Wire, it takes a while for the EDAS system to update your payment status (Important Reminder: please pay "All Bank's Charges If Any Are To Be Born" by yourself!)
6.  After successful payment (via credit card or bank wire), the official receipt will be available to be downloaded from EDAS. We don’t offer the manual/customized receipt.
7.  Any problem occurs in EDAS, please Click "Request help" (on the bottom line of the page) and EDAS staff will reply to you ASAP.

## Topics of Interest

### Track I: Computer Systems

### Track V: Telecommunication Systems

### Track VI: Security Systems

*   Authentication and access control

*   Security of personal area networks
*   Security of WiFi and WiMax systems
*   Security of web systems
*   Secure PHY and MAC protocols
*   User & location privacy
*   Virtual Private Network systems
*   Vulnerability and Virus analysis
*   Vulnerability and attack modeling
*   Web security and privacy

## Location and Venue

CITS 2025 will take place in the **Institut Universitaire de Technologie de Colmar (IUT), Universitè de Haute Alsace:** 34, Grillenbreit Street, 68008 Colmar, France.

Colmar is located in the eastern part of France, near the German and Swiss border.

## Keynote Speakers

*   **Helen Karatza:** Resource Allocation and Scheduling in the Mist-Fog-Cloud Continuum
*   **Pengfei Wang:** Federated Unlearning and Its Applications
*   **Khalid Mahmood:** Robust and Secure Authenticated Solutions for Contemporary and Critical Infrastructures
*   **Habib Mostafaei:** Geo-Distributed Microservice Execution: Opportunities and Challenges
*   **Jaafar Gaber:** Beyond the Algorithm: Symbolic Reasoning and Programmable Matter for the Next Generation of Intelligent Systems
*   **Axel Sikora:** Heterogeneous Real-Time & Secure Networks: Integrating Ethernet, WiFi, and Campus-B5G Networks

summary: The 28th International Conference on Pattern Recognition (ICPR) will be held in Lyon, France from August 17-21, 2026. ICPR is a leading event for the International Association for Pattern Recognition, covering a wide range of topics including Computer Vision, Machine Learning, and Image Processing.
callForPapers:
# ICPR 2026: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Pattern Recognition (ICPR) is the leading event of the International Association for Pattern Recognition, recognized as a top conference in the field.

The 28th ICPR will be held in **Lyon, France from August 17-21, 2026** and encompasses a wide range of topics where Pattern Recognition methods are applied in fields including Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Image Processing, Speech and Natural Language Processing, and Sensor Pattern Processing. The conference offers an excellent platform for students, academics, and industry researchers to foster new ideas and collaborations.

## Main Topics of Interest

*   Artificial Intelligence, Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning
*   Computer and Robot Vision
*   Image, Speech, Signal and Video Processing
*   Biometrics and Human Computer Interaction
*   Document Analysis and Recognition
*   Biomedical Imaging and Bioinformatics

## Preliminary Call for Papers

The flyer of the preliminary call for papers is available [here](files/flyerPreCallFP.pdf).

## Contact

For any questions, please contact contact@icpr2026.org

summary: The IEEE International Symposium on Autonomous Decentralized Systems (ISADS) is part of the IEEE International Congress on Intelligent and Service-Oriented Systems Engineering (CISOSE), held in Tucson, Arizona, from July 21-24, 2025. CISOSE features keynote speakers, panelists, and an exhibition of real-world solutions in academia and industry. The venue is the University of Arizona Student Union Building.
callForPapers:
# IEEE ISADS 2025: Call for Papers

The 16th IEEE International Symposium on Autonomous Decentralized Systems (ISADS) will be held as part of the IEEE International Congress on Intelligent and Service-Oriented Systems Engineering (CISOSE) from **July 21-24, 2025**, in **Tucson, Arizona, United States** at the **University of Arizona Student Union Building**.

IEEE CISOSE is the premier event on service-oriented systems and the practices involving these systems. It constitutes a platform and venue for the wider community of Service-Oriented Systems Engineering and Distributed and Mobile Systems enthusiasts.

## Keynote

The CISOSE congress will feature excellent keynote speakers and panelists in several parallel program tracks.

*   **Title:** Software Architects Are Dead—Long Live the AI-Augmented Architect!
*   **Speaker:** Davide Taibi (Full Professor of Software Engineering at the University of Oulu)
*   **Date:** Tuesday July 22, 2025 at 9:00am

## Important Dates for IEEE ISADS

| What                       | Date           |
| :------------------------- | :------------- |
| Camera-ready copies due    | May 18, 2025   |
| Author notification        | May 10, 2025   |
| Paper submission deadline | April 10, 2025 |

## CISOSE 2025 Co-located Conferences

*   IEEE AI TEST 2025 - 7th IEEE International Conference On Artificial Intelligence Testing.
*   IEEE BigDataService 2025 - 11th IEEE International Conference on Big Data Computing Service and Machine Learning Applications.
*   IEEE DAPPS 2025 - 7th IEEE International Conference on Decentralized Applications and Infrastructures.
*   IEEE JCC 2025 - 16th IEEE International Conference on Jointcloud Computing.
*   IEEE IMC 2025 - 13th IEEE International Conference on Intelligent Mobile Computing.
*   IEEE SOSE 2025 - 19th IEEE International Conference On Service-Oriented System Engineering.
*   IEEE FTS 2025 - the 2025 IEEE Future Technology Summit.
*   IEEE FITYR 2025 - 2nd IEEE International Workshop on Future Intelligent Technologies for Young Researchers.

## Committees

*   **Steering Committee:** More details on the website.
*   **Lifetime Honorary Chair:** More details on the website.
*   **General Chair:** More details on the website.
*   **Program Chairs:** More details on the website.
*   **Program Committee:** More details on the website.

## More Information

*   **CISOSE 2025 Home:** [https://conf.researchr.org/home/cisose-2025](https://conf.researchr.org/home/cisose-2025)
*   **IEEE ISADS 2025 Track:** [https://conf.researchr.org/track/cisose-2025/cisose-2025-ieee-isads-2025](https://conf.researchr.org/track/cisose-2025/cisose-2025-ieee-isads-2025)

The conference focuses on explainable and responsible AI, security, privacy, ethics in AI, machine learning, and applications related to decision support, knowledge-based systems, robotics, planning, computer vision, and more.
callForPapers:
# ISMIS 2024: Call for Papers

The 27th International Symposium on Methodologies for Intelligent Systems (ISMIS 2024) will be held in **Poitiers / Futuroscope, France 🇫🇷** from **June 17-19, 2024**.

## ISMIS 2024 in a Nutshell

*   **Submission date:** February 19, 2024
*   **Submission website:** [ISMIS 2024 Online Submission System](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ismis2024)

## Conference Scope

This year’s conference theme spans over two main directions: “*the concepts and metrics to evaluate the explainability of AI systems*” and “*the principles of responsible AI*”.

Relevant conference topics include but are not limited to:

*   Explainable AI (XAI)
*   Responsible AI
*   Security, Privacy and Ethics in AI
*   Machine Learning (Robustness, Trustworthiness, Biases, Uncertainty, etc.)
*   Multi-Instance, Multi-Label and Multi-Task Learning
*   Deep Learning, Neural Networks
*   Causality and Machine Learning
*   Anomaly Detection
*   Data Mining
*   Recommender Systems
*   Constraint-based Systems
*   Autonomous Systems (UAVs, Robots, Agents, etc.)
*   Applications (Configuration, Internet of Things, Smart Cities, Healthcare, Music Information Retrieval, Games, Archeology, Earth Observing Systems, Business Process Management, etc.)
*   Intelligent User Interfaces
*   User Modeling
*   Human Computation
*   Socially-aware Systems
*   Intelligent Agent Technology
*   Intelligent Data Processing and Analytics
*   Intelligent Information Retrieval
*   Natural Language Processing
*   Knowledge Integration and Aggregation
*   Knowledge Visualization
*   Knowledge Representation
*   Soft Computing
*   Web & Text Mining
*   Digital Libraries
*   Urban Traffic Control and Mobility
*   Ethics

## Important Dates

| Event                            | Date            |
| -------------------------------- | --------------- |
| Paper Submission                 | February 19, 2024 |
| Notification of Acceptance       | March 15, 2024    |
| Camera-ready version             | March 31, 2024    |
| Author registration/payment deadline | March 31, 2024    |
| Non-author early registration    | April 30, 2024    |
| Non-author late registration     | May 31, 2024      |
| ISMIS’2024 conference date       | 17-19 June, 2024  |

**All deadlines are at 11:59pm in the Anywhere on Earth timezone.**

## Submission Guidelines

Authors are invited to submit original unpublished papers that demonstrate current research on one of the session topics of interest. Papers should be prepared in PDF form using the Springer LNCS/LNAI style (max 10 pages) and submitted via [ISMIS 2024 Online Submission System](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ismis2024).

All submitted papers will be reviewed by the members of the ISMIS PC members.

## Publications of Papers

The ISMIS 2024 proceedings will be published by Springer in Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence. Authors of best papers (up to 12) will be invited to submit their extended versions to the Special ISMIS 2024 Track of the Journal of Intelligent Information Systems (JIIS) published by Springer.

## Awards

ISMIS 2024 will award **600 EUR** to the **best conference paper** and **400 EUR** to the **best student paper** (student has to be the first author).

## Contact

For any questions regarding ISMIS 2024, please contact the organizing committee:

*   [ismis2024@ensma.fr](mailto:ismis2024@ensma.fr)
*   [#ismis2024](https://twitter.com/search?q=ismis2024)

# JADT 2024 - Call for Papers

The 17th International Conference on Statistical Analysis of Textual Data (JADT 2024) will take place in **Brussels, Belgium, from June 25-27, 2024**.

The conference will take place **exclusively face-to-face**.

## Languages

Submissions, communications, and presentations can be made in **English, French, Italian, or Spanish**.
All communications and presentations must contain an **English abstract**.

## Topics of Interest

The conference welcomes submissions on the application of statistical models and tools in the following domains:

*   Textometry, Statistical Analysis of Textual Data
*   Exploratory Textual Data Analysis
*   Corpus and Quantitative Linguistics
*   Natural Language Processing
*   Text Corpora Encoding
*   Statistical Analysis of Unstructured and Structured Data
*   Text Categorisation, Fuzzy Classification and Visualization
*   Information Retrieval and Information Extraction
*   Text Mining, Web Mining, Semantic Web
*   Stylometry, Discourse analysis
*   Software for TextualData Analysis
*   Machine Learning for Textual Data Analysis
*   Multilingual and parallel corpora

## Submission Guidelines

Participants interested in presenting a paper for either an oral or poster presentation should submit a **title and abstract in .pdf format (maximum 20 rows)**.

The full text of the communication should be **maximum 10 pages, including references**.

Authors are invited to submit the final accepted version of their paper (10 pages).

An author will not be allowed to present two different papers alone.

## Important Dates

| Date                 | Event                                                       |
| -------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------- |
| **November 30, 2023** | **Deadline for abstract submission (intention to participate)** |
| **February 11, 2024** | **Submission deadline: First Version of Paper (Full-text)**     |
| **March 13, 2024**    | **Notification to Authors and opening of registrations**      |
| **April 1, 2024**     | **Final Camera-Ready Paper Delivery**                         |
| **April 1, 2024**     | **Deadline for registration for authors of a paper**          |
| **May 15, 2024**      | **End of reduced-rate entries**                               |

## Contact

For further information or enquiries, see "contact" on the website: [mailto:jadt-2024@sciencesconf.org](mailto:jadt-2024@sciencesconf.org).

callForPapers:
# PRO-VE 2024: Call for Papers

**Navigating Unpredictability: Collaborative Networks in Non-linear Worlds**

The IFIP Working Conferences on Virtual Enterprises (PRO-VE) 2024 is a forum for sharing and discussing current developments and experiences regarding the role of collaborative networks in managing non-linear Ecosystems and Societies.

Contributions are invited from multiple and diverse disciplines such as Engineering, Managerial, and Socio-Human sciences: industrial engineering, computer science, manufacturing, organization science, logistics, management, and social sciences, among others.

## Topics

*   AI and digital transformation for collaborative systems
*   Distributed cognition in agile and resilient collaborative systems
*   Collaboration in untrustworthy environments
*   Collaborative cognitive cyber-physical systems
*   Agile design and management of collaborative networks
*   Smartness and adaptability of collaborative logistics and transportation networks
*   Human-machine collaboration for agile processes
*   Society 5.0 and collaborative networks
*   Complex hybridization of collaboration – organizations, people, machines, intelligent systems
*   Resilience, sustainability, and antifragility of networked organizations
*   Digital twins for adaptable collaborative networks
*   Ethics, security, and trust in a changing world
*   Collaborative risk and crisis management
*   VUCA management in collaborative networks
*   CN applications and case studies in multiple fields

## Special Sessions

*   [Special Session 1: Collaborative Networks as Driver of Innovation in Organizations 5.0](/page/paper_submission#SS1)
*   [Special Session 2: Fostering Collaborative and Interoperable Digital Models for Digital Twins](/page/paper_submission#SS2)
*   [Special Session 3: Empowering Vulnerable Populations Wellbeing through Collaborative Networks](/page/paper_submission#SS3)
*   [Special Session 4: Trust and trustworthy technologies in collaborative networks](/page/paper_submission#SS4)
*   [Special Session 5: Collaborative Manufacturing Systems in the Digital Era](/page/paper_submission#SS5)
*   [Special Session 6: Zero Defects and Zero Waste strategies in Industrial Collaborative Networks](/page/paper_submission#SS6)
*   [Special Session 7: Collaborative Ecosystems: Skills and Technologies for Resilient Futures](/page/paper_submission#SS7)

## Important Dates

*   **Special session proposal:** March 1, 2024 (submitted to [cgi-pro-ve2024-sessions@listes.mines-albi.fr](mailto:cgi-pro-ve2024-sessions@listes.mines-albi.fr))

summary: SimTech 2025, hosted by CORYS, is a simulation technology and training conference taking place in Grenoble, France from October 7 to 9, 2025. The conference will feature keynote speaker Hans Härting, who will discuss building real-world competence through high-fidelity simulation in high-stakes environments.
callForPapers:
# SimTech 2025: Call for Participation

The Simulation Technology and Training Conference (SimTech), hosted by CORYS, will take place in **Grenoble, France from October 7 to 9, 2025**.

This year's event will bring together leaders in simulation technology, training, and industry operations.

## Keynote Speaker

**Hans Härting** will be the keynote speaker, focusing on the importance of high-fidelity simulation for developing real-world competence in high-stakes environments. His keynote, titled "Competence Isn’t Something You Can Prescribe — It Must Be Developed," will explore why true competence must be earned through experience, practice, and the right tools.

### Key Takeaways from the Keynote:

*   Effective training is a necessity in high-stakes environments.
*   The closer training replicates real-life conditions, the better the outcomes.
*   Simulation provides the highest standard of practice.
*   Only high-fidelity simulation builds high-level competence.

## Topics of Interest

SimTech 2025 will explore the future of training and simulation across various industries, including:

*   Power Simulation
*   Transport Simulation
*   Process Industries Simulation

## Additional Information

*   For the full conference agenda, please [Click here for the full conference agenda](https://www.corys.com/en/simtech-france-2025-keynote/).

## Contact

For inquiries, please use the contact information provided on the CORYS website.

summary: The 47th International ACM SIGIR Conference on Research and Development in Information Retrieval (SIGIR 2024) will be held in Washington D.C., USA, from July 14-18, 2024. SIGIR is a major international forum for information retrieval research, with a focus on new research results, systems, and techniques. callForPapers:
# SIGIR 2024: Call for Full Papers

The 47th International ACM SIGIR Conference on Research and Development in Information Retrieval will be held in-person from **July 14th to 18th, 2024** in **Washington D.C., USA**.

SIGIR is the major international forum for the presentation of new research results, and the demonstration of new systems and techniques, in the broad field of information retrieval (IR).

## Important Dates for Full Papers

Time zone: Anywhere on Earth (AoE)

*   **Full paper abstracts due:** January 18, 2024
*   **Full papers due:** January 25, 2024
*   **Full paper notifications:** March 25, 2024

Full paper authors are required to submit an abstract by midnight January 18, 2024 AoE. Paper submission is not possible without a submitted abstract.

## Submission Guidelines

*   See this [brief checklist to strengthen an IR paper](https://sigir.org/sigir2022/checklist-to-strengthen-an-ir-paper/) for authors and reviewers.
*   Full research papers must describe original work that has not been previously published, not accepted for publication elsewhere, and not simultaneously submitted or currently under review in another journal or conference.
*   Submissions must be in English, in PDF format, and be at most 9 pages (including figures, tables, proofs, appendixes, acknowledgments, and any content except references) in length, with unrestricted space for references, in the current ACM two-column conference format.
*   Suitable LaTeX, Word, and Overleaf templates are available from the ACM Website (use “sigconf” proceedings template for LaTeX and the Interim Template for Word).
*   ACM’s CCS concepts and keywords are required for review.
*   Submissions must be anonymous and should be submitted electronically via EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=sigir24](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=sigir24)
*   At least one author of each accepted paper is required to register for, and the author(s) or their delegate(s) must present the work at the conference in person.

## Anonymity and Pre-Print/ArXiv Policy

The full paper review process is double-blind. Authors are required to take all reasonable steps to preserve the anonymity of their submission. However, your paper must conform to the [SIGIR 2024 Pre-Print/ArXiv Policy](policy_arxiv.html). Breaking anonymity or pre-print/ArXiv policy puts the submission at risk of being desk rejected.

## Authorship Policy

Authors should carefully go through [ACM’s authorship policy](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/new-acm-policy-on-authorship) before submitting a paper. Please ensure that all authors are clearly identified in EasyChair before the submission deadline. No changes to authorship will be permitted for the camera-ready submission under any circumstance or after the abstract submission deadline.

## Desk Rejection Policy

Submissions that violate the anonymity, pre-print policy, length, or formatting requirements, or are determined to violate ACM’s policies on academic dishonesty, including plagiarism, author misrepresentation, falsification, etc., are subject to desk rejection by the chairs. 

## Relevant Areas

Relevant areas include:

*   Search and Ranking.
*   System, Efficiency and Scalability.
*   Recommender Systems.
*   Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing for IR.
*   Conversational IR.
*   Humans and Interfaces.
*   Evaluation.
*   Fairness, Accountability, Transparency, Ethics, and Explainability (FATE) in IR.
*   Multi Modal IR.
*   Domain-specific Applications.
*   Other IR Topics.

## Program Chairs

*   Claudia Hauff, Spotify, The Netherlands
*   Guido Zuccon, University of Queensland, Australia
*   Yi Zhang, University of California Santa Cruz, USA

## Contact

For any questions about full paper submissions you may contact the Program Chairs by email to [sigir24-fullpaperchairs@easychair.org](mailto:sigir24-fullpaperchairs@easychair.org).

callForPapers:
# APLAS 2025: Call for Papers

Welcome to the website of the **23rd Asian Symposium on Programming Languages and Systems (APLAS) 2025**.

APLAS 2025 will occur from **October 27 to 30, 2025**, in **Bengaluru, India**. This year’s conference is co-located with the 23rd edition of the International Symposium on Automated Technology for Verification and Analysis ([ATVA 2025](https://conf.researchr.org/home/atva-2025)). We are proud to announce **Prof. Dr. Peter Müller** as our plenary joint keynote for APLAS and ATVA 2025!

## Scope

We solicit submissions in the form of regular research papers describing original scientific research results, including system development and case studies. Among others, solicited topics include:

*   **Programming paradigms and styles:** functional, object-oriented, probabilistic, logic, constraint programming; extensible programming languages; programming languages for systems code; novel programming paradigms.
*   **Methods and tools to specify and reason about programs and languages:** programming techniques; meta-programming; domain-specific languages; proof assistants; type systems; dependent types; program logics, static and dynamic program analysis; language-based security; model checking; testing.
*   **Programming language foundations:** formal semantics; type theory; logical foundations; category theory; automata; effects; monads and comonads; recursion and corecursion; continuations and effect handlers; program verification; memory models; abstract interpretation.
*   **Methods and tools for implementation:** compilers; program transformations; rewriting systems; partial evaluation; virtual machines; refactoring; intermediate languages; run-time environments; garbage collection and memory management; tracing; profiling; build systems; program synthesis.
*   **Concurrency and distribution:** process algebras; concurrency theory; session types; parallel programming; service-oriented computing; distributed and mobile computing; actor-based languages; verification and testing of concurrent and distributed systems.
*   **Applications and emerging topics:** programming languages and PL methods in education, security, privacy, database systems, computational biology, signal processing, graphics, human-computer interaction, computer-aided design, artificial intelligence and machine learning; case studies in program analysis and verification.

## Submission Information

*   Submissions should not exceed **17 pages**, excluding bibliography, in the [Springer LNCS format](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines).
*   The accepted papers will be allowed one extra page to accommodate reviewers’ feedback.
*   Additional material intended for reviewers but not for publication in the final version (e.g., details of proofs) may be placed in a clearly marked appendix that is not included in the page limit. However, the paper must be understandable without the appendix. Reviewers are not obligated to review it.
*   Submitted papers must be unpublished and not submitted for publication elsewhere.
*   Papers must be written in English.
*   Accepted papers must be presented at the conference. For further details, please consult [Springer Nature Code of Conduct for Authors](https://www.springernature.com/gp/authors/book-authors-code-of-conduct).
*   Papers should be submitted via HotCRP: [https://aplas25.hotcrp.com/](https://aplas25.hotcrp.com/)

## Reviewing Process

APLAS uses a **light double-blind reviewing process**, with a rebuttal phase, to address factual errors and minor misunderstandings. Reviewers will not see author names until they submit a review. Therefore, the authors must adhere to the following rules:

*   Omit your names and institutions.
*   Refer to your prior work in the third person, just as you refer to prior work by others.
*   Omit the acknowledgments.

## Publication

*   The proceedings will be published as a volume in [Springer’s LNCS series](https://link.springer.com/conference/aplas).
*   Authors interested in making their contributions Open Access, please refer to [Springer’s webpage](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/open-access-publishing-in-computer-proceedings) for additional information, or contact the organizers.

## Best Paper Award

APLAS continues the tradition of the best paper award. The award will be announced on the website, and printed certificates will be issued to the authors at the conference.

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

*   **Submission Deadline:** Saturday, 7 June 2025
*   **Author Response Period:** Monday 7 - Wednesday 9 July 2025
*   **Acceptance Notification:** Friday 18 July 2025
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** Sunday 31 August 2025

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

ARITH 2025 welcomes submissions of conference papers describing recent scientific advances related to computer arithmetic. Papers under review elsewhere are not acceptable for submission to ARITH 2025. By submitting a paper, authors implicitly confirm that they are solely submitting it to ARITH 2025. Submissions must be in English.

## Submission System

Submissions must be made through the EasyChair website: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=arith2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=arith2025).

## Paper Types and Lengths

*   **Full papers:** Should not exceed **8 pages** (no extra pages) for submission. For review purposes, full papers may be submitted with up to 20 pages, using 12pt font size, single column, and double spacing.
*   **Short and industry papers:** Should not exceed **4 pages** (no extra pages) for submission. For review purposes, short/industry papers may be submitted with up to 10 pages, using 12pt font size, single column, and double spacing.

## Formatting

Papers must adhere to the IEEE Computer Society Conference format (two columns).

For formatting instructions, please refer to: [http://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html](http://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html)

## Review Process

The review process for ARITH 2025 is **double-blind**. Author names, affiliations, and grants must be **anonymized** in submitted papers, and self-references should be handled as third-party references. Papers not complying with this policy will be administratively rejected. While non-anonymous preprints or code repositories are not considered a violation of this policy, reviewers are discouraged from seeking them out. Authors should provide anonymized versions of any related artifacts where applicable.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract submission deadline**: December 13, 2024
*   **Paper submission deadline**: December 23, 2024
*   **Reviews completed and Authors notified**: February 14, 2025

## Topics of Interest

Topics of interest include, but are not restricted to:

*   Arithmetic foundations, systems and formats
    *   Theory of computer arithmetic such as integer, fixed/floating-point, interval, finite-field, etc.
    *   Novel arithmetic systems and application-specific number formats.
*   Implementation of arithmetic
    *   Novel architecture of arithmetic units on various technologies including traditional, FPGA, optical and quantum.
    *   High-performance, low-power and fault-tolerant designs and implementations
    *   Design tools and methodologies, including testing and formal verification
*   Algorithms and numerics
    *   Computer approximations of elementary and special functions
    *   Arithmetic algorithms and their analysis
    *   Design, compilation, optimization, validation, and verification of numerical software
*   Application-specific arithmetic
    *   Cryptography or security
    *   Artificial intelligence, machine learning and deep learning
    *   Signal processing, multimedia, and computer graphics

All topics that relate to intensive use of computer arithmetic are welcome as well.

## Students

ARITH is the premier conference for computer arithmetic. Students of all levels are urged to submit a paper and/or attend the conference if they are interested in this subject.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ArtsIT 2025

The 14th EAI International Conference on ArtsIT, Interactivity & Game Creation (ArtsIT 2025) is a **hybrid conference** taking place from **7-9 November, 2025**, at Heriot-Watt University Dubai, UAE. ArtsIT aims to explore the dynamic relationship between art and information technology, bringing together a diverse international community of researchers, practitioners, artists, and academics. The conference serves as a prominent scientific platform for sharing cutting-edge research at the convergence of art, science, culture, performing arts, media, and technology, focusing on how digital media influences our lives, culture, and society, and fostering discussions on sustainability, responsibility, and human dignity.

The conference aims to bridge the gap between research in art and technology, encouraging collaboration to cultivate innovation and stimulate imaginative thought.

*Event Update: This event is being relocated. More details coming soon.*

## Deadlines

All deadlines are at **11:59 PM UTC** unless otherwise specified.

### Main Track
*   Full Paper Submission deadline: **1 July 2025**
*   Notification deadline: **15 August 2025**
*   Camera-ready deadline: **30 September 2025**

### Late Track
*   Full Paper Submission deadline: **1 August 2025** (Submission open)
*   Notification deadline: **10 September 2025**
*   Camera-ready deadline: **10 October 2025**

### Special Tracks
*   Full Paper Submission deadline: **1 July 2025** (Submission open)
*   Notification deadline: **15 August 2025**
*   Camera-ready deadline: **30 September 2025**

### Poster Track
*   Full Paper Submission deadline: **31 August 2025** (Submission Open)
*   Notification deadline: **20 September 2025**
*   Camera-ready deadline: **10 October 2025**

## Topics of Interest

ArtsIT covers a wide range of topics at the intersection of art and technology. In addition to the main track, there are dedicated sessions on recent advancements such as virtualization, artificial intelligence and big data, virtual reality, and the metaverse. Specific areas include:

*   Digital artworks and cultural heritage
*   Audio art
*   Games and gamification
*   Immersive technologies and interactive art installations
*   Virtualization, artificial intelligence and big data
*   Virtual reality and the metaverse
*   Sustainability, responsibility, and human dignity in digital media

## Special Tracks

The conference features nine exclusive special tracks, offering focused discussions and in-depth presentations:

1.  **Accessible Digital Music**
2.  **Advancing Game Accessibility**
3.  **Art and Design in the AI Era: New Creative Practices, Data Curation, and Automation**
4.  **Broadcasting in the AI Age – Innovations in Broadcasting: Evolving Practices, Technologies, and Audiences**
5.  **Exploring the Intersection of Biofeedback and Art: Innovation, Expression, and Human-Computer Interaction**
6.  **Exploring Digital Innovation: Transforming Arts, Education, and Therapy with Musical Interfaces and Emerging Technologies**
7.  **Extended Reality (XR) Technologies for the Animation and Cinema Industry**
8.  **Interactive Design in Intangible Heritage: Exploring Interdisciplinary Perspectives**
9.  **Transcending Reality: Creating Immersive experiences to foster Mental Health and Wellbeing**

## Submission Types

The conference invites various contribution types:
*   **Full Papers:** For Main Track, Late Track, and Special Tracks.
*   **Posters:** For ongoing research projects, concrete realizations, or industrial applications.
*   **Demos:** Presentation of tools, implementations, or systems.
*   **Panel Proposals:** Discussions on controversial and challenging topics.
*   **Workshop Proposals:** Covering specific related topics.

## Publication

All registered papers will be submitted for publishing by **Springer – LNICST series** and made available through the **SpringerLink Digital Library**. Proceedings will be submitted for inclusion in leading indexing services such as Web of Science, Compendex, Scopus, DBLP, EU Digital Library, Google Scholar, etc.

Authors of selected papers are eligible to submit an extended version to **EAI Endorsed Transactions journals** (e.g., Creative Technologies, AI and Robotics, Internet of Things) with additional publication opportunities.

## Keynote Speakers

*   Michel van Dartel (Centre of Applied Research for Art, Design and Technology, Avans University of Applied Sciences, Netherlands)

## Venue

*   **Heriot-Watt University Dubai, UAE**
    *   Knowledge Park, Al Sufouh, Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

## Conference Highlights

*   Ranked in CORE and Ranked by Oxford.
*   Hybrid Conference with Onsite and Online Options.
*   Extensive Special Tracks covering niche and current research areas.
*   Opportunities for extended publications in indexed journals.
*   Inspiring keynote speakers and panel discussions.
*   Engaging social program, including a dinner cruise.

## Contact

For general inquiries, please contact: conferences@eai.eu

For registration and camera-ready submission inquiries, refer to the FAQ.

# 31st Asia and South Pacific Design Automation Conference (ASP-DAC 2026): Call for Papers

The 31st Asia and South Pacific Design Automation Conference (ASP-DAC 2026) will be held from **January 19-22, 2026**, at the **Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel**.

ASP-DAC is the premier conference in the Asia and South Pacific regions for Electronic Design Automation (EDA) in the VLSI and systems area. ASP-DAC 2026 offers an ideal opportunity to learn about recent technologies and future directions in LSI design and design automation through technical papers and tutorials.

The conference also features a Designers' Forum for presentations on the latest designs.

## Key Information

*   **Date:** Jan. 19-22, 2026
*   **Place:** Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel
*   **General Chair:** Tsung-Yi Ho (The Chinese University of Hong Kong)
*   **Technical Program Chair:** Takashi Sato (Kyoto University)
*   **Design Contest Chair:** Fengbin Tu (Hong Kong University of Science and Technology)

## Contact

callForPapers:
# ASSETS 2025: Call for Papers

The ASSETS conference is the premier forum for presenting research on the **design, evaluation, use, and education** related to computing for people with disabilities and older adults. We invite high-quality original submissions on topics relevant to computing and **accessibility**.

Submissions should present significant contributions to design, systems, tools, scientific understanding, methodology, or social issues. Relevant topics include (but are not limited to) new enabling technologies, studies of how technologies are used by people with disabilities, explorations of barriers to access, and evaluations of accessibility education methods. We recommend that papers with a technical contribution be validated through research activities with representative users when possible. However, we acknowledge that many accessibility-focused projects may begin with deep formative work with representative users, or may be based on prior research with representative users, and as such key contributions of a single paper may be primarily technical.

## Submission Categories and Deadlines

All accepted papers and abstracts will be archived in the ACM Digital Library. At least one author of accepted submissions must register as the presenter by the early registration deadline.

### Mentoring

*   **Request a mentor for your paper:**
    *   **Priority Deadline:** Thursday, February 20, 2025
    *   **Late Deadline:** Wednesday, March 12, 2025

### Technical Papers

*   [Technical Papers](technical_papers.html)

### Posters and Demonstrations

*   **Notification of Acceptance:** Wednesday, July 30, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** Wednesday, August 6, 2025
*   **Video Presentations Submission Deadline:** Wednesday, August 20, 2025

### Workshops

*   **Notification of acceptance:** Wednesday, July 9, 2025

*   **Camera-ready deadline:** Wednesday, July 16, 2025
*   **Acceptances to workshop attendees sent out:** Friday, August 15, 2025

### Experience Reports

*   **Notification of Acceptance:** Wednesday, July 9, 2025

### Doctoral Consortium

### Student Research Competition

*   **Final version deadline:** Wednesday, August 6, 2025
*   **Video presentation submission deadline:** Wednesday, August 20, 2025
*   [Student Research Competition](student_research_competition.html)

## Review Process

All Technical Papers and Posters and Demonstrations submissions are peer-reviewed by an international Program Committee.

## How to Submit

callForPapers:
# The 6th ACM/IEEE International Conference on Automation of Software Test (AST 2025) - Call for Papers

## Scope

Software pervasiveness in both industry and digital society, as well as the proliferation of Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies, are continuously leading to emerging needs from both software producers and consumers. Infrastructures, software components, and applications aim to hide their increasing complexity to appear more human-centric. However, the potential risk from design errors, poor integrations, and time-consuming engineering phases can result in unreliable solutions that can barely meet their intended objectives. In this context, Software Engineering processes and methods keep demanding the investigation of novel and further refined approaches to Software Quality Assurance (SQA).

Software testing automation is a discipline that has produced noteworthy research in the last decades. The search for solutions to automatically test any concept of software is critical, and it encompasses several areas: from the generation of test cases, test oracles, test stubs/mocks; through the definition of selection and prioritization criteria; up to the engineering of infrastructures governing the execution of testing sessions locally or remotely in the cloud.

The Automation of Software Test (AST) conference continues with a long record of international scientific forums on methods and solutions to automate software testing. In 2025, AST is in its 6th edition, having been formerly organized as workshops since 2006. The conference promotes high-quality research contributions on methods for software test automation and original case studies reporting practices in this field. We invite contributions that focus on:

i) lessons learned about experiments of automatic testing in practice;
ii) experiences of the adoption of testing tools, methods and techniques;
iii) best practices to follow in testing and their measurable consequences; and
iv) theoretical approaches that are applicable to the industry in the context of AST.

Our theme for this year is **“Adapting test automation to the AI era including sustainability and emerging challenges”** with special sessions on test automation for AI, sustainability, and AI testing education and training.

## Topics of Interest

Submissions on the AST 2025 theme are especially encouraged, but papers on other topics relevant to the automation of software tests are also welcome. Topics of interest include, but are not limited to the following:

*   AI for Automated Software Testing
*   Testing of AI-based systems
*   Effective testing through explainable AI
*   Education to software testing with the advent of AI-based technology
*   Automated software testing for sustainability, resource efficiency, energy consumption
*   Codeless and low code test automation
*   Test Automation in Software Process and Evolution, DevOps, Agile, CI/CD flows
*   Test-driven development
*   Model-based testing
*   Formal methods, model checking and theories for testing and test automation
*   Test case generation based on formal, semi-formal and AI models
*   Theoretical foundations and methods for test automation
*   Standardization of test languages, processes and tools
*   Security, performance, and robustness testing
*   Functional, interoperability, and conformance testing
*   Usability and user experience testing
*   Software simulation and automated software testing
*   Testing of embedded, reactive and object-oriented systems
*   Test automation of large complex systems
*   Testing cyber physical systems
*   Testing cloud and web systems and services
*   Product line testing
*   Testing anomaly detectors
*   Metrics for testing - test effectiveness, efficiency, test coverage
*   Testing tools
*   Testing in different industry domains including healthcare, energy, finance, etc.

## Important Dates (AoE - Anywhere On Earth)

*   **Submission deadline:** **9 November 2024**
*   **Notification of acceptance:** **12 January 2025 (UPDATED)**
*   **Final version deadline:** **31 January 2025**
*   **Conference Dates:** **28-29 April 2025**

## Organizers

*   **General Chair:** Andy Zaidman, Delft University of Technology, The Netherlands
*   **Program Co-Chairs:**
    *   Francesca Lonetti, ISTI-CNR, Italy
    *   Ina Schieferdecker, Technische Universität Berlin, Germany
    *   Rajesh Subramanyan, Stealth Startup & University of Washington, USA

## Submission Details

Three types of submissions are invited for both research and industry:

*   **Regular Papers:** (up to 10 pages plus 2 additional pages of references for references) - This includes Research Papers and Industrial Case Studies.
*   **Short Papers:** (up to 4 pages plus 1 additional page of references) - This includes Research Papers, Industrial Case Studies, and Doctoral Student Research.
*   **Industrial Abstracts:** (up to 2 pages for all materials).

The submission website is: [https://ast2025.hotcrp.com/](https://ast2025.hotcrp.com/)

### Formatting Requirements:

*   The page limit is strict (10 pages + 2 pages of references for full papers; 4 pages + 1 page of references for short papers; 2 pages for industrial abstracts). No additional pages will be allowed.
*   Submissions must strictly conform to the **IEEE conference proceedings template**. Please refer to the IEEE Conference Proceedings Formatting Guidelines: [https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html).
*   For LaTeX users, use `\documentclass[10pt,conference]{IEEEtran}` without including `compsoc` or `compsocconf` options.

### Review Process:

AST 2025 will follow a **double-blind review process**.

### Publication:

Accepted regular and short papers, case studies, and industrial abstracts will be published in the ICSE 2025 Co-located Event Proceedings and included in the IEEE and ACM Digital Libraries.

## Special Issue

Authors of the **best papers** presented at AST 2025 will be invited to submit an extension of their work for possible inclusion in a special issue in **Software Testing, Verification, and Reliability (STVR) journal**.

## Keynotes

*   **Keynote: Andreas Zeller**
    *   Title: Personalized Fuzzing
    *   When: Mon 28 Apr 2025 09:00 - 10:30
    *   Bio: Andreas Zeller is faculty at the CISPA Helmholtz Center for Information Security, and professor for Software Engineering at Saarland University. His research on automated debugging, mining software archives, specification mining, and security testing has been highly influential. Andreas is one of the few researchers to have received two ERC Advanced Grants, most recently for his S3 project. He is an ACM Fellow and holds an ACM SIGSOFT Outstanding Research Award.
*   **Keynote: Tiziana Margaria**
    *   Title: Learning-Based Testing: The Ease, the Impact, the Future
    *   When: Tue 29 Apr 2025 09:00 - 10:30
    *   Bio: Prof. Tiziana Margaria is Chair of Software Systems at the University of Limerick. She leads the digital manufacturing Platform within the Research Ireland funded I-Form Centre for advanced manufacturing and she is a co-director of the National Centre of Research Training in AI. She works on neurosymbolic approaches to create connected digital IT spaces (data, processes, machines, and their interoperability) and on explainable AI for case-by-case auditable high assurance systems. This combines various kinds of formal methods and deterministic reasoning with suitable AI and ML technologies.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 17th International Conference on Advanced Visual Interfaces (AVI 2024) was held in Arenzano (Genoa), Italy, from June 3rd to 7th, 2024. AVI has been a biennial appointment for a vast international community of experts since 1992, attracting leading researchers of Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) from all over the world. The conference provides a forum to present and disseminate new technological results, paradigms, and visions for HCI and user interfaces, with a primary focus on the conception, design, implementation, and evaluation of **novel visual interfaces**.

## Submission Types

AVI 2024 accepted the following types of contributions:

### Long and Short Research Papers

We solicit high-quality original research papers describing original, unpublished research in the area of advanced visual interfaces and Human-Computer Interaction in general. All submissions undergo peer-review by an international panel of experts.

*   **Long Papers:** Maximum **8 pages** (with one additional page for references).
*   **Short Papers:** Maximum **4 pages** (with one additional page for references).

### Poster Papers

The Poster Track allows researchers and practitioners to present their work in progress and obtain feedback from peers in an informal setting. Poster submissions must be up to **2 pages** (with one additional page for references) and are **not anonymized**.

### Demo Papers

The Demo Track showcases innovative implementations, systems, and technologies demonstrating new ideas about interactive visual interfaces. We seek implementations of novel and exciting concepts or systems related to AVI's main topics. Demo papers must be up to **2 pages** (with one additional page for references) and are **not anonymized**.

### Workshops & Tutorials

*   **Workshops:** Proposals are invited for half-day or one-day workshops that facilitate the exchange of new ideas in all areas related to advanced visual interfaces and HCI.
*   **Tutorials:** Proposals are encouraged for specific topics related to AVI and general HCI approaches, methodologies, or technologies.

### Doctoral Consortium

The Doctoral Consortium aims to provide a setting for PhD students to present their work, receive feedback on their doctoral research plan and progress, articulate their problem statement, goals, methods, and results, and gain guidance from established researchers and peers.

## Topics of Interest

The conference focuses on the conception, design, implementation, and evaluation of **novel visual interfaces**, broadly covering **Human-Computer Interaction (HCI)**.

## Important Dates (23:59, AoE)

*   **Workshop proposals:** Friday, **December 1, 2023**
*   **Abstract submission (Long and short papers):** Wednesday, **January 17, 2024**
*   **Paper submission (Long and short papers):** Wednesday, **January 24, 2024**
*   **Posters and Demo papers:** Friday, **March 8, 2024**
*   **Doctoral Consortium papers:** Friday, **March 15, 2024**
*   **Tutorial proposals:** Friday, **March 15, 2024**

## Submission Guidelines

### Formatting

*   All submissions must be formatted according to the **ACM SIGCONF template**.
*   Templates are available for LaTeX (including Overleaf) and Microsoft Word.
*   The required format is **double-column**.

### Anonymization

*   **Long and short research papers must be anonymized**. This involves removing information (such as authorship, acknowledgments, or specific application/software names) that could identify the authors.
*   Citations to authors' previous work should remain visible and be in the third person (e.g., "As described by [10]" and not "As described in our previous work [10]").

### Submission Portal

*   All papers must be submitted online via EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=avi2024](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=avi2024)

### Abstract Submission

*   Authors are required to submit a **250-word abstract** by the abstract deadline. This helps in speeding up the paper assignment to reviewers.

## Proceedings

Accepted full and short research papers, poster papers, demo papers, and workshop descriptions will be published in the Proceedings by **ACM Press** and made available in the **ACM Digital Library**.

## Registration Requirement

For each accepted paper, at least one author must **register for AVI 2024** by the author registration deadline and present the paper at the Conference.

The 38th International Conference on Computer Applications in Industry and Engineering (CAINE 2025) provides an international forum for the presentation and discussion of research on computer applications in industry and engineering.

## Registration

Registration details can be found at: [https://www.caine-conf.org/main/registration/](https://www.caine-conf.org/main/registration/)

## Awards

CAINE 2025 will feature a **Best Paper Award**.

# Call for Papers: 16th International Conference on Broadband Communications, Networks, and Systems (Broadnets)

The **16th International Conference on Broadband Communications, Networks, and Systems (Broadnets)** will take place from **August 14-16, 2025**, in **Sunyani, Ghana**.

## Important Dates

*   **Full Paper Submission deadline:** April 15th, 2025
*   **Notification deadline:** May 10th, 2025
*   **Camera-ready deadline:** June 14th, 2025

*Note: Deadlines for the Poster Track and Late Track appear to be historical (July 2024/August 2024) and may not apply to the main 2025 submissions.* For specific track deadlines, please refer to the conference website.

## Scope and Topics

The conference focuses on cutting-edge research and technological advancements in next-generation communication networks, artificial intelligence-driven security mechanisms, and intelligent systems. It aims to provide a platform for researchers, industry professionals, and policymakers to explore innovative solutions in **5G/6G networks**, **IoT-enabled smart systems**, **speech and signal processing**, **cybersecurity**, and **edge computing**.

Key areas of interest include:

*   Network architectures
*   Distributed computing
*   Digital twin technologies
*   Vehicular communication
*   Trust and privacy mechanisms
*   AI-driven anomaly detection
*   Speech and signal processing techniques (especially in secure communications, speech enhancement, and audio analytics for real-time applications)
*   Cloud-to-things systems
*   Fog computing
*   AI-driven access control

## Publication

All registered papers will be submitted for publishing by **Springer** and made available through the **SpringerLink Digital Library**.

Proceedings will be submitted for inclusion in leading indexing services, such as Web of Science, Compendex, Scopus, DBLP, EU Digital Library, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Inspec, and Zentralblatt MATH.

Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit an extended version to:

*   **Springer Wireless Networks (WINET) Journal** [IF: 2.1 (2023)]
*   **EAI Endorsed Transactions on Mobile Communications and Applications** (Scopus, Ei-indexed, ESCI-WoS, Compendex) - with an additional fee.

Additional publication opportunities include:

*   EAI Transactions series (Open Access)
*   EAI/Springer Innovations in Communications and Computing Book Series (indexed in Ei Compendex, Web of Science & Scopus)

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Paper Submission:** Authors are invited to submit their papers through the designated submission system.
*   **Author's kit – Instructions and Templates:** Detailed instructions and templates will be provided.
*   **Contribution Types:** The conference accepts various contribution types, including full papers, poster papers, and late-track papers.

For more details on submission formats and requirements, please refer to the conference's official Call for Papers page.

callForPapers:
# BMVC 2025: Call for Papers

The 36th British Machine Vision Conference (BMVC 2025) will be held from **24th - 27th November 2025** in **Sheffield, UK**.

BMVC is a leading international conference on machine vision, image processing, and pattern recognition, organized by the British Machine Vision Association (BMVA). It is a prestigious event in the computer vision calendar, featuring a single-track meeting with both oral and poster presentations.

## Topics of Interest

Submissions are invited for papers covering, but not limited to, the following areas:

*   3D from X
*   3D Shape modeling and processing
*   Action and event understanding
*   Adversarial attack and defense
*   Architecture and Space Design
*   Biometrics
*   Brave new ideas (not beating SOA but a new approach, theory, niche)
*   Computational Photography and Photogrammetry
*   Computer vision theory
*   Datasets and Evaluation
*   Deep learning architectures and techniques
*   Document analysis and understanding
*   Embodied vision: Active agents; simulation
*   Explainable AI
*   Fairness, privacy, ethics, social-good, transparency, accountability in vision
*   Generative models
*   Humans: Face, Gestures, Pose and Body Movement
*   Human-in-the-loop computer vision
*   Image Retrieval
*   Low-level and Physics-based Vision
*   Machine learning (other than deep learning)
*   Medical and Biological Image Analysis
*   Motion estimation and tracking
*   Multimodal learning
*   Recognition for X
*   Representation Learning
*   RGBD sensors and analytics
*   Scene Analysis and Understanding
*   Segmentation, grouping and shape analysis
*   Self-, semi-, meta-, unsupervised learning
*   Transfer, low-shot, continual, long-tail learning
*   Video analysis and Understanding
*   Vision and audio
*   Vision and graphics
*   Vision and language
*   Vision and robotics
*   Vision applications and systems
*   Visual reasoning and logical representation

Papers submitted under the “Brave new ideas” subject area are expected to move away from incremental benchmark gains. Proposed ideas should radically differ from the current research strand or propose a novel problem.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are at **23:59 GMT**:

1.  **Abstract Submission Deadline:** Tuesday, 13 May 2025
2.  **Full Paper Submission Deadline:** Friday, 16 May 2025
3.  **Supplementary Material Submission:** Friday, 16 May 2025
4.  **Author Notifications:** Friday, 25 July 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   Papers should not exceed **NINE pages** (references are excluded). Appendices should be submitted via the supplementary information.
*   Submissions are made via the OpenReview portal: [https://openreview.net/group?id=bmva.org/BMVC/2025/Conference](https://openreview.net/group?id=bmva.org/BMVC/2025/Conference)
*   Further information can be found in the [Author Guidelines](/authors/author-guidelines/) and [Submit your Paper](/authors/submit-your-paper/) pages.

## Review Process

*   Each paper will be reviewed by at least three reviewers.
*   An Area Chair will provide a meta-review, summarizing reviewers' points and recommending decisions.
*   **BMVC will not have a rebuttal period this year.**
*   Authors are asked to be prepared to review papers. Failure to engage with the reviewing process might be grounds for rejection.
*   More information about the reviewing process can be found at the [Reviewing policies](/authors/reviewing-guidelines/).

## Publication

Accepted papers will be included in the conference proceedings published and DOI-indexed by BMVA. Past proceedings are online at the [BMVA proceedings website](https://britishmachinevisionassociation.github.io/bmvc).

Top papers from BMVC 2025 will be invited to submit extended versions to a special issue of the **International Journal of Computer Vision (IJCV)**.

## Contact

For any queries, please contact the Programme Chairs at [programmechairs.bmvc2025@bmva.org](mailto:programmechairs.bmvc2025@bmva.org).

summary: The CAivDE – Computer Animation, Information Visualisation, and Digital Effects symposium is seeking original paper projects for presentation. The symposium aims to provide a forum for researchers, educators, and practitioners to share opinions, discuss key research issues, review current developments, and outline future directions in computer animation. It is part of the IV Conference 2025 and will be held from August 6-8, 2025, with both onsite and online participation options.
callForPapers:
# CAivDE – Computer Animation, Information Visualisation, and Digital Effects: Call for Papers

CAivDE is a symposium designed to provide a forum for researchers, educators, and practitioners in the field of Computer Animation to share their opinions. The symposium aims to identify presentations on key research issues, review current state-of-the-art developments, and outline future directions within computer animation, computer graphics, and visualisation.

## Submission Topics

This symposium seeks original paper projects that are either completed, or still in the production stage, dealing with, but not limited to, the following topics:

*   Motion Synthesis and motion capture
*   Physics-based animation
*   Vision techniques in animation
*   Modelling in animation
*   Rendering and lighting techniques
*   Animation of deformable materials and characters
*   Modelling and animation of heads, faces, and hair
*   Animation of natural phenomena
*   Real-time simulation used for visualisation
*   Simulations for virtual reality, training, and online education
*   Forensic animation and its applications
*   Animation for Scientific and medical visualisation

## Important Dates

*   **Paper submissions open / Registration online:** 30 September 2024
*   **Symposium submission deadline:** 01 February 2025
*   **Submission of Computer Animation deadline:** 20 June 2025
*   **Notification of Reviewing Result:** 15 June 2025 (Revised Date)
*   **Submission of camera-ready:** 25 June 2025 (Revised Date)
*   **Early registration closes:** 20 June 2025 (Revised Date)
*   **Submission of Video / Poster display version:** 30 June 2025
*   **Doctoral Research Workshop abstract submission deadline:** 30 June 2025
*   **Researchers Link research proposal submission deadline:** 30 June 2025
*   **Tutorial Registration Cancellation & Refund date:** 30 June 2025
*   **Registration closing dates (Pre-Registration date):** 20 July 2025
*   **Registration Close:** 20 July 2025

## Conference Details

*   **Conference Dates:** 06 – 08 August 2025
*   **Venue:** Nice, France
*   **Participation Options:** Hybrid (in-person & Online)

## Submission and Registration

*   **Submission & Registration:** [https://www.conftool.org/IV-cgiv-2025/](https://www.conftool.org/IV-cgiv-2025/)
*   **Registration Form:** [https://www.graphicslink.co.uk/IV2025/IV25_RegisterForm.pdf](https://www.graphicslink.co.uk/IV2025/IV25_RegisterForm.pdf)

## Publication

*   Published by IARIA Press (operated by Xpert Publishing Services)
*   Archived in the Open Access IARIA ThinkMind Digital Library
*   Prints available at Curran Associates, Inc.
*   Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit extended versions to a IARIA Journal.

## Contact Information

*   **General enquiries and submissions:** Conference Coordinator
*   **Symposium-Specific enquiries:**
    *   Prof. Mark W. McK. Bannatyne (mbannaty@iupui.edu)
    *   Prof. Jian J Zhang (jzhang@bournemouth.ac.uk)
*   **GraphicsLink Secretariat:**
    *   P.O. BOX 29, HATFIELD, AL9 7ZL, United Kingdom
    *   (Int. +44) 1707 - 652 224
    *   iV_CGiV@graphicslink.co.uk

summary: The IEEE-EMBS International Conference on Body Sensor Networks (BSN 2025) will be held in Los Angeles, California, USA, from November 3-5, 2025. The conference theme is “Computational Medicine: Expanding Health through Sensing and AI.” BSN 2025 is the premier conference on sensing systems for digital health, bringing together experts from academia, industry, and healthcare.
callForPapers:
# Call for Technical Papers

The IEEE-EMBS International Conference on Body Sensor Networks (BSN 2025) invites submissions for its annual conference, themed “Computational Medicine: Expanding Health through Sensing and AI.” The conference will be held in Los Angeles, California, USA, from November 3–5, 2025.

BSN 2025 is the premier conference on sensing systems for digital health, providing a cross-disciplinary, highly selective, single-track forum for cutting-edge research.

## Submission Types and Guidelines

*   **Regular Technical Papers:** 4-page limit (including references).
*   **Technical Abstracts:** 1-page limit (including references).
*   **Clinical Abstracts:** 1-page limit (including references).
*   **Demo Abstracts:** 1-page limit (including references).

All submissions are required to follow the **IEEE Conference template**. BSN adopts a **single-blind review process**, allowing authors to include their names and affiliations in the submission.

Excellent papers will be invited for extension and rapid review for publication in the **IEEE Open Journal of Engineering in Medicine and Biology**.

**Student Travel Awards** will be provided to selected students from worldwide institutions.

## Topics of Interest

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Novel digital health solutions (i.e., sensors and algorithms) for diagnosis, disease progress tracking, and self-management.
*   Sensors and systems for digital health, wellness, and athletics.
*   Conformable decoders: unintrusive, comfortable, self-powered sensors and systems.
*   Flexible, stretchable, and imperceptible electronics for sensors and systems.
*   Contact-less solutions for human sensing.
*   Power-optimization for implantable and wearable sensors and systems.
*   Wearable robotics system for digital healthcare.
*   Signal processing, machine learning, deep learning, and decision-support algorithms.
*   Adaptive, personalized intervention systems by closing the loop between technologies and humans.
*   Security, privacy, and trust in digital health technologies.
*   Optimization and personalization for digital health technologies and outcomes.
*   Human-centered design for digital healthcare to address real-world stakeholder needs.
*   Emerging topics such as Agentic AI and LLMs for computational health

## Important Dates

All deadlines are **11:59 pm AoE**:

1.  **Workshop Proposal Deadline:** June 15, 2025
2.  **Workshop Acceptance Notification:** June 29, 2025
3.  **Paper Submission Deadline:** July 11, 2025
4.  **Abstract, Clinical abstracts, and Demo Submission Deadline:** July 11, 2025
5.  **Paper Acceptance Notification:** August 1, 2025
6.  **Abstract Acceptance Notification:** August 1, 2025
7.  **Late Breaking Abstract Deadline:** August 10, 2025
8.  **Late Breaking Abstract Notification:** August 24, 2025
9.  **Camera-Ready Deadline:** September 1, 2025
10. **Conference Dates:** November 3-5, 2025

## Submission

Submit your 4-page technical paper here: [https://openreview.net/group?id=IEEE.org/EMBS/BSN/2025/Conference&referrer=%5BHomepage%5D(%2F)#tab-your-consoles](https://openreview.net/group?id=IEEE.org/EMBS/BSN/2025/Conference&referrer=%5BHomepage%5D(%2F)#tab-your-consoles)

## Awards

Awards will be presented for **Best Paper, Best Demo, and Best Clinical Abstract** recognizing excellent contributions.

## Workshops and Tutorials

Google will host a tutorial session on using their Foundation Models for Wearable Sensors and Time-Series Data. Details on associated workshops and other tutorials will be available on the workshop page.

callForPapers:
# Call For Papers

The IEEE International Symposium on Cluster, Cloud, and Internet Computing (CCGrid 2025) is a leading forum for disseminating and discussing research activities, resulting in a broad range of topics in distributed systems.

## Topics of Interest

Specific topics of interest include but are not limited to the following:

*   **Track 1: Hardware Systems and Networking:** hardware architecture, networking of data centers. Virtualized hardware, Open hardware architectures.
*   **Track 2: Software Systems and Platforms:** Programming models and runtime systems. Resource management and scheduling. Service-oriented architectures. IaaS, PaaS, SaaS. Monitoring and evaluation tools, analysis of system/application performance.
*   **Track 3: Machine Learning (ML) for Systems and Systems for ML:** abstraction, architecture, design and implementation supporting machine learning and artificial intelligence applications. Use of ML/AI applications to enhance the performance of cluster, cloud and Internet-computing systems. ML/AI techniques for workload prediction. Application scheduling, resource placement, resilience in cluster, cloud and Internet-computing systems.
*   **Track 4: Future Compute Continuum and Seamless Ecosystems:** Internet computing frontiers. Future Internet. Osmotic computing. Post- and Non-Von Neumann computing. Quantum computing.
*   **Track 5: Sustainable IT Systems:** abstraction, architecture, design and implementation. Ultra-low power systems architectures. Optimization and analysis in green computing. Environment-friendly computing ecosystems. Power, cooling and thermal awareness. Green edge, IoT, Cloud, datacenter and supercomputers.
*   **Track 6: Applications and Workflows:** Data science. Machine learning and artificial intelligence applications. Cyber-physical systems. e-Health. Internet of Things (IoT)-enabled smart systems and applications.

## Paper Submission

*   Authors are invited to submit papers electronically, following the links on the website.
*   All manuscripts will be peer-reviewed and will be evaluated on correctness, originality, technical strength, significance, quality of presentation, and relevance to the conference topics.
*   Submissions need to be **double-blinded**. Authors should not reveal their identity in their submissions. References to past work need to be in a third-person form.
*   Submitted manuscripts should not exceed **10 letter size pages** (8.5 x 11, IEEE format for conference proceedings), including figures, tables and references.
*   Original unpublished research that is not currently under review for any other conference or journal is expected. Papers determined to be under active review elsewhere will be rejected without review.
*   Submissions received after the due date, exceeding the length limit will not be considered.
*   Authors may purchase up to two additional pages beyond the original 10 pages (excluding references) for accepted papers.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are Anywhere on Earth (AoE, UTC-12 timezone).

*   Workshop proposal open: **August 1, 2024**
*   Workshop proposal due: **September 2, 2024**
*   Workshop proposal acceptance: **October 1, 2024**
*   Deadline paper abstract: **December 9, 2024**
*   Deadline paper: **December 23, 2024**
*   Author notification: **February 17, 2025**
*   Camera ready: **March 14, 2025**
*   Conference date: **May 19 to May 22, 2025**

## Publication

The proceedings will be published through the IEEE Press and will be made available online through the IEEE Digital Library.

## Contact

Contact email: [ccgrid2025@uit.no](mailto:ccgrid2025@uit.no)

callForPapers:
# CIAA 2025: Call for Papers

The 29th International Conference on Implementation and Application of Automata (CIAA) will take place from **September 22-25, 2025**, in **Palermo, Italy**.

The purpose of CIAA is to bring together members of the academic, research, and industrial community who have an interest in the theory, implementation, and application of automata and related structures. The conference concerns research on all aspects of implementation and application of automata and related structures, including theoretical aspects.

## Topics

We solicit papers on all aspects of implementation and application of automata and related structures, including theoretical aspects, including but not limited to:

*   Algorithms on automata
*   Automata and logic
*   Bioinformatics
*   Complexity of automata operations
*   Compilers
*   Computer-aided verification
*   Concurrency
*   Data structure design for automata
*   Data and image compression
*   Design and architecture of automata software
*   Digital libraries
*   DNA, molecular, and membrane computing
*   Document engineering
*   Editors, environments
*   Experimental studies and practical experiences
*   Industrial applications
*   Natural language processing
*   Networking
*   New algorithms for manipulating automata
*   Object-oriented modeling
*   Pattern-matching
*   Quantum computing
*   Speech and speaker recognition
*   Structured and semi-structured documents
*   Symbolic manipulation environments for automata
*   Teaching
*   Text processing
*   Techniques for graphical display of automata
*   VLSI
*   Viruses, related phenomena
*   World-wide-web

## Submission Guidelines

Submissions must be written in LaTeX using the LNCS LaTeX2e style and must not exceed **12 single-spaced pages**, excluding the title page and the references.

If the authors believe that more details are essential to substantiate the main claims, they may include a clearly marked appendix that will be read at the discretion of the program committee.

Simultaneous submissions of papers to journals or any other conference with published proceedings or submitting previously published papers is not allowed.

Only electronic submission of PDF documents is possible.

Authors should submit their contributions through Easychair.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission deadline:** May 16th (AoE)
*   **Notification deadline:** June 23rd
*   **Final version deadline:** June 30th
*   **Last day for early registration:** July 18th
*   **Last day for late registration:** September 8th
*   **Conference Dates:** September 22nd-25th, 2025

> Deadlines differ for special tracks. Please consult the conference home page for special tracks Call for Papers (if any).

## Publication

CIAA 2025 proceedings will be published in the **Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)**.

## Special Issue

Extended versions of selected papers from the conference will be invited for consideration in a special issue of **International Journal of Foundations of Computer Science (IJFCS)**.

## Invited Speakers

*   Marie-Pierre Béal, Université Paris-Est Marne-la-Vallée, France
*   Dirk Nowotka, University of Kiel, Germany
*   Alberto Policriti, University of Udine, Italy

## Contacts

All questions should be addressed to [ciaa2025@unipa.it](mailto:ciaa2025@unipa.it).
