callForPapers:
# CIAC 2025: Call for Papers

The 14th International Symposium on Algorithms and Complexity (CIAC 2025) is scheduled to take place from **June 10 to June 12, 2025**, at **LUISS University, Rome, Italy**.

## Aims and Scope

The conference is intended to provide a forum for researchers working in all aspects of computational complexity and the use, design, analysis, and experimentation of efficient algorithms and data structures.

## Topics

Authors are invited to submit papers presenting original and unpublished research on algorithms and complexity. Typical areas include:

*   Algorithm design and analysis
*   Sequential, parallel, and distributed algorithms
*   Data structures
*   Computational and structural complexity
*   Lower bounds and limitations of algorithms
*   Randomized and approximation algorithms
*   Parameterized algorithms and parameterized complexity classes
*   Smoothed analysis of algorithms
*   Alternatives to the worst-case analysis of algorithms (e.g., algorithms with predictions)
*   On-line computation and competitive analysis
*   Streaming algorithms
*   Quantum algorithms and complexity
*   Algorithms in algebra, geometry, number theory and combinatorics
*   Computational geometry
*   Algorithmic game theory and mechanism design
*   Algorithmic economics (including auctions and contests)
*   Computational learning theory
*   Computational biology and bioinformatics
*   Algorithmic issues in communication networks
*   Algorithms for discrete optimization (including convex optimization)
*   Algorithm engineering

## Important Dates

*   **Deadline for submissions:** November 15, 2024 (AoE) – extended November 22, 2024
*   **Author notification:** January 31, 2025
*   **Camera-ready due:** February 14, 2025
*   **Author Registration:** April 03, 2025
*   **Early Registration:** May 03, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   Authors are invited to submit an extended abstract or full paper with at most **15 pages**, excluding the title page and the references. The title page consists of the title of the paper and the abstract. The first section of the paper should start on the next page.
*   The usage of the **LNCS style file is mandatory**. LNCS templates are available at: [https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines). No changes to font size, page geometry, etc. are permitted.
*   Submissions should be anonymized according to the double-blind review policy.
*   Late submissions and submissions not in the correct format will not be considered.
*   The paper should contain a succinct statement of the issues and their motivation, a summary of the results, a brief explanation of their significance, and a comparison to related work, accessible to non-specialists. Proofs omitted due to space constraints must be put into an appendix, to be read by the PC members at their discretion.
*   Simultaneous submission to other conferences with published proceedings or to journals is not allowed.
*   At least one author of each accepted paper will have to register for the conference. For authors who cannot present their paper in person for a significant reason, the possibility of remote presentation may be offered.

## Submission Site

Submissions will be through EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ciac2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ciac2025)

## Double-Blind Reviewing

CIAC 2025 will implement a lightweight double-blind reviewing process. Submissions should not reveal the identity of the authors in any way; in particular, authors’ names, affiliations, and email addresses should not appear at the beginning or in the body of the submission. Authors should feel free to disseminate their ideas or draft versions of their paper as they normally would (e.g., making early drafts available on their webpage, or through pre-print dissemination websites such as arXiv). When submitting a paper, please indicate Conflict of Interest (CoI) with PC members.

## PC Submissions

Submissions authored or co-authored by (non-chair) members of the program committee are allowed.

## Proceedings

Accepted papers will be published in the proceedings of the symposium as a volume in Springer LNCS.

## Best Paper Award

Two selected papers will receive the Best Paper Award, sponsored by Springer.

## Contact Information

All questions about submissions should be emailed to Loukas Georgiadis at [loukas@uoi.gr](mailto:loukas@uoi.gr).

callForPapers:
# CIDR 2025: Call for Papers

The Conference on Innovative Data Systems Research (CIDR) is a systems-oriented conference, complementary to mainstream database conferences, emphasizing the systems architecture perspective. CIDR 2025 will be held in **Amsterdam, The Netherlands, from January 19-22, 2025**.

## Overview

CIDR gathers researchers and practitioners from academia and industry to discuss innovative and visionary ideas in data management systems. It encourages contributions on novel approaches to data management systems, architecture, and usage, including cloud-based systems, data storage, networking, hardware acceleration, custom processors, memory hierarchies, processor interconnects, and ML/AI technologies for data processing. CIDR values innovation, experience-based insight, and vision.

## Contribution Types

CIDR 2025 invites two kinds of contributions:

*   **Papers:** (at most 6 pages) Including regular research papers and more visionary papers that promote interesting ideas and ongoing work.
*   **Demos:** (at most 6 pages) This can be a video or a description of the demo.

To encourage authors to submit only their best work, each person can be an author or co-author of **at most one submission** of any kind.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Format:** Papers should be submitted in PDF format.
*   **Length:** Papers must not exceed 6 pages, including all references and appendix.
*   **Template:** Submissions must be formatted using the double-column ACM sigconf style. LaTeX and Word templates are available.
*   **Submission Portal:** Submit electronically via CMT: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/CIDR2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/CIDR2025)
*   **Presentation:** At least one author of an accepted paper or demo is expected to attend the conference in person to present.

## Important Dates

(All deadlines are 11:59pm Pacific Time)

*   **Submission deadline:** August 2nd, 2024
*   **Author notification:** October 4th, 2024
*   **Conference Dates:** January 19-22, 2025

## Camera-Ready Guidelines

*   Follow the formatting instructions above.
*   Include the following copyright notice at the bottom left of the first page:
    > This paper is published under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC-BY 4.0) license. Authors reserve their rights to disseminate the work on their personal and corporate Web sites with the appropriate attribution, provided that you attribute the original work to the authors and CIDR 2025. 15th Annual Conference on Innovative Data Systems Research (CIDR '25). January 19-22, 2025, Amsterdam, The Netherlands.
*   Recommended LaTeX style file and Word template files include the copyright notice.

## Diversity and Inclusion

Authors are strongly urged to follow the D&I writing instructions when drafting paper submissions.

# CODES+ISSS: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Hardware/Software Codesign and System Synthesis (CODES+ISSS) is the premier event in system-level design, hardware/software co-design, modeling, analysis, and implementation of modern Embedded Systems, Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS), and Internet-of-Things (IoT), from system-level specification and optimization to system synthesis of multi-processor hardware/software implementations. The conference is a forum bringing together academic research and industrial practice for all aspects related to system-level and hardware/software co-design.

## Calls for Contribution

*   [Call for Papers](http://esweek.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/ESWeek2025_CFP.pdf)
*   [Call for Contributions](href="")
*   [Call for Special Sessions](https://esweek.org/call-for-special-session-proposals/)
*   [Call for Tutorials](https://esweek.org/call-for-tutorial-proposals-page/)
*   [Call for Workshops](https://esweek.org/call-for-workshop-proposals/)
*   [Call for LB (Late Breaking/Work-in-Progress Papers)](http://esweek.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/ESWeek2023_CFP_LBWIP.pdf)
*   [Call for Artifacts (for EMSOFT)](https://esweek.org/call-for-artifacts/)

## Submission Tracks

*   **Journal Track:** For full research papers.
*   **Late Breaking Tracks:** For work-in-progress and other shorter contributions.
*   **Special Session Proposals:** Proposals for dedicated sessions on specific topics.
*   **Tutorial Proposals:** Proposals for educational tutorials.
*   **Workshops Proposals:** Proposals for co-located workshops.

## Important Dates

*   **March 23, 2025 (AOE):** Journal Track: Abstract Submission
*   **March 30, 2025 (AOE, firm):** Journal Track: Full Paper Submission, Special Session Proposals, Tutorial Proposals, Workshops Proposals
*   **May 18, 2025:** Journal track: First Round Notification
*   **June 01, 2025 (AOE, firm):** Late Breaking Tracks: Paper Submission
*   **June 15, 2025 (AOE, firm):** Journal track: Revised paper submission
*   **July 13, 2025:** Journal Track, Late Breaking Track: Notification
*   **August 11, 2025:** All tracks (full paper, LB, Special Session): Camera ready
*   **TBD:** Submission deadline for the Embedded System Software Competition (ESSC) and the ACM SIGBED Student Research Competition.

## Program Chairs

*   **Prabhat Mishra** (University of Florida, FL, US) - CODES+ISSS TPC Chair
*   **Paul Bogdan** (University of Southern California, CA, US) - CODES+ISSS TPC Co-Chair

## Submission

*   [Submit an Article to CODES+ISSS 2025](https://codesisss25.hotcrp.com/)
*   [Author Information](https://esweek.org/author-information/)

## About CODES+ISSS

CODES+ISSS is a conference within ESWEEK, focusing on the intersection of hardware and software for system synthesis and design, covering embedded systems, CPS, and IoT.

## ESWEEK 2025

ESWEEK 2025 will take place as an in-person event from September 28th to October 3rd, 2025, in Taipei, Taiwan.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: CISIS 2025

The **18th International Conference on Computational Intelligence in Security for Information Systems (CISIS 2025)** aims to provide a platform for academic and industry researchers from the fields of Computational Intelligence, Information Security, Cybersecurity, and Data Mining.

The conference will take place in **Salamanca, Spain**, from **October 16-17, 2025**. CISIS 2025 is part of a larger congress including the International Joint Conferences HAIS 2025, SOCO 2025, and ICEUTE 2025.

## About CISIS

CISIS aims to offer a meeting opportunity for academic and industry-related researchers belonging to the various, vast communities of Computational Intelligence, Information Security, Cybersecurity, and Data Mining. The need for intelligent, flexible behaviour by large, complex systems, especially in mission-critical domains, is intended to be the catalyst and the aggregation stimulus for the overall event.

## Topics

For a detailed list of topics, please visit the [Topics page](http://cisisconference.eu/topics/).

## Special Issues

Accepted papers (from the general track and special sessions) will be considered for possible inclusion in a special issue of **Neurocomputing (ELSEVIER)**.

## Special Sessions

Proposals for special sessions are open until **15th March 2025**. Organizers are responsible for:

*   Selecting a topic of interest to delegates.
*   Obtaining a minimum of 5 papers (at least 60% from authors not involved in the session as chairs, team members, or reviewers).
*   Managing the review process within deadlines and providing suitable reviewers.
*   Ensuring final versions of papers are uploaded before the deadline.
*   Attending the conference and chairing the session.
*   Disseminating the call for papers for the special session.

To submit a special session proposal, please send an e-mail to hector.quintian@udc.es including:

*   Title of the special session and selected conference (SOCO’25, CISIS’25, and ICEUTE’25)
*   Name of chair/co-chairs, email/s and affiliation/s
*   A description of the session content (one or two paragraphs).
*   A list of at least 10 international reviewers (including chairs) from at least three different universities (name, family name, email, affiliation).
*   Description of the plan to disseminate the special session (CFPs, etc).

## Important Dates

*   **Special Sessions proposal deadline:** 15th March 2025
*   **Paper submission deadline:** 1st June 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** 15th June 2025
*   **Submission of revised papers:** 30th June 2025
*   **Final version submission:** 5th July 2025
*   **Payment deadline:** 10th July 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** 16th – 17th October 2025

## Paper Submission & Publication

*   **Proceedings:** SOCO’25, CISIS’25, and ICEUTE’25 proceedings will be published by **Springer in Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems (LNNS)**. They will be indexed by SCOPUS, INSPEC, WTI Frankfurt eG, zbMATH, SCImago.
*   **Paper Length:** Papers must be prepared according to the LNNS style template and must be no more than **ten (10) pages long**, including figures and bibliography. Additional pages (over 10 pages) will be charged **150 euros** for each page.
*   **Submission System:** All submissions must be made through the EasyChair system: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cisis2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cisis2025)
*   **Presentation Requirement:** All accepted papers must be presented by one of the authors who must register for the conference and pay the fee.

## Committees

### General Chair
*   Dr. Emilio Corchado (University of Salamanca, Spain)

### Co-Chairs
*   Dr. Alicia Troncoso Lora (Pablo de Olavide University, Spain)
*   Dr. Hilde Pérez García (University of León, Spain)
*   Dr. Esteban Jove (University of A Coruña, Spain)
*   Dr. José Luis Calvo Rolle (University of A Coruña, Spain)
*   Dr. Francisco Javier Martínez de Pisón (University of La Rioja, Spain)
*   Dr. Pablo García Bringas (University of Deusto, Spain)
*   Dr. Francisco Martínez Álvarez (Pablo de Olavide University, Spain)
*   Dr. Alvaro Herrero Cosio (University of Burgos, Spain)
*   Dr. Paolo Fosci (University of Bergamo, Italy)
*   Dr. Héctor Quintián (University of A Coruña, Spain)

## Sponsors

*   Startup OLÉ
*   BISITE

## Contact

For conference-related issues or doubts, please contact: [hector.quintian@udc.es](mailto:hector.quintian@udc.es)

callForPapers:
# Computability in Europe 2025 (CiE 2025): Call for Papers

Computability in Europe (CiE) is an interdisciplinary series of international conferences organized by the Association Computability in Europe (ACiE). CiE brings together both basic and application-oriented research in computability-related areas of science.

The **CiE 2025** conference will be held in **Lisbon, Portugal, from July 14 to July 18, 2025**.

## Topics of Interest

The conference welcomes research contributions on computability-related fields of science, including:

*   Mathematics
*   Theoretical Computer Science
*   Logic
*   Quantum Computability
*   Cryptography
*   Information Theory
*   Computational Biology
*   Computational Linguistics
*   History and Philosophy of Computability
*   And many other related subjects.

## Deadlines and Important Dates

*   **Abstract Submission:** January 26, 2025 (AOE)
*   **Full Paper Submission:** February 2, 2025 (AOE)
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** April 6, 2025
*   **Final Versions Due:** April 13, 2025
*   **Informal Presentations Submission:** April 22, 2025
*   **Early Registration:** Before May 6, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** July 14-18, 2025

## Participant Support

*   **Women in Computability:** As part of the program, support is offered for junior women researchers to join CiE 2025. See the details [here](https://sites.google.com/view/cie2025-computabilityineurope/registration).
*   **Student Travel Support:** The Association for Symbolic Logic will support the travels of some students. More information can be found [here](/view/cie2025-computabilityineurope/registration).

## Submission Information

Information regarding the submission process can be found on the [conference home page](/view/cie2025-computabilityineurope/home).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - CoDIT 2025

The 11th International Conference on Control, Decision and Information Technologies (CoDIT 2025) will be held in a **hybrid format**, allowing both virtual and in-person participation, from **July 15-18, 2025**, at **Split, Croatia**.

## Welcome

CoDIT 2025 serves as a forum for technical exchange among scientists interested in Control, Automation, Robotics, Optimization, Decision, Cybernetics, Computer Science, and Information Technologies. It offers an exceptional platform for both academic and industrial communities to tackle new challenges, share solutions, and explore future research directions.

## Call for Contributed Papers

All papers must be written in English and should describe original work.

All registered and presented papers (Regular and Short-WiP) will be submitted for inclusion into **IEEE Xplore** as well as other Abstracting and Indexing (A&I) databases.

### Regular Papers

*   The length of the paper is limited to a maximum of **6 pages** (in the standard IEEE conference double-column format).
*   Registered and presented regular papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore as well as other Abstracting and Indexing (A&I) databases.
*   Papers will be refereed through a **blind process** for technical merit and content.
*   To be eligible for publication in the Conference proceedings, an accepted paper must be presented at the Conference by one of the authors.
*   You can send your work as a regular paper or send it to one of the accepted special sessions.
*   Papers should be submitted before **April 30, 2025**.

### Short Papers (Work-in-Progress / WiP)

*   The length of WiP paper is limited to a maximum of **4 pages**.
*   At most **8 references** can be included.
*   WiP (short papers) contributors are expected to give a **short presentation** of their work (10 mn).

## Templates for Authors

The submitted papers should follow the usual IEEE paper format for conferences (two-columns, 10 point, Times New Roman).

Templates are available for:

*   [LaTeX](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/learn/creating-a-latex-document) (Example, actual link would be provided by conference)
*   [MS Word](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/learn/creating-a-latex-document) (Example, actual link would be provided by conference)

## Call for Special Sessions

*   The goal of special sessions (5-6 papers) and special tracks (at least two sessions) is to provide focused discussions on new topics or innovative applications.
*   Each prospective session/track organizer must submit a proposal, including the title of the session, a short description, and the organizer's name.
*   Proposals should be submitted before **January 17, 2025**.
*   To submit your proposal, please fill in the form inside the following MS Word file, convert it as PDF, and upload the generated PDF to the PaperCept Conference Management System at: [https://controls.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl](https://controls.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl) (click on the CoDIT 2024 link “Submit a special session to CoDIT 2025” and follow the steps).

## Key Dates

*   **Submission site opening:** November 07, 2024
*   **Special session Proposal:** January 17, 2025
*   **Papers submission deadline:** April 30, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** April 27, 2025 (for papers submitted by April 7) / May 10, 2025 (for papers submitted after April 7).
*   **Final version due:** May 27, 2025
*   **Registration deadline:** May 27, 2025

## Publications & Special Issues

Along with the publication of the proceedings in IEEE Xplore, the best-presented papers at CoDIT 2025 will have the opportunity to be extended and published in prestigious special issues:

*   International Journal of Dynamics and Control (Impact Factor: 2.2)
*   Transactions of the Institute of Measurement and Control (Impact Factor: 1.7)
*   Computational Optimization and Applications (Impact Factor: 1.6)

## Registration

Registration for CoDIT 2025 should be made online by CREDIT CARD at: [Registration Link](https://controls-registration.paperhost.net/codit25/)

# HCOMP 2024: Call for Papers

The Twelfth AAAI Conference on Human Computation and Crowdsourcing (HCOMP 2024) will be held **October 16–19, 2024**, in **Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania**. The conference theme is **''Responsible Crowd Work for Better AI.''**

HCOMP is the premier venue for disseminating the latest research findings on human computation and crowdsourcing, promoting interdisciplinary research across AI, HCI, economics, social computing, digital humanities, policy, and ethics.

HCOMP 2024 is colocated with ACM UIST 2024 (October 13-16, 2024).

## Announcements

*   Registration is now open!
*   The HCOMP Test of Time and Award will be announced and given out this year. For more information, check the [technical program](/program.html).

## Quick Links

*   View the [keynote speakers](/keynotes.html).
*   View the list of [accepted papers](/papers.html).
*   View the list of [workshops](/workshops.html).
*   View the [Works-in-Progress](/papers.html#wip).

## Important Dates

All times are midnight AoE:

*   **Abstracts due:** June 5, 2024
*   **Full papers due:** June 12, 2024
*   **Notifications:** July 31, 2024
*   **HCOMP 2024 Conference Dates:** Oct 16–19, 2024

## Stay CONNECTED: HCOMP COMMUNITY

*   **Join crowd-hcomp Google Group:** [crowd-hcomp Google Group](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/crowd-hcomp) (mailing list) to post and receive crowdsourcing and human computation email announcements. To subscribe, send an email to [crowd-hcomp+subscribe@googlegroups.com](crowd-hcomp+subscribe@googlegroups.com).
*   View the [Google Group webpage](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/crowd-hcomp) to view the archive of past communications.
*   Keep track of our twitter hashtag: [#HCOMP2024](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23hcomp2024).
*   Join the [HCOMP Slack Community](https://hcomp.slack.com/) to connect with researchers, industry players, practitioners, and crowd workers.

callForPapers:
# HPCC 2025: Call for Papers

The **27th IEEE International Conference on High Performance Computing and Communications (HPCC-2025)** will be held from **13-15 August 2025** in **Exeter, England, UK**.

IEEE HPCC-2025 is sponsored by **IEEE**, **IEEE Computer Society**, and **IEEE Technical Committee on Scalable Computing (TCSC)**.

## Introduction

With the rapid growth in computing and communications technology, the past decade has witnessed a proliferation of powerful parallel and distributed systems and an ever increasing demand for practice of high performance computing and communications (HPCC). HPCC has moved into the mainstream of computing and has become a key technology in determining future research and development activities in many academic and industrial branches, especially when the solution of large and complex problems must cope with very tight timing schedules.

Among a series of highly successful International Conferences on High Performance Computing and Communications (HPCC), the HPCC-2025 conference is the 27th edition of a forum for engineers and scientists in academia, industry, and government to address the resulting profound challenges and to present and discuss their new ideas, research results, applications and experience on all aspects of high performance computing and communications.

Prospective authors are invited to submit their papers to HPCC-2025. Accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore subject to meeting IEEE Xplore’s scope and quality requirements. The authors of selected best papers will be invited post conference to extend their contributions for special issues of prestigious journals to be planned in conjunction with the conference.

## Scope and Topics

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

### Track 1: High Performance Computing and Applications

*   High Performance Computing Theory
*   High Performance Computing Architectures
*   System Software and Middleware
*   System Software Support for Scientific Workflows
*   Storage and I/O Systems
*   Resource Management
*   Instruction-Level and Thread-Level Parallelism
*   Performance Modeling and Evaluation
*   Massively Multicore Systems
*   Future Novel Computing Platforms
*   Database Applications and Data Mining
*   High Performance Computing for Bioinformatics
*   High Performance Computing for Big Data
*   High Performance Computing for AI
*   High Performance Computing for Block Chains
*   Green High Performance Computing

### Track 2: Parallel and Distributed Computing and Systems

*   Parallel and Distributed System Architectures
*   Parallel and Distributed Algorithms
*   Data Center Architectures
*   Resource Virtualization
*   Web Services and Internet Computing
*   Cloud Computing
*   Grid and Cluster Computing
*   Federated Learning
*   Embedded Systems
*   Distributed Systems and Applications
*   Pervasive/Ubiquitous Computing & Intelligence
*   Distributed Graphics and VR/AR/MR Systems
*   Distributed AI and Soft/Natural Computing
*   Power-Efficient and Green Computing Systems
*   Parallel and Distributed Computing for Big Data
*   Parallel and Distributed Computing for AI

### Track 3: Communications and Networking

*   Network and Interconnect Architectures
*   Computer Networks
*   Internet Architectures and Protocols
*   Telecommunications
*   Trust, Security, and Privacy
*   Energy-Aware Computing and Networking
*   5G Network
*   Software Defined Networking
*   Network Functions Virtualization
*   Machine Learning and Deep Learning
*   Social Networking and Computing
*   Performance Evaluation and Measurement

### Track 4: Computing Power Network(CPN) and Network for AI Computing

*   Computing and network convergence technology for AI application
*   Resource allocation and collaboration in CPN
*   Computing power identification and measurement technology
*   Lossless network design
*   Technology for RDMA
*   IPv6/SRv6-based hyperscale AI Datacenter

## Important Dates

*   **Workshop Proposal:** **1 March 2025**
*   **Submission Deadline:** **18 May 2025** (Firm Deadline - extended from 30 April 2025)
*   **Authors Notification:** **15 June 2025**
*   **Final Manuscript Due:** **15 July 2025**
*   **Registration Due:** **15 July 2025**

## Sponsors

*   IEEE
*   IEEE Computer Society
*   IEEE Technical Committee on Scalable Computing (TCSC)

The workshop aims to bring together researchers and practitioners to present and discuss new ideas in systems research and how technological advances and new applications are shaping computational infrastructure. callForPapers:
# Call for Papers and Discussions

The 20th Workshop on Hot Topics in Operating Systems (HotOS XX) solicits **position papers** proposing new directions of systems research, advocating innovative approaches to long-standing problems, or reporting on deep insights gained from experience with real-world systems. The program committee will explicitly favor papers likely to stimulate reflection and discussion. Early-stage work where authors can benefit from community feedback is highly encouraged.

HotOS takes a broad view of systems research, encompassing operating systems, storage, distributed systems, mobile and embedded systems, virtualization, programming languages, networking, security, dependability, and manageability. It also welcomes contributions influenced by fields such as hardware design, machine learning, verification, economics, social organization, and nontraditional computing systems.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Research and Position Papers:**
    *   Length: No longer than **5 pages** including figures and tables, plus as many pages as needed for references.
    *   Formatting: Adhere to ACM's formatting conventions using the `acmart` style (`\documentclass[sigconf,10pt]{acmart}`). This includes 10-point font, two columns, 8.5x11-inch paper, 10-point Times Roman or Libertine font on 12-point leading, 0.75-inch margins, and a 0.33-inch gutter.
    *   Anonymity: Submissions must be **double blind**. Authors must make a good faith effort to anonymize their submissions, avoiding explicit or implicit self-identification in references or acknowledgments. Pages should be numbered. Figures and tables must be legible in black and white.
    *   Rejection: Submissions not meeting these criteria will be rejected without review; no deadline extensions will be granted for reformatting.
    *   ORCID ID: Authors must obtain an ORCID ID for the publishing process.

*   **Panel and Event Proposals:**
    *   Length: 1-page proposal (using the same format as papers) plus pages for references and supporting letters.
    *   Anonymity: Unlike papers, panel and event proposals need **not be anonymous** (i.e., they may be single blind).
    *   Evaluation: Proposals will be evaluated based on topic relevance and potential to engage the audience. Topics such as industry perspectives on systems research, diversity and inclusion, under-appreciated open source technologies, and hardware trends are encouraged.

## Key Dates

*   **Paper or Panel Proposal Submission Deadline:** **January 15, 2025** (AoE)
*   **Author Notifications:** April 1, 2025
*   **Camera-ready Deadline:** April 15, 2025
*   **Workshop Dates:** May 14–16, 2025

## Submission Method

Submissions must be in PDF format via the web submission form: [https://hotos25.hotcrp.com/](https://hotos25.hotcrp.com/). Select your submission type (paper or proposal) on the form.

## Attendance and Registration

HotOS will be an **in-person workshop**. At least one author of each accepted paper is expected to present and participate. Alternatives may be considered in extreme cases (e.g., visa issues) upon contacting the chairs.

Registration will be limited to encourage deeper discussion. At least two authors per accepted paper will receive invitations to attend if desired. A separate invitation request process will be announced for non-authors, including students and industry practitioners.

## Policy

*   **Simultaneous submission, previously published work, or plagiarism** constitutes dishonesty and is prohibited. Prior or concurrent publication in non-peer-reviewed contexts (like arXiv) is permitted, but the submission must use an anonymized project name.
*   Authors are subject to all ACM Publications Policies, including those on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects.

callForPapers:
# Call For Papers

The 31st IEEE International Symposium on High-Performance Computer Architecture (HPCA) will be held in **Las Vegas, NV** from **March 1st to March 5th, 2025**.

HPCA is a high-impact premier venue for presenting research results on a wide range of computer architecture topics.

## Topics of Interest

*   Processor, memory, and storage systems architecture
*   Instruction-, thread-, and data-level parallelism
*   Interconnection networks and network interface architecture
*   Domain-specific architectures and Accelerators
*   FPGA, CGRA, and Reconfigurable systems
*   Near/In-Memory computing
*   Cloud, Datacenters, cluster/distributed systems
*   Approximate computing
*   Compilers/Languages/Runtimes for novel architectures
*   IoT, Mobile, Edge, and Embedded architectures
*   Effects of circuits or technology on architecture (3D/chiplets/interposer/wafer-scale)
*   Architecture modeling and simulation methodologies
*   Neuromorphic computing
*   Quantum, Superconducting and Emerging technologies impacting computer architectures
*   Reliability/Fault Tolerance, Energy Efficiency and Sustainability of Computer Systems
*   Security/Privacy
*   Evaluation and measurement of real computing systems

## Industry Track

HPCA 2025 features a separate Industry Track with a separate call for papers. The goal of the HPCA Industry Track is to publish papers that are written by industry authors and their content relates to industrial products/processes.

## Important Dates

### Research Papers

*   **Abstract Deadline:** **July 26, 2024**
*   **Paper Submission:** **August 2, 2024**
*   **Revision/Rebuttal Period:** October 4, 2024 - October 16, 2024
*   **Notification:** November 5, 2024

### Industry Track

*   **Abstract Deadline:** **September 9, 2024**
*   **Paper Submission:** **September 16, 2024**
*   **Revision/Rebuttal Period:** November 8, 2024 - November 15, 2024
*   **Notification:** November 26, 2024

### General

*   **Final Papers Due:** January 17, 2025
*   **Conference Date:** March 1, 2025 - March 5, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

### Paper Registration and Abstract Submission

*   Please make the paper title as close to the final version as possible.
*   The author list should not change (order of authors can) after registration. If there is a change, you should send an email indicating the change at least 48 hours before the paper submission deadline to the PC chair.
*   Consequently the Conflict List should also be finalized by the abstract registration. Please ensure it is accurate at the time of registration.
*   Please make the abstract as close to the final version as possible.

*Flagrant violation of the above could result in an outright rejection of the submission*

### Paper Format

*   Papers must be submitted in printable **PDF format**.
*   Text must be in a minimum **10pt font**.
*   Papers must be at most **11 pages**, not including references.
*   Line spacing (leading) must be no less than **12pt**.
*   No page limit for references.
*   References must include all authors (i.e., do not use et al.).

### Templates and Submission Site

*   Download LaTeX Template: [hpca2025-latex-template.zip](https://hpca-conf.org/2025/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/hpca2025-latex-template.zip)
*   Sample Paper: [HPCA_2025_template.pdf](https://hpca-conf.org/2025/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/HPCA_2025_template-2.pdf)
*   Paper Registration/Submission Site: [Upload Abstracts and Papers to HotCRP](http://hpca2025.hotcrp.com/)

## Paper Evaluation Objectives

The committee will make every effort to judge each submitted paper on its own merits. There will be no target acceptance rate. We expect to accept a wide range of papers with appropriate expectations for evaluation – while papers that build on significant past work with strong evaluations are valuable, papers that open new areas with less rigorous evaluation are equally welcome and especially encouraged. We also acknowledge the wide range of evaluation methodologies in HPCA including modeling, simulation, prototyping, experimental implementation, real product evaluation, etc.

## Paper Formatting Details

*   **Page Limit:** 11 pages, not including references.
*   **Paper Size:** US Letter: 8.5in x 11in
*   **Margins:** Top/Bottom: 0.7in / 1in, Left/Right: 0.7in
*   **Body:** 2-column, single spaced
*   **Space Between Columns:** 0.1in
*   **Line Spacing (Leading):** 12pt
*   **Body Font:** 10pt, Times
*   **Abstract Font:** 9pt, Times, Bold
*   **Section Heading Font:** 12pt, Small caps, Roman numbering (I, II, …)
*   **Subsection Heading Font:** 10pt, Italic, Alpha numbering (A, B, …)
*   **Caption Font:** 9pt (minimum)
*   **References:** 8pt, no page limit, list all authors’ names

## Reviewing Process

Reviewing will be **double blind**. Authors must not include any author names on submitted documents except in the space provided on the submission form. Ensure that the metadata included in the PDF does not give away the authors. Refer to prior work in the third person and include a full citation for the work in the bibliography.

## Authorship Guidelines

IEEE guidelines dictate that authorship should be based on a substantial intellectual contribution. All authors must have met specific conditions related to intellectual contribution, drafting/revising the article, and approving the final version.

## Conflicts of Interest

Authors must register all their conflicts on the paper submission site. Conflicts include advisor-advisee relationships, family members, collaborations within the last 4 years, people from the same institution within the last 4 years, funding relationships, and members of the same research center where unpublished work is regularly discussed. 

*Scenarios that do NOT constitute a conflict include: authors of previously-published, closely related work; service collaborations; co-authoring community-wide tools; people working on similar topics; and people under the same umbrella funding award without close collaboration.*

## ArXiv Submissions

Authors may submit their work to HPCA 2025 even if it appears on Arxiv. However, authors are encouraged to reduce the possibility of their name being disclosed to avoid issues with the double-blind review process.

## Concurrent Submissions

Manuscripts must not have been previously published or accepted for publication in a substantially similar form, nor be under review for any other conference or journal during the HPCA 2025 review period, with specific exceptions for workshops without archived proceedings or venues like arXiv.

## Further Information

For questions regarding topic fit, please contact the program chair at [hpca2025@psu.edu](mailto:hpca2025@psu.edu).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ACM SIGGRAPH Symposium on Interactive 3D Graphics and Games (I3DG) 2025

The **ACM SIGGRAPH Symposium on Interactive 3D Graphics and Games (I3DG) 2025** is the leading conference for real-time 3D computer graphics and human interaction. It brings together researchers, engineers, and industry professionals to discuss their latest work. This year marks I3D's 39th year since its inaugural workshop and 29th conference.

**Conference Dates:** May 7-9, 2025
**Location:** NJIT, Jersey City, NJ, USA

## Paper Submissions

We invite you to submit papers about real-time 3D graphics, interaction, and games. All accepted papers will be published in **PACMCGIT Issue I3D 2025** and presented at I3D 2025. Submissions from industry and outside of academia are welcome.

### Topics of Interest

*   Real-time rendering
*   Real-time ray tracing and path tracing
*   Physics-based animation
*   Virtual and augmented reality
*   Deep learning for graphics and simulation
*   Collision detection
*   Real-time computer vision
*   Navigation in virtual environments
*   Texture synthesis
*   Real-time post-processing effects
*   Interactive 3D modeling
*   In-the-wild 3D reconstruction
*   Level-of-detail approaches
*   Pre-computed lighting for real-time applications
*   Visibility computation
*   Real-time surface shading
*   Fast shadows, caustics and reflections
*   Impostors and image-based techniques
*   Motion synthesis and path planning
*   Character and crowd animation and simulation techniques
*   Interaction devices and techniques
*   User studies of interactive techniques
*   Sketch-based 3D modeling and design
*   Video game techniques
*   Content generation techniques for real-time applications

### Submission Information

*   **Format:** Papers should be in ACM conference format using the **ACM small trim journal size (“acmsmall”)**. Videos are required for techniques involving motion or animation.
*   **Length:** At most **sixteen (16) pages** of content, including appendices but excluding references. Shorter submissions are welcome. Optional supplemental material does not count towards this limit.
*   **Anonymity:** Papers must be submitted anonymously.
*   **Review Process:** Papers will be evaluated by **double-blind peer review**. There is no rebuttal process. The review process is two-round.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=i3d2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=i3d2025)
*   **Presentation:** Accepted papers will have a 15-20 minute talk.
*   **Registration:** At least one author from each accepted paper must register for the conference.
*   **Policies:** Authors are subject to ACM Publications Policies, including the policy on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects. ORCID IDs are required for publication.

## Poster Submissions

*   **Submission Link:** [Poster Submissions](cfp-posters.html)
*   **Poster Notifications:** **March 27, 2025**
*   **Poster Camera-ready deadline:** **April 9, 2025**

## Important Dates

All deadlines are **23:59 Pacific Time (UTC -7)**.

*   **Paper submission deadline:** **January 10, 2025**
*   **Paper notifications:** **February 24, 2025**
*   **Revision deadline:** **March 14, 2025**
*   **PACMCGIT camera-ready deadline:** **April 4, 2025**
*   **Poster notifications:** **March 27, 2025**
*   **Poster camera-ready deadline:** **April 9, 2025**
*   **Extended Poster submission deadline:** **March 21, 2025**
*   **Early registration deadline:** **April 18, 2025**
*   **Conference Dates:** **May 7-9, 2025**

## Contact Information

*   **General inquiries, registration, sponsorship:** `general@i3dsymposium.org`
*   **Paper submissions:** `papers@i3dsymposium.org`
*   **Poster submissions:** `posters@i3dsymposium.org`

## Publication

Accepted papers will be published in **PACMCGIT Issue I3D 2025**.

## Sponsors

More information about corporate sponsors can be found [here](https://research.activision.com).

*   Platinum Sponsors
*   Gold Sponsors
*   Silver Sponsor (NVIDIA)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: 25th International Conference on Innovations for Community Services (I4CS)

## Motto and Theme

"**Celebrating I4CS' Quarter-Century**" is the motto of the I4CS 2025 conference. We aim to explore the transformative impact of technology on the essence and well-being of our communities.

## Topics of Interest

The conference addresses internet community systems, foundations, technology, applications, and socializations. Topics include, but are not limited to:

### Technology: Emerging Architectures and Frameworks

*   Data architectures and enablers for community services
*   Cryptography and cryptology
*   5G/6G technologies and ad-hoc wireless networks
*   Data models, analytics, and big data management
*   Quantum and cloud computing

### Applications: Smart Communities on the Move

*   Social networks, open data, and distributed coworking
*   Barrier-free collaboration, publishing, and eLearning
*   Recommender solutions and chat bots
*   Virtual & augmented reality, robotics, and mobile e-sports
*   Intelligent traffic, logistics, and connected cars

### Socialization: Ambient Work and Living

*   Distributed work challenges and eHealth-assisted living
*   Machine Learning, human-centered AI, and governance
*   Smart home, energy control, and public infrastructure
*   Internet of things and dynamic sensor networks
*   Cyber- and information security

## Submission and Publication

I4CS solicits submissions of unpublished papers presenting research results, industrial experiences and applications, as well as detailed specifications of open problems.

*   **Electronic submission is required.**
*   **Format:** Full papers should be submitted as PDF files.
*   **Length:** No more than **20 pages**.
*   **Language:** Written in American English.
*   **Submission System:** [EasyChair conference management system](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=i4cs2025)
*   **Review Process:** Single-blind review by at least three members of the program committee. Anonymizing submissions is not necessary.

## Proceedings and Indexing

I4CS Proceedings will be published with **Springer in Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS) series**. Papers will be submitted to indexing libraries, e.g., **DBLP, Scopus**, and for consideration by the **Web of Science (WoS) conference proceedings citation index**.

*   **Formatting Instructions:** Refer to [Springer's Conference Proceedings Guidelines](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines).

## Important Dates

*   **Paper submission (extended):** February 23, 2025
*   **Authors' notification:** March 23, 2025
*   **Camera-ready copies:** March 30, 2025
*   **Presenters' registration:** March 30, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** June 11 - 13, 2025

## Hosted by

*   LMU Munich, Germany

## Supported by

*   Ernst-Abbe-Hochschule Jena, University of Applied Sciences
*   Deutsche Telekom AG, Group Technology

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IADIS International Conference Applied Computing (IADIS AC) 2025

The IADIS International Conference Applied Computing (IADIS AC) 2025 aims to address the main issues of concern within the applied computing area and related fields, covering essentially technical aspects. Innovative contributions that don’t fit into the defined areas will also be considered.

## Areas of Interest

All areas related to Applied Computing are of interest, including:

### Application Fields

*   eCommerce and ePayment
*   eLearning
*   eHealth and eSports
*   IT services
*   Mobile computing
*   Knowledge management and distribution

### Fundamental Concepts and Engineering

*   Algorithms
*   Data bases and data mining
*   Information Systems
*   Information sourcing and aggregation
*   Programming languages and concepts
*   Security and Privacy

### Usability

*   Automation of Services
*   Human-centred Computing
*   Multimedia and Visualization
*   Modalities of User Interfacing
*   Personalization and empathic systems
*   Virtual Reality

### Performance

*   Distributed and parallel systems
*   Cloud Computing
*   Evaluation and Assessment
*   Intelligent systems
*   Large-scale applications
*   Local and distributed storage

### Communication

*   IoT
*   Industry 4.0
*   Mobile Systems and Networks
*   Protocols, Standards and Mark-up Languages
*   Sensor Networks
*   WWW Applications and Technologies

### Hardware scope

*   Embedded Computing
*   Environment-friendly Constructions
*   Mobile Aspects
*   Realization of IoT nodes
*   Security concepts and devices
*   Wideband Information streaming

## Contribution Types

*   **Full Papers:** Max 8 pages (5,000 words), for accomplished research results.
*   **Short Papers:** Max 4 pages (2,500 words), for work in progress or fresh developments.
*   **Reflection Papers:** Max 2 pages (1500 words), for literature reviews, trend analysis, or discussion of issues.
*   **Posters / Demonstrations:** Max 1 page (625 words), with the poster or demonstration to be exposed.
*   **Tutorials:** Proposal of max 250 words.
*   **Panels:** Proposal of max 250 words.
*   **Invited Talks:** Abstract included in proceedings.
*   **Doctoral Consortium:** Max 2,500 words (4 pages), for PhD students.
*   **Corporate Showcases & Exhibitions:** For company presentations and displays.

## Review Process

This is a **blind peer-reviewed conference**.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline (2nd CFP):** 25 July 2025
*   **Notification to Authors (2nd CFP):** 1 September 2025
*   **Final Camera-Ready Submission and Early Registration (1st CFP):** Until 18 July 2025
*   **Late Registration (1st CFP):** After 18 July 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** 1 – 3 November 2025

## Submission

Submit your paper here: [https://conf-system.org/confman_ac2025/author_new.asp](https://conf-system.org/confman_ac2025/author_new.asp)

## Publication and Indexing

*   Proceedings will be published in the form of a book and digital copy with ISBN.
*   Conference proceedings will be submitted (pending approval) to indexing services, including Crossref, and each published paper will be allocated a DOI.
*   Extended versions of the best papers will be selected for publication in the IADIS Journal on Computer Science and Information Systems (ISSN: 1646-3692), indexed by Emerging Sources Citation Index by Thomson Reuters.

## Contact

*   Email: [secretariat@computing-conf.org](mailto:secretariat@computing-conf.org)

callForPapers:
# ICAISC 2025: Call for Papers

The 24th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Soft Computing (ICAISC 2025) will be held in **Zakopane, Poland**, from **June 22-26, 2025**, at the **Bachleda Kasprowy Zakopane Hotel**.

The conference will be held in a **hybrid mode**: online and on-site. Authors of accepted papers will have the choice to present their papers online or on-site.

All accepted papers, irrespective of the presentation mode, will be included in the **LNAI conference proceedings** published by Springer.

## About ICAISC 2025

The conference provides an excellent opportunity for scientists and engineers to present and discuss the latest scientific results and methods. It will include keynote addresses, contributed papers, and numerous lectures and tutorials.

## Scope

Contributions covering all theoretical developments and practical applications in artificial intelligence and soft computing techniques are invited. Key technical areas include, but are not limited to:

*   AI and adversarial attacks
*   Agent-based systems
*   Ant colony optimization
*   Approximate reasoning
*   Artificial immune systems
*   Artificial Intelligence in modelling and simulation
*   Artificial Intelligence in scheduling and optimization
*   Artificial life
*   Bioinformatics and computational biology
*   Brain-machine interfaces
*   Cognitive systems and applications
*   Collective intelligence
*   Computer vision
*   Data mining
*   Differential Evolution
*   Evolutionary data mining
*   Evolutionary design
*   Evolutionary scheduling
*   Expert systems
*   Explainable AI
*   Fuzzy Computing with Words
*   Fuzzy control and intelligent systems
*   Fuzzy decision making and decision support systems
*   Fuzzy logic and fuzzy set theory
*   Fuzzy optimization and design
*   Fuzzy pattern recognition
*   Fuzzy systems for robotics
*   Game theory
*   Generative artificial intelligence
*   Hardware Implementations
*   Intelligent database systems
*   Knowledge engineering
*   Large language models
*   Machine learning
*   Modeling and identification
*   Molecular and quantum computing
*   Multi-agent systems
*   Natural language processing
*   Neural Network Theory and Architectures
*   Particle swarm optimization
*   Robotics and related fields
*   Robust and secure machine learning algorithms
*   Rough sets and rough data analysis
*   Speech understanding
*   Supervised and Unsupervised Learning
*   Type-2 fuzzy logic
*   Various Applications
*   Web intelligence
*   Human–computer interaction

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Language:** English.
*   **Originality:** Only original, unpublished papers are invited.
*   **Submission Format:** Electronic version of papers via the conference web page.
*   **Paper Structure:** Common scientific structure (abstract, state of the art, intention, methodology, results, references).
*   **Anonymity:** Prepare **anonymized versions** of the paper for submission. Avoid information that may identify authors in acknowledgements, links, or references. Refer to your previous work as if it were by someone else. Use "Anonymous ICAISC 2025 submission" in place of author names.
*   **Review Process:** Papers will undergo **double-blind reviewing** by an international committee.
*   **Acceptance Criteria:** Based on scientific merit and relevance to conference topics.
*   **Final Submission:** Accepted papers must be submitted in **Latex format only**. Authors will be allowed to make corrections based on reviewer suggestions.
*   **Copyright Form:** A completed and signed Consent-to-Publish form is required from the corresponding author. The form is available on the Springer website.
*   **Attendance:** Accepted papers **must be presented** by the author(s) personally to be published.
*   **Submission System:** [https://icaiscsystem.icaisc.eu/](https://icaiscsystem.icaisc.eu/)
*   **Springer Guidelines:** Authors should consult Springer’s [authors’ guidelines](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines) and use their proceedings templates (LaTeX or MS Word). LaTeX templates are also available in Overleaf.
*   **Paper Length:** Initial submissions should preferably be **12 pages**.

## Contribution Types

*   **Regular papers:** Preferably 12 pages, presented on-site as posters (max A0 size) or remotely via Zoom (10 min presentation + 3-5 min Q&A).

## Important Dates

*   **Submission of papers:** The deadline for submission has now passed.
*   **Notification of acceptance:** From **February 1, 2025**.
*   **Submission of camera-ready papers:** **April 10, 2025**.
*   **Conference date:** **June 22-26, 2025**.

## Day of Business & Science

On **Tuesday, June 24**, a special full-day event will bring together science, business, government, and innovation through AI. It will feature keynote speeches, discussions on science-industry cooperation, government actions in AI, and startup/investment panels.

## Previous Conferences & Proceedings

Proceedings of ICAISC 2024 (LNCS 15164, 15165, 15166) are available online. Conference participants receive free access to ICAISC 2024 proceedings via [https://icaiscsystem.icaisc.eu/](https://icaiscsystem.icaisc.eu/).

## Warning

Be aware of fake conferences organized by WASET (World Academy of Science, Engineering, and Technology) which may lack academic rigor and credibility.

callForPapers:
# IEEE International Conference on Blockchain and Cryptocurrency (ICBC) 2025: Call for Papers

The **IEEE International Conference on Blockchain and Cryptocurrency (ICBC) 2025** will be held from **June 2nd to 6th, 2025**, in **Pisa, Italy**. Sponsored by the IEEE Communications Society, ICBC 2025 is the 7th edition of this conference.

ICBC 2025 is seeking submissions for technical papers (both full and short), posters, tutorial proposals, workshop proposals, and demos in areas related to Blockchain and Cryptocurrencies.

## Review Process

ICBC 2025 employs a **DOUBLE-BLIND review process** with a **REBUTTAL period**.

## Topics of Interest

Areas related to Blockchain and Cryptocurrencies, including but not limited to:

*   Distributed Consensus & Fault Tolerance Algorithms
*   Blockchain Platforms & Offchain Technologies
*   Distributed Database Technologies for Blockchain
*   Storage Solutions and Data Availability Verification
*   Blockchain Interoperability & Cross-chain Mechanisms
*   Performance, Scalability & Sustainability Issues
*   Transaction and Network Monitoring, Measurement, and Analysis
*   Simulation Tools
*   Blockchain-based Applications & Services
*   Decentralised App Development
*   Smart Contracts and Verification
*   Security, Privacy, Forensics
*   Token Economy
*   Regulations & Policies in Cryptocurrencies
*   Novel Mechanisms for the Creation, Custody, and Exchange of Crypto Assets
*   Anonymity and Criminal Activities of Cryptocurrency
*   Managing the Risks of Cryptocurrency
*   Distributed Trust
*   Decentralised Internet Infrastructure
*   Decentralised Financial Services
*   Blockchain for Internet of Things/Cyber Physical Services
*   Blockchain and Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence
*   Blockchain for Metaverse & Digital Twins

## Submission Instructions

*   **Ethical Considerations**: For papers involving human participants, personal data, or security/privacy attacks, ethical considerations must be discussed, and institutional ethical approval must be in place before submission.
*   **Originality**: Authors are invited to submit original papers, written in English, that have not been published or submitted for publication elsewhere.
*   **Formatting**: Technical papers must be formatted using the **IEEE 2-column format**. Templates are available on IEEE Manuscript Templates for Conference Proceedings.
    *   **Full Papers**: Not exceeding 8 pages (excluding references).
    *   **Short Papers**: Not exceeding 4 pages (excluding references).
    *   **Poster Papers**: Not exceeding 2 pages (excluding references).
    *   **Systemisation of Knowledge (SoK) papers**: Not exceeding 16 pages (excluding references).
*   **Submission Portal**: All papers must be submitted through EDAS via the URL: [https://edas.info/N32838](https://edas.info/N32838).
*   **File Type**: Only **PDF files** will be accepted for the review process.
*   **Anonymisation**: The paper should be anonymised, removing all identifying information (explicit self-citations, acknowledgments, and funding sources).
*   **AI Content Generation Guidelines**: [https://icbc2025.ieee-icbc.org/ai-content-generation-guidelines](https://icbc2025.ieee-icbc.org/ai-content-generation-guidelines)

## Important Dates

*   **Paper/Poster Submission Deadline:** **10 January 2025** (AoE, firm)
*   **Reviews Released to Authors:** **21 February 2025**
*   **Rebuttals Due:** **28 February 2025** (AoE)
*   **Acceptance Notification:** **12 March 2025**
*   **Camera Ready:** **21 April 2025**
*   **Demo Submission Deadline:** **5 April 2025**
*   **Demo Acceptance Notification:** **15 April 2025**
*   **Tutorial Submission Deadline:** **28 February 2025**
*   **Tutorial Acceptance Notification:** **7 March 2025**
*   **Workshop Submission Deadline:** **16 March 2025** (AoE)
*   **Workshop Acceptance Notification:** **14 April 2025**

## Registration

*   Author registration deadline: **21st April 2025**.
*   For registration fees and policy, please refer to the conference website.

## Student Travel Grants

A limited number of student travel grants are available. The application deadline is **April 25th, 2025**.

## Invited Extended Versions

Authors of the best accepted papers will be invited to submit extended versions of their papers to a fast-tracked special issue of a prestigious journal.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

[Download the call for papers](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2019/08/ICASSP2026_CfP.pdf)

The 51th IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech, and Signal Processing (ICASSP) will be held in Barcelona, Spain, from May 4 to 8, 2026, at the Centre de Convencions Internacional de Barcelona (CCIB). The flagship conference of the IEEE Signal Processing Society will offer a comprehensive technical program presenting the latest developments in signal processing research and applications. Featuring world-class oral and poster sessions, keynotes, exhibitions, demonstrations, tutorials, and short courses, the conference will attract leading researchers and global industry figures, providing great networking opportunities. Exceptional papers and contributors will be selected and recognized at ICASSP 2026.

## Important Dates

*   **Special Session Proposals:** July 9, 2025
*   **Grand Challenge Proposals:** July 9, 2025
*   **Workshop Proposals:** July 9, 2025
*   **Paper Submissions (regular papers and OJSP):** **September 17, 2025**
*   **Tutorial and Short Course Proposals:** October 22, 2025
*   **Author Response Deadline:** December 24, 2025
*   **Published Journal Presentation Request:** January 9, 2026
*   **Paper Acceptance:** January 16, 2026
*   **Camera Ready Paper Deadline:** February 13, 2026
*   **Author Registration:** February 13, 2026
*   **Open Preview Starts:** April 7, 2026

## Technical Program Chairs

*   Christian Jutten
*   Markus Rupp
*   Tülay Adali

## Technical Committee Members

*   Applied Signal Processing Systems: Brian Telfer (Chair)
*   Audio & Acoustic Signal Processing: Minje Kim (Chair)
*   Bio Imaging and Signal Processing: Mathews Jacob (Chair)
*   Computational Imaging: Justin Haldar (Chair)
*   Image, Video, and Multidimensional Signal Processing: Xiao-Ping (Steven) Zhang (Chair)
*   Information Forensics and Security: Anderson Rocha (Chair)
*   Machine Learning for Signal Processing: Danilo Comminiello (Chair)
*   Multimedia Signal Processing: Giuseppe Valenzise (Chair)
*   Sensor Array and Multichannel: Elias Aboutanios (Chair)
*   Signal Processing for Communications and Networking: Urbashi Mitra (Chair)
*   Signal Processing Theory and Methods: Xavier Mestre (Chair)
*   Speech and Language Processing: Shinji Watanabe (Chair)

## Technical Scope

We invite submissions of original, unpublished technical papers on topics including but not limited to:

*   Applied Signal Processing Systems
*   Audio & Acoustic Signal Processing
*   Biomedical Imaging & Signal Processing
*   Compressive Sensing, Sparse Modeling
*   Computational Imaging
*   Computer Vision
*   Green Signal Processing
*   Image, Video & Multidimensional Signal Processing
*   Information Forensics, Security & Privacy
*   Internet of Things
*   Machine Learning and Generative AI
*   Multimedia Signal Processing
*   Neuromorphic Computing
*   Quantum Signal Processing
*   Remote Sensing & Signal Processing
*   Sensor Array & Multichannel SP
*   Signal Processing Theory & Methods
*   Speech & Language Processing
*   Signal Processing for Big Data
*   Signal Processing for Communications
*   Signal Processing Education
*   Signal Processing for Manufacturing
*   Signal Processing for Memory and Storage
*   Signal Processing for Robotics
*   Signal Processing over Graphs
*   Signal Processing in Emerging Technologies

## Submission Types and Publication

*   **Regular Papers:** Accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings and available in the IEEE Xplore Digital Library.
*   **OJSP Papers:** Submissions of 8+1 pages. Accepted papers will be published in the IEEE Open Journal of Signal Processing (OJSP) and presented at the conference, but will not be included in the conference proceedings. Authors planning to submit an OJSP paper are kindly requested to fill in [this form](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/event/paper-submissions-icassp-and-icassp-ojsp/).
*   **Published Journal Paper Presentations:** Authors of papers published or accepted in IEEE SPS and Eurasip journals may present their work at ICASSP 2026. These papers will not be re-reviewed or included in the proceedings.

Open Preview: Conference proceedings will be available in IEEEXplore, free of charge, to everyone, 30 days prior to the conference start date until its end.

## Other Calls

*   [Call for Special Sessions](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/call-for-special-sessions/)
*   [Call for Satellite Workshops](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/call-for-satellite-workshops/)
*   [Call for Tutorials](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/call-for-tutorials/)
*   [Call for Show & Tell Demos](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/call-for-show-tell-demos/)
*   [Call for Short Courses](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/call-for-short-courses/)
*   [Call for SP Grand Challenge Proposals](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/call-for-sp-grand-challenge-proposals/)

## Contact

For inquiries related to this call for papers, please email: [techprogramchairs@2026.ieeeicassp.org](mailto:techprogramchairs@2026.ieeeicassp.org).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ICCE 2025

The 33rd International Conference on Computers in Education (ICCE 2025) will be hosted by the Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IITM) in Chennai, India, from **December 1-5, 2025**. ICCE 2025 is planned as an **in-person event only**.

We encourage submissions that contribute to the field of computers in education, fostering collaboration and innovation.

## Conference Details

*   **Conference Name:** 33rd International Conference on Computers in Education (ICCE 2025)
*   **Dates:** December 1-5, 2025
*   **Location:** Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai, India
*   **Format:** In-person event only

## Topics of Interest / Tracks

ICCE 2025 invites submissions covering various aspects of computers in education, including but not limited to the following tracks:

*   **C1: AIED/ITS:** Artificial Intelligence in Education / Intelligent Tutoring Systems
*   **C2: CSCL:** Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning
*   **C3: ALT:** Adaptive Learning Technologies
*   **C4: TEML:** Technology-Enhanced Mobile Learning
*   **C5: EGG:** Educational Games and Gamification
*   **C6: TELL:** Technology-Enhanced Language Learning
*   **C7: PTP:** Teacher Professional Development

## Other Submission Categories and Events

*   SATULEC (Showcase of Advancements in Technology-Enhanced Learning in Underrepresented Countries)
*   Extended Summary
*   Workshops
*   Panels Proposal
*   Doctoral Student Consortium
*   APSCE Excellence Scholarship Award
*   Early Career Workshop
*   Workshops/Tutorials/Interactive Event Proposals
*   Work-in-Progress Posters

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Page Limits:**
    *   Full paper: 8-10 pages
    *   Short paper: 5-6 pages
    *   Poster: 2-3 pages
*   **Formatting:** Authors must adhere to the formatting instructions in the provided paper template file. Please download the latest version.
*   **Review Process:** The conference will have a **single-blind review** process. Authors' identities will not be known to referees, but referees' identities will be known to authors. Anonymization is not required.
*   **Submission System:** All papers must be submitted via EasyChair.
    *   **EasyChair Site:** Go to the EasyChair ICCE 2025 site.
    *   **Account:** Login to your existing EasyChair account or create a new one.
    *   **Submission Process:** Click the 'enter as an author' link or 'New Submission' button and choose the appropriate sub-conference (track).
*   **Copyright:** Authors of accepted papers will be required to complete a "Transfer of Copyright Agreement."

## Important Dates

Specific submission deadlines, notification dates, and other key dates are not detailed in the provided text, but an "Important Dates" section is available on the conference website.

## Publication

*   Accepted papers from the main conference, workshops, Early Career Workshop, Doctoral Student Consortium, SATULEC, and Work-in-Progress Posters will be published in proceedings.
*   These proceedings will be submitted to **Elsevier for inclusion in Scopus**.
*   Proceedings of the main conference will also be submitted to **Thomson Reuters for inclusion in the Conference Proceedings Citation Index**.

## Message from the Local Organizing Committee (LOC)

The LOC addresses concerns regarding geopolitical developments, reassuring participants that Chennai is over 2,000 kilometers from affected border areas and that life in Chennai continues normally. There are no travel advisories in place for the region. The message also notes that across India, major academic events and conferences have resumed. The LOC is committed to the safety and well-being of all participants and encourages authors to proceed with submissions.

## Contact Us

*   **Program-related queries:** [icce2025.program@gmail.com](mailto:icce2025.program@gmail.com)
*   **Location-related queries:** [icce2025.loc@code.iitm.ac.in](mailto:icce2025.loc@code.iitm.ac.in)

callForPapers:
# IEEE ISI 2025: Call for Papers

The **IEEE International Conference on Intelligence and Security Informatics (ISI) 2025** will be held from **July 12-13, 2025, in Hong Kong, China**.

## Overview

Intelligence and security informatics (ISI) is an interdisciplinary field that bridges academic researchers in information technology, social and behavioral sciences, computer science, law, and public policy with industry consultants, practitioners, security managers, and chief information security officers. The conference aims to advance the understanding of the interrelationships between technology, humans, organizations, and security, integrating recent advances from diverse domains.

## Invitation to Submit

ISI 2025 invites academic researchers in ISI and related areas, as well as IT, security, and analytics professionals, industry consultants, and practitioners, to submit papers and workshop proposals.

## Areas of Interest

Research relevant to **artificial intelligence security**, **LLM security**, and **human behavior in security contexts** is strongly encouraged.

## Submission Information

*   **Contribution Types:** Papers and workshop proposals are invited.
*   **Publication:** All accepted papers will be included in the proceedings at IEEE Xplore.
*   **Further Information:** Please refer to the following sections for detailed guidelines:
    *   [Call for Papers](https://ieee-isi.org/2025/contributions/call-for-papers/)
    *   [Information For Authors](https://ieee-isi.org/2025/contributions/information-for-authors/)
    *   [Reviews Guidelines](https://ieee-isi.org/2025/contributions/reviews-guidelines/)

## Registration

Registration is available here: [Register Here](https://its-registration.paperhost.net/isi25/session/login)

callForPapers:
# CALL FOR RESEARCH PAPERS

The IEEE International Symposium on Real-Time Distributed Computing (ISORC) 2025, themed **"Resilient and Intelligent Real-Time Systems for a Hyperconnected World"**, invites high-quality papers pertaining to all aspects of ORC technology. ISORC has become established as the leading event devoted to state-of-the-art research in the field of object/component/service-oriented real-time distributed computing (ORC) technology.

Authors of selected papers from ISORC 2025 will be invited to submit an extended version of their work for the **Special Issue on AI-Driven Real-Time Distributed Computing for the Edge-Cloud Continuum** for review and possible publication in the Elsevier Journal of Systems Architecture: Embedded Software Design (JSA).

## Main Theme and Topics

ISORC 2025 encourages submissions with a practical orientation and validation related to Case Studies & Applications. The specific ORC focus areas include, but are not limited to:

*   **Software architectures for real-time and/or distributed computing:** Programming paradigms, ORC paradigms, object/component models languages, synchronous languages, microservices architectures, soft, hard, performance-aware, distributed aspects of real-time computing, service-oriented architectures, scalability, performance, Event-Driven, Safety, Reliability, Middleware, Patterns and practices, etc.
*   **Distributed and/or Real-Time Image, video and Stream Processing:** Deep Learning, Methods and Algorithms, Federated Learning, distributed and parallel AI/ML, Real-Time stream processing with Kafka, Apache Spark and Flink, AI/ML for real-time and/or distributed image and video processing, distributed Digital Signal Processing in Communications, decentralized emerging technologies for real time, real time Image and signal processing Applications.
*   **Distributed and/or Real Time Communication for Emerging and Future Networks:** Distributed and/or Real-time communications, networked platforms, protocols (WPAN, LPWAN, NB-IoT, 5G cellulars), Internet QoS, Peer-to-Peer computing, sensor networks, VANETS and V2V and V2I communications, Time-Sensitive and Time-predictable software, systems and hardware, Time Sensitive Networking, AI-powered Metaverse, Network Programmability, distributed and/or real-time packet processing for future networking infrastructures, Network Function Virtualization (NFV), Network Slicing, Digital twin for NGN and distributed and/or real-time data processing.
*   **Blockchain and Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT) for Distributed and/or Real-Time Computing:** Blockchains architectures and their interoperability and scalability, Layer-2 solutions (e.g., state and side channels, DeFi protocols and NFTs, optimistic rollup Bundle, Zero Knowledge Rollup, off-chain), Layer 3 Blockchain protocols (e.g., interoperable protocols and cross-chain DApps, cross-chain RT applications), Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI) based ORC, consensus protocols and smart contracts, Blockchain oracles, trusted and dependable systems, Cryptographic techniques for ORC, etc.
*   **Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for Distributed and/or Real Time Computing:** Parallel and distributed AI/ML, Real-time AI/ML, Machine Learning on the Edge, TinyML, EdgeAI, Federated Learning, Ensemble Machine Learning Models, Generative AI and LLM, etc.
*   **DevOps and CI/CD for Distributed and/or Real Time Computing:** Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD), Microservices Architecture, Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), Orchestration, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Monitoring and Logging, Distributed Systems, Event-Driven Architecture, Message Queues (Kafka, RabbitMQ), Serverless Computing, Scalability, Load Balancing, Fault Tolerance, High Availability, Cloud-Native Applications, API Management, Data Streaming, Real-Time Analytics, Network Latency Optimization, SRE (Site Reliability Engineering).
*   **CyberSecurity and Security of Distributed and/or Real Time IoT Systems:** Cyber security of critical infrastructures, cyber defense, Zero Trusted Architecture, Data Encryption, Privacy-preserving Homomorphic encryption, Arbitrary code execution, Backdoors, Code injection, Botnets, Ensemble Learning for Anomalies and Attacks Detection, etc.
*   **Optimization Approaches for Distributed and/or Real Time Computing:** Optimization Algorithms, methods, and heuristics, unconstrained nonlinear, graph and concave quadratic functions, constrained nonlinear, convex optimization, combinatorial, metaheuristics for IoT, CPS, Edge-Cloud continuum.
*   **Sustainable and Green Computing Transformation for Distributed and/or Real Time Computing:** Green energy and green networking, digital and green transformation, sustainable hardware and software, green software engineering and power modeling, carbon neutrality computation and networking, green network slicing and virtualization, data center sustainability, sustainable energy for 5G/6G Mobile Networks.
*   **Formal Verification and Model Checking for Distributed and/or Real-Time Computing:** Real-Time System verification and validation, Statistical model-checking, Formal Methods and Models, Formal verification technology, Reduction and Abstraction Techniques for Model-Checking, etc.
*   **Ontology-based Knowledge Modeling for Distributed and/or Real-Time Computing:** Knowledge and Reasoning frameworks for ORC, Semantics for model-based systems engineering, Ontology-Based Simulation, Distributed ontologies, Ontology alignment, Formal ontologies, Scalability in knowledge systems, Distributed Knowledge graph for ORC, etc.
*   **Dependability, Fault tolerance, and Resilience of Distributed and/or Real-Time Computing:** Fault Tolerance, Fault Detection and Recovery, Fault Injection Testing, Self-Healing, Failover, Error Correction, Redundancy, High Availability, Safety, Reliability, Autonomic Reconfiguration, Autonomic Resilience, Availability, Durability, Reliability, and Resilience, Error Detection, .
*   **Algorithms for Distributed and/or Real-Time Analytics:** Real-Time Stream Processing, Clustering, Classification, Mining and Inferencing, AI-ML, FedML, DRL and Statistical Modeling, Digital Twin and Predictive Analytics, Stream Correlation and Sampling, Dynamic Scheduling, Complex Event-Processing, Time-Series and TimeFM Analysis.
*   **Distributed Management, Monitoring, Performance Evaluation of Distributed and/or Real-Time Computing:** Infrastructures and Clusters Monitoring (Kubernetes, Grafana, prometheus, etc.), Distributed Network Monitoring, Management tools and techniques, Timing/Temporal Evaluation, Dependability, End-to-End QoS, System/Infrastructure Overheads, Fault Detection and Recovery, Large-scale Evaluations and Field Studies.
*   **Operating Systems, Middleware and System software for Distributed and/or Real-Time Computing:** Real-Time Kernels, Operating Systems, Virtualization/Containerization, Middleware for ORC, QoS Management and Performance, Decentralized Processing, Scalability, Extensibility, Synchronization, Resource Allocation, Scheduling, Energy Efficiency, Timing Analysis, Fault Tolerance and Resilience, Security, etc.
*   **Distributed and/or Real-Time IoT Applications:** Medical devices, Intelligent Transportation Systems, Industrial Automation Systems and Industry 4.0, Internet of Things and Smart Grids, Embedded and Cyber-Physical Systems (Automotive, Avionics, Spatial, Under-Water, Autonomous Vehicles, Consumer Electronics, Building Systems, Sensors, etc.), Multimedia Processing, Real-Time Web-based Applications, QoS-Aware and Real-Time Cloud/Edge/Fog Computing, SDN/NFV, Network Slicing, Blockchain, Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT) for Real-time Log Management, decentralized real-time data network, Digital Twins, time-sensitive social dispersed computing.

## Submission Guidelines

ISORC 2025 invites papers in three categories, all will be published in the IEEE proceedings. Submissions will be reviewed by at least three TPC members according to a **single-blind review process**.

### Contribution Types:

*   **Regular Research Papers:** Papers should describe original work. They should be a maximum of **10 pages** in length, using the IEEE conference paper format. A maximum of **two extra pages** may be purchased during the camera-ready submission of accepted papers.
*   **Industrial Papers and Practitioner Reports:** Papers describing experiences of using ORC technology in application or tool development projects. These papers should be no longer than **10 pages**, using the IEEE conference paper format and may be less formal than research papers. A maximum of **two extra pages** may be purchased during the camera-ready submission of accepted papers. They should clearly identify and discuss in detail the issues that represent notable industrial advances. Reports with project metrics supporting their claims are particularly sought, as well as those that show both benefits and drawbacks of the approaches used in the given project.
*   **Short Papers:** Short research papers on real-time analytics are also invited. They should be no longer than **6 pages**, using the IEEE conference paper format, and should contain enough information for the program committee to understand the scope of the project and evaluate the novelty of the problem or approach.

The [IEEE conference paper templates](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html) can be found [here](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html).

Papers are to be submitted through the [HotCRP system](https://isorc25.hotcrp.com/).

## Important Dates

*   **Submission deadline (extended):** February 02, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** March 05, 2025
*   **Camera-ready papers:** March 20, 2025
*   **Author registration deadline (FIRM):** April 20, 2025

## Publication and Presentation

*   All accepted submissions will appear in the proceedings published by IEEE.
*   Each accepted paper shall be accompanied by at least one non-student registration.
*   One of the authors of the paper must attend and present their work at the conference. Failure to present the paper in person can lead to the paper being withdrawn from the proceedings.

## Contact Information

For questions regarding paper submissions, please contact:

*   Daniel Casini
*   Pascal Berthou
*   Mustafa Al Lail
