callForPapers:
# ISPASS 2025: Artifact Evaluation

ISPASS 2025 will conduct an optional artifact evaluation (AE) process for authors of accepted papers. The goal is to promote reproducibility and provide recognition through various badges.

## Important Dates

*   **AE Registration Deadline:** March 14, 2025, 11:59:59 PM, Anywhere on Earth
*   **AE Submission Deadline:** March 17, 2025, 11:59:59 PM, Anywhere on Earth
*   **AE Decision Notification:** April 8, 2025

## Submission Instructions

Registration and submission should be done on the [ISPASS 2025 AE HotCRP site](https://ispass2025ae.hotcrp.com/).

An artifact submission consists of two parts:

1.  **Paper and a two-page appendix:** Prepare your appendix using the provided template. The appendix should include an abstract, metainformation, artifact access details, system requirements, experiment workflow, steps for evaluation, and results. This appendix does not count towards the regular page limit.
2.  **The artifact:** Ensure the artifact evaluation committee can access your artifact. For submission, providing code via convenient means like GitHub is sufficient. To earn the "Available" badge, you must upload your artifact to a public archival website.

## Badges

The availability of artifacts will be denoted by the following IEEE Reproducibility Badges:

*   **Available:** Reasonable and complete code and/or datasets, including data and documentation, provided by authors to support reproducibility.
*   **Reviewed:** Reasonable and complete code and/or datasets that run to produce described outputs and support reproducibility.
*   **Reproducible:** Computational results regenerated by an independent party using author-created research objects, methods, code, and analysis conditions. Assumes artifacts were also reviewed.

Artifacts can be **Code** or **Datasets**. A paper can have both.

## Earning the "Available" Badge

To earn the "Available" badge, artifacts must be uploaded to either [Zenodo](https://zenodo.org/) or [Figshare](https://figshare.com/) to ensure long-term archival storage and provide a persistent identifier (DOI).

## Artifact Evaluation Process

*   Artifacts will be evaluated by a dedicated Artifacts Evaluation (AE) committee through a **single-blind review process**.
*   Authors should be available to respond quickly during the evaluation period.
*   The evaluation is restricted to **accepted papers** at ISPASS 2025.
*   The committee may communicate with authors (anonymously through the submission platform) to provide feedback and allow authors to address issues.
*   Authors are recommended to document artifacts thoroughly to minimize interaction.
*   For artifacts requiring significant computation time, provide a shortcut or sampling mechanism.
*   For system requirements that cannot be met by a standard computer, authors are responsible for providing remote access (e.g., via SSH) with proper anonymization.

## Distinguished Artifact Award

All submitted artifacts will compete for a "Distinguished Artifact Award" based on reproducibility, ease of use, documentation, extensibility, and substantial support for the paper's claims.

## Questions

For any questions, please contact the Artifact Evaluation chairs: Eojin Lee and Hyokeun Lee.

# ISPEC 2025: Call for Papers

Authors are invited to submit full papers presenting new research results related to information security technologies and applications to the **20th International Conference on Information Security Practice and Experience (ISPEC 2025)**.

## Conference Details

*   **Dates:** November 7-9, 2025
*   **Venue:** Chengdu, China
*   **Organizers:** University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, China and IEEE Reliability Society
*   **Publication:** Springer, Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) series.

## Topics of Interest

Areas of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Cryptology
*   Applied cryptography
*   Mobile security
*   Cloud security
*   Access control
*   Privacy enhanced technology
*   Viruses and malware
*   Software security
*   Database security
*   Web security
*   Operating system security
*   Intrusion detection
*   Big data security and privacy
*   Biometric Security
*   Implementation
*   Network security
*   Key management
*   Security and privacy in ubiquitous computing
*   Formal methods for security
*   Digital forensics
*   Security for critical infrastructures
*   Embedded systems security
*   Lightweight security
*   Smart grid security
*   Cyber security for urban transportation
*   Cyber-physical security
*   Cryptocurrency

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission Type:** Original papers, not substantially duplicating work published elsewhere or submitted in parallel to other venues.
*   **Anonymity:** Submissions must be anonymous, with no author names, affiliations, acknowledgements, or obvious references.
*   **Length:** Up to **16 pages** (single column) excluding appendices and bibliography, and up to **20 pages** in total. Must use at least 11-point fonts and reasonable margins.
*   **Formatting:** Papers must use either the LaTeX or Word templates provided by Springer. Consult Springer's [Instructions for Authors of Proceedings](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines) for detailed guidelines.
*   **Code of Conduct:** Authors are required to adhere to Springer Nature's [Code of Conduct for book authors](https://www.springernature.com/gp/authors/book-authors-code-of-conduct).
*   **Submission Link:** [ISPEC 2025 Submission Link](https://easychair.org/my/conference?conf=ispec2025)

## Important Dates

*   **Paper submission:** July 7, 2025
*   **Acceptance Notification:** July 31, 2025
*   **Camera-ready Version:** August 15, 2025

## Keynote Speakers

*   **Mohammed Atiquzzaman**, Professor, University of Oklahoma, United States
*   **Shui Yu**, Professor, University of Technology Sydney, Australia

## Special Issues

Selected manuscripts may be invited for extended versions to be submitted to Special Issues in open access journals with discounted article processing charges (APCs).

## Registration

Registration is under construction and will be announced later.

## Visa Information

*   Overseas participants should check visa requirements for China.
*   Information on visa-free transit policies is available on the website, but participants should double-check with official sources.
*   For invitation letters, contact Dr. Chaosheng Feng (email: csfenggy@sicnu.edu.cn).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - Research Track

ISSRE (International Symposium on Software Reliability Engineering) is the leading conference on software reliability, focusing on approaches, techniques, and tools for assessing, predicting, and improving the reliability, safety, and security of software systems.

## ISSRE 2025 Key Features

*   **Early Decisions:** ISSRE 2025 introduces an early decision system. Authors will be notified of an "Accept", "Reject", or "Response Recommended" outcome at the beginning of the author response period, reserving author responses for cases with specific reviewer inquiries.
*   **Transparency and Reproducibility:** Authors are encouraged to disclose data and submit artifacts to the Artifact Evaluation (AE) track to enhance reproducibility and quality, potentially earning credibility badges.
*   **Physical Presentation Requirement:** At least one author of every accepted paper is required to make a full author registration and present at the conference physically in São Paulo.
*   **Special Issue Invitation:** Authors of accepted papers will be invited to submit an extended version of their work to a special issue of the Empirical Software Engineering (EMSE) journal.

## Submission Categories

ISSRE 2025 invites high-quality submissions in the following categories:

1.  **Full research regular (REG) papers:** Describing a novel contribution to the reliability of software systems, with clear evidence and validation.
2.  **Practical experience reports (PER) papers:** Exposition of practical experiences, lessons learned, or empirical studies, including negative results.
3.  **Tools and artefacts (TAR) papers:** Presenting new tools or substantial extensions to existing tools, or software and experimental data sets.

## Important Dates (AoE)

*   **Abstract submission deadline:** April 28, 2025 / May 5, 2025
*   **Paper submission deadline:** May 5, 2025 / May 12, 2025
*   **Early decisions:** June 30, 2025
*   **Author rebuttal period:** June 30th - July 6th, 2025
*   **Notification to authors:** July 18, 2025
*   **Camera ready papers:** August 19, 2025

## Paper Categories and Lengths

*   **REG papers:** 12 pages (including references).
*   **PER papers:** 12 pages (including references).
*   **TAR papers:** 6 - 10 pages (including references).

Papers exceeding the page limits will be rejected without review.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include development, analysis methods and models throughout the software development lifecycle, and are not limited to:

*   Dependability attributes (i.e., security, safety, maintainability, survivability, resilience, robustness) impacting software reliability
*   Reliability threats, i.e. faults (defects, bugs, etc.), errors, failures
*   Reliability means (fault prevention, fault removal, fault tolerance, fault forecasting)
*   Software testing and formal methods
*   Software fault localization, debugging, root-cause analysis
*   Metrics, measurements and threat estimation for reliability prediction and the interplay with safety/security
*   Reliability of autonomous systems and (self-)adaptive systems
*   Reliability of AI-based systems, AI for Reliability Engineering
*   Reliability of Large Language/Foundational Model (LLM) and LLM for software reliability
*   Reliability of software services and Software as a Service (SaaS)
*   Reliability of model-based and auto-generated software
*   Reliability of open-source software
*   Reliability of software dealing with Big Data
*   Reliability of green and sustainable systems
*   Reliability of mobile systems
*   Reliability of software within specific technological spaces (e.g., Internet of Things, Cloud, Semantic Web/Web 3.0, Virtualization, Blockchain, networks softwarization, 5G/6G, edge-to-cloud computing)
*   Normative/regulatory/ethical spaces about software reliability
*   Societal aspects of software reliability

## Anonymizing Rules

Authors must anonymize their papers by:

1.  Removing authors' names and affiliations from the title page.
2.  Removing acknowledgements of identifying names and funding sources.
3.  Using care in naming files (source file names are often embedded).
4.  Referring to related work, particularly your own, in the third person. Avoid omitting references.
5.  If citing anonymous work, send deanonymized references to the PC chairs via email.
6.  Authors may use a non-anonymized version for other purposes but must not mention submission to ISSRE 2025.

Submissions violating formatting and anonymization rules will be desk rejected.

## Formatting Rules

*   Submissions must adhere to the IEEE Computer Society Format Guidelines using the provided LaTeX/Word templates.
*   Each paper must be submitted as a single Portable Document Format (PDF) file with embedded fonts.
*   The first page must include the title and a maximum 200-word abstract.
*   Figures and graphs should be readable in grayscale.
*   Symbols and labels in graphs should be readable when printed.
*   Limit file size to less than 15 MB.
*   Authors are encouraged to supply source code and raw data for reproducibility.

## Paper Submission

*   Papers are submitted via Easychair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=issre2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=issre2025)
*   Submissions will be reviewed via a double-blind process. Papers with non-disclosure agreement forms will be rejected.
*   Changes in author numbers/order are not allowed after acceptance.
*   Submissions violating formatting and anonymization rules will be desk rejected without review.

## Review Process and Author Response

Reviews will be made available to authors before the PC/Board meeting for factual error correction. Responses should be concise and focus on reviewer concerns. The new "Early Decisions" system will categorize papers as "Accept", "Reject", or "Response Recommended" early on, reducing the need for responses in many cases.

## Awards

*   **Best Research Paper Award:** Awarded annually to the best paper in the Research Track.

## Conference Proceedings

The conference proceedings will be published by IEEE Computer Society Conference Publishing Services (CPS), submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore and A&I partners.

## IEEE Policies

All submissions must adhere to IEEE Conference Publishing Policies and will be screened for plagiarism through the IEEE Cross Check portal.

The symposium aims to provide a forum for researchers to present their latest research in visual computing, covering computer vision, computer graphics, virtual reality, and visualization. callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 20th International Symposium on Visual Computing (ISVC) seeks papers describing contributions to the state of the art and practice in the broad field of visual computing. The symposium is structured around the four central areas of visual computing: **Computer Vision**, **Computer Graphics**, **Virtual Reality**, and **Visualization**. Papers that span multiple areas are particularly encouraged.

In addition to the main program, ISVC includes invited and contributed presentations, six keynote presentations, tutorials, special tracks, and a poster session.

## Submission Areas and Topics

ISVC is organized around the following core areas, with topics of interest including, but not limited to:

### Area 1: Computer Vision
Computer vision is the study of enabling computers to understand and interpret visual information from static images and video sequences. We are seeking papers covering both the theory and applications of computer vision. Topics of interest include:
*   Early and Biologically-Inspired Vision
*   Color and Texture
*   Illumination and Reflectance Modeling
*   Segmentation and Grouping
*   Object Recognition/Detection/Categorization
*   Motion and Tracking
*   Video Analysis and Event Recognition
*   Biometrics (Face, Fingerprint, Hand, Iris, etc.)
*   Pattern Recognition
*   Statistical Methods and Learning
*   Deep Learning
*   Big Data
*   Document Analysis
*   Medical Image Analysis
*   Image and Video Retrieval
*   3D Reconstruction
*   Shape from X
*   Physics-Based Modeling
*   Image-Based Modeling
*   Computational Photography
*   Human-Computer Interfaces
*   Vision for Graphics
*   Vision for Robotics
*   Sensors and Systems
*   Secure Image/Video Communication
*   Image/Video Encoding/Compression
*   Applications

### Area 2: Computer Graphics
Advances and breakthroughs in computer graphics have made visual media the basis of the modern user interface. ISVC seeks original research and applied papers in all areas of computer graphics. Topics of interest include:
*   Geometric Modeling
*   Physically Based Modeling
*   Geometric Computing
*   Shape and Surface Modeling
*   Graphics Algorithms
*   Web Based Graphics
*   Perceptual Aspects of Computer Graphics
*   Computer Animation
*   Special Effects
*   Multimedia and Digital Media
*   Computational Photography
*   Image-Based Computer Graphics
*   Rendering Techniques
*   Stylized Rendering
*   Global Illumination, Photo-Realistic Computer Graphics
*   Volume Graphics, Semi-Transparent Media
*   Graphics System Architectures
*   Graphics Hardware and Hardware-Related Techniques (GPU)
*   Data Compression for Graphics
*   Computer Graphics for Small/Large Displays
*   Parallelism in Computer Graphics
*   Graphic Toolkits
*   Interaction and HCI
*   Simulation for Computer Graphics
*   Applications

### Area 3: Virtual Reality
Virtual reality (VR) enables users to experience a three-dimensional environment generated using computer graphics, and perhaps other sensory modalities, to provide an environment for enhanced interaction between a human user and a computer-created world. ISVC seeks original research and applied papers in all areas of virtual reality, as well as augmented reality, mixed reality and 3D HCI. Topics of interest include:
*   Augmented Reality
*   Mixed Reality
*   Artificial Reality
*   Real-Time Rendering
*   Collision detection in VR
*   3D Interaction for VR
*   Modeling and Simulation
*   Virtual Humans and Artificial Life
*   VR Systems and Toolkits
*   Collaborative Virtual Environments
*   Tele-collaboration
*   VR System Architecture
*   Multimodal Displays
*   Projection and Display Systems
*   Human Computer Interaction
*   Presence and Cognition
*   Integration of VR and Multimedia
*   Immersive Gaming
*   Multi-user and Distributed VR and gaming
*   Serious Games
*   Haptics, Audio, and Other Non-Visual Interfaces
*   Tracking and Sensing
*   Human Factors
*   User Studies and Evaluation
*   Hardware Devices
*   Applications

### Area 4: Visualization
The field of visualization seeks to determine and present underlying correlated structures and relationships in both scientific (computational and medical sciences) and more abstract datasets. The prime objective of the presentation should be to communicate the information in a dataset so as to enhance understanding. Topics of interest include:
*   Visualization Taxonomies and Models
*   Information Visualization
*   Scalar, Vector, and Tensor Visualization
*   Multi-dimensional and Multi-Resolution Data Visualization
*   Time Series Data Visualization
*   Medical Data Visualization
*   Molecular Data Visualization
*   Geographic Data Visualization
*   Volume Visualization
*   Flow Visualization
*   Large Scale Data Set Visualization
*   Collaborative and Distributive Visualization
*   Isosurfaces
*   Rendering Techniques
*   Visualization Systems
*   Visual Analytics, Visual Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery
*   Display and Interaction Technology
*   Human Perception and Cognition
*   Human Factors
*   Haptics for Visualization
*   Evaluation and User Studies
*   Hardware for Visualization
*   Mesh Techniques and Compression
*   Applications

## Important Dates

*   **Tutorial and Special Track Proposals:** April 30, **May 15, 2025**
*   **Tutorial & Special Track Notifications:** May 12, **20, 2025**
*   **Paper Submissions:** **August 20, 2025** (11:59PM PST)
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** **September 22, 2025**
*   **Final Paper:** **October 20, 2025**
*   **Early Registration:** **October 20, 2025**
*   **Hotel Reservation:** **October 20, 2024**
*   **ISVC’25 Conference Dates:** **November 17-19, 2025**

## Publication

The symposium’s proceedings will be published by Springer in the **Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) series**. Authors of selected papers presented at ISVC’25 will be invited to submit an extended version of their work for expedited review and possible publication in a special issue on Advances in Visual Computing in the **Machine Vision and Applications journal**.

## Submission

Please submit your paper via the Paper Submission portal: [https://www.isvc.net/index.php/paper-submission/](https://www.isvc.net/index.php/paper-submission/)

Check the [special tracks](https://www.isvc.net/index.php/special-tracks-2/) for potential fits for your submission.

callForPapers:
# VEHITS 2026: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Vehicle Technology and Intelligent Transport Systems (VEHITS) 2026 is an event dedicated to bringing together engineers, researchers, and practitioners interested in the advances and applications in the field of Vehicle Technology and Intelligent Transport Systems.

VEHITS 2026 will be held from **May 18 to May 20, 2026**, and is sponsored by INSTICC – Institute for Systems and Technologies of Information, Control and Communication.

## Scope

This conference focuses on innovative applications, tools, and platforms across all technology areas related to vehicles and intelligent transportation systems. Papers describing advanced prototypes, systems, tools, techniques, and survey papers indicating future directions are encouraged. Both full research reports and work-in-progress reports are welcome.

## Conference Areas

1.  **Connected Vehicles**
2.  **Data Analytics**
3.  **Intelligent Transport Systems and Infrastructure**
4.  **Intelligent Vehicle Technologies**
5.  **Smart Mobility and Sustainable Transport Services**

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work as a complete paper or an abstract. Accepted abstracts are presented but not published in the proceedings.

*   **Language:** English, carefully checked for correct grammar and spelling.
*   **Content:** Papers should indicate the nature of their technical/scientific contribution and their applicability.
*   **Anonymity:** To facilitate double-blind evaluation, authors must produce papers without any reference to authors' personal details, acknowledgments, or other identifying information.
*   **Originality:** Only original papers should be submitted. Submissions must not substantially overlap with work published elsewhere or simultaneously submitted.
*   **Submission Platform:** All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform PRIMORIS.
*   **Ethical Norms:** Authors must adhere to INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism.

## Publications

*   All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings, available in the SCITEPRESS Digital Library, with an ISBN reference and DOI.
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.
*   It is planned to publish a short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers with Springer in a CCIS Series book (final approval pending).

## Important Dates

All dates refer to AOE time, i.e. "Anywhere on Earth"

### Regular Papers

*   **Paper Submission:** January 5, 2026
*   **Authors Notification:** March 3, 2026
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** March 17, 2026

### Position Papers / Regular Papers

*   **Paper Submission:** February 17, 2026
*   **Authors Notification:** March 24, 2026
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** April 6, 2026

### Workshops

*   **Workshop Proposal:** January 20, 2026

### Special Sessions

*   **Special Session Proposal:** January 20, 2026

### Tutorials

*   **Tutorial Proposal:** April 10, 2026

### Demos

*   **Demo Proposal:** April 10, 2026

### Panels

*   **Panel Proposal:** April 10, 2026

## Conference Chair

*   Karsten Berns, University of Kaiserslautern-Landau, Germany

## Program Co-Chairs

*   Jeroen Ploeg, Siemens Industry Software Netherlands B.V., Netherlands
*   Arnaud de La Fortelle, Heex Technologies, France

## Program Committee

(Members listed on the website)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IEEE VISSOFT 2025

The thirteenth IEEE Working Conference on Software Visualization (VISSOFT 2025) is principally a venue for publishing and discussing research related to software visualization. It brings together a community of researchers from software engineering, information visualization, human-computer interaction, computer graphics, and data science to discuss theoretical foundations, algorithms, techniques, tools, and applications related to software visualization.

VISSOFT 2025 will be held from **September 7-8, 2025**, and is co-located with ICSME 2025.

## Topics of Interest

Software visualization is a broad research area. Topics include, but are not limited to, the visualization of:

*   **Software Engineering data:** source code, dependencies, repositories, developer social networks (e.g., StackOverflow, GitHub), mobile app reviews, documentation, runtime logs, and DevOps data.
*   **Software development activities:** design, requirements engineering, software maintenance, program comprehension, software performance, software testing, and debugging.
*   **Software analytical approaches** based on data science concepts.
*   **Empirical evaluations** of software visualizations, including eye-tracking studies.
*   **Tools, techniques, and frameworks** that include visual programming languages.
*   **Interactive and immersive techniques and algorithms** related to software development.
*   **Integrating tools** with development environments.
*   **Industrial experience** with using software visualization.
*   **Techniques used in Software Engineering Education**.
*   **Application of trendy techniques** such as Machine Learning and AI-assisted models (Large Language Models, Large Multi-Modal Models with Software).
*   **Application of techniques** such as Augmented and Virtual Reality, and Sonification, to software engineering activities.

## Submission Types

### Research Track

*   **Description:** In-depth and mature research results relevant to software visualization.
*   **Page Limit:** Maximum of 10 pages (including figures, tables, appendices), plus up to two additional pages for the bibliography.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Abstract: **May 16, 2025**
    *   Paper Submission: **May 23, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 4, 2025**
*   **Supplementary Materials:** Submission of a video (up to 5 minutes) and/or reproduction packages is highly encouraged.
*   **Awards:** Distinguished technical papers may be awarded and invited for extended submission to the IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics journal.
*   **Artifact Evaluation:** Authors are encouraged to submit artifacts for evaluation.

### New Ideas and Emerging Results (NIER) Track

*   **Description:** Work-in-progress, preliminary, and exciting ideas and results. Encourages open questions and provocative hypotheses for early feedback.
*   **Page Limit:** Maximum of 5 pages (including bibliography).
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Abstract: **May 16, 2025**
    *   Paper Submission: **May 23, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 4, 2025**
*   **Awards:** Distinguished NIER papers may be awarded.

### Tools Track

*   **Description:** Submissions describing already implemented and functional tools, focusing on architecture or use for new insights. Evolutions of previously presented tools are also welcome.
*   **Page Limit:** Short papers: 4 pages (+ 1 page for bibliography). Long papers: 10 pages (+ 2 pages for bibliography).
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Abstract: **May 16, 2025**
    *   Paper Submission: **May 23, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 4, 2025**
*   **Video Submission:** Mandatory (up to 5 minutes).
*   **Showcase Session:** Informal tool demonstration session.
*   **Artifact Evaluation:** Authors are encouraged to submit tools and artifacts for evaluation.

### Journal-First Track

*   **Description:** Presentation of papers accepted by relevant journals published between July 1, 2023, and July 11, 2025, reporting new research results.
*   **Submission Requirements:** A one-page presentation proposal including paper title, authors, statement on criteria satisfaction, and a pointer to the original journal paper.
*   **Publication:** Journal-first manuscripts are published through journals, not conference proceedings.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Submission: **July 11, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 16, 2025**

### Poster Track

*   **Description:** Opportunity for researchers and practitioners to present new and innovative preliminary work in an informal, interactive setting.
*   **Manuscript:** Two-page documents.
*   **Publication:** Poster manuscripts will be part of the Conference proceedings.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Submission: **July 11, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 16, 2025**

### Visualization Challenge Track (NEW!)

*   **Description:** Contribution of expertise focused on a single software system (this year: the Linux kernel) to reveal new understandings.
*   **Submission:** Short abstract, video (up to 5 minutes), optional link to tool demo.
*   **Evaluation:** Primarily novelty and interest.
*   **Post-Notification Submission:** 2-4 page paper describing the tool/visualization.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Abstract Submission: **June 13, 2025**
    *   Notification of invitation to submit: **June 17, 2025**
    *   Short Paper Submission: **July 11, 2025**
    *   Feedback from PC Chairs: **July 16, 2025**

## How to Submit

*   Papers must strictly adhere to the two-column IEEE conference proceedings format. Use the available IEEE Manuscript Templates for Conference Proceedings: [https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html)
*   At least one author of an accepted paper must register and present at the conference.
*   Supplemental material (e.g., video, data, software) can be linked in your paper. Archiving artifacts in an open access archive is encouraged.
*   **Review Process:** VISSOFT uses a **single-blind review process**.

## Important Dates Summary (AoE)

| Track                               | Paper Abstract   | Paper Submission | Paper Notification |
| :---------------------------------- | :--------------- | :--------------- | :----------------- |
| Research, NIER, and Tools Track   | May 16, 2025     | May 23, 2025     | July 4, 2025       |
| Journal-First, and Poster Track   | --               | July 11, 2025    | July 16, 2025      |
| **Visualization Challenge Track**   | **June 13, 2025**| **July 11, 2025**| **July 16, 2025**  |
| *(Abstract Submission)*             |                  |                  | *(Notification)*   |
| *(Short Paper Submission)*          |                  |                  | *(Feedback)*       |

callForPapers:
# VMCAI 2025: Call for Papers

VMCAI 2025 is the 26th International Conference on Verification, Model Checking, and Abstract Interpretation, taking place from **January 20-21, 2025**, in **Denver, Colorado, United States**. The conference is co-located with POPL 2025.

VMCAI provides a forum for researchers from the communities of Verification, Model Checking, and Abstract Interpretation, facilitating interaction, cross-fertilization, and advancement of hybrid methods that combine these and related areas.

## Scope

The program will consist of refereed research papers, invited lectures, and tutorials. Research contributions can report new results as well as experimental evaluations and comparisons of existing techniques.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Program Verification
*   Model Checking
*   Abstract Interpretation
*   Abstract Domains
*   Program Synthesis
*   Static Analysis
*   Type Systems
*   Deductive Methods
*   Program Logics
*   First-Order Theories
*   Decision Procedures
*   Interpolation
*   Horn Clause Solving
*   Program Certification
*   Separation Logic
*   Probabilistic Programming and Analysis
*   Error Diagnosis
*   Detection of Bugs and Security Vulnerabilities
*   Program Transformations
*   Hybrid and Cyber-physical Systems
*   Concurrent and distributed Systems
*   Analysis of numerical properties
*   Analysis of smart contracts
*   Analysis of neural networks
*   Case Studies on all of the above topics

Submissions can address any programming paradigm, including concurrent, constraint, functional, imperative, logic, and object-oriented programming.

## Submission Categories and Page Limits

Submissions are required to follow Springer’s LNCS format. The page limit depends on the paper’s category. Additional material beyond the page limit may be placed in a clearly marked appendix.

*   **Regular papers:** Clearly identify and justify an advance to the field. Supported by experimental validation where applicable. **20 pages** (not counting references).
*   **Tool papers:** Present a new tool, component, or extensions. Emphasize design and implementation. **12 pages** (not counting references).
*   **Case studies:** Describe the use of techniques in new application domains or industrial settings. Expected to contain novel applications and evaluations. **20 pages** (not counting references).

## Important Dates (AoE / UTC-12)

*   **Paper submission deadline (extended):** October 1, 2024
*   **Notification:** November 11, 2024
*   **Camera-ready version due:** November 22, 2024

## Artifact Submission

*   **Artifact Registration Deadline:** October 1, 2024
*   **Artifact submission deadline:** October 3, 2024
*   **Artifact Evaluation Notification:** November 8, 2024

Artifacts should not be anonymous and will be evaluated based on consistency with the paper, replicability, completeness, documentation, and ease of use.

## Registration

*   Registration is handled through [easyconferences](https://www.easyconferences.org/vmcai2025/register).
*   **Early registration deadline:** December 20, 2024.
*   At least one author of each accepted paper must register for the conference.

### Registration Rates (USD):

| Type of Registration | Early Rate | Regular Rate |
|----------------------|------------|--------------|
| Student              | 395        | 425          |
| Regular              | 535        | 635          |

## Proceedings

Proceedings for VMCAI 2025 are published in two Springer LNCS volumes: 15529 and 15530. Conference participants can download the proceedings from Springer for up to 4 weeks.

## Contact

For questions, use the [VMCAI contact form](https://conf.researchr.org/contact2/VMCAI-2025/VMCAI-2025-papers).

callForPapers:
# VLSID 2026: Call for Papers

The International Conference on VLSI Design (VLSID) provides a platform for researchers and practitioners to explore how VLSI and Embedded Systems can drive disruptive advancements for the next generation. VLSID 2026 will explore the frontiers of **VLSI & Embedded Systems**, with a special emphasis on **VLSI and Embedded AI for Next-Gen Electrified Mobility Powering Sustainable Future**.

## Submission Information

*   **Paper Submission:** Authors are invited to submit full-length papers (maximum 6 pages) along with an abstract of at most 200 words.
*   **Anonymity:** Double anonymous review is employed. Authors should not reveal their identity directly or indirectly. Previously published or under-review papers will not be considered.
*   **Format:** Electronic submission in PDF format is required. Papers should be in camera-ready IEEE two-column format, following IEEE proceedings specifications.
*   **Submission Portal:** Submissions are to be made electronically via [SoftConf](https://softconf.com/vlsi/vlsid2026/login/).
*   **Brochure:** For further details, download the brochure [here](https://vlsid.org/call-for-papers/).
*   **Enquiries:** Please [Contact Us](https://vlsid.org/contact-us/) for any questions.

## Topics of Interest

*   Hardware for Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
*   Analog & Mixed Signal and, RF Circuits
*   Sensors interfacing circuits and systems
*   Test, Verification and Reliability
*   Embedded Systems, Internet of Things (IoT), and Cyber-Physical System Design
*   Low power Digital Systems
*   Electronic design automation
*   Hardware and Systems Security
*   Photonic Integrated Circuits & Optical Communication
*   Power & Energy Management
*   Emerging Technologies: in-memory/near-memory computing, neuromorphic computing, Post-CMOS Technologies
*   Quantum computing – hardware, algorithms and security
*   3D IC and Advanced Packaging
*   Emerging Memory Technologies
*   Wireless systems 5G and beyond
*   Reconfigurable computing and processor design
*   VLSI circuits and systems for manufacturing, automotive and EVs

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Opens:** July 2, 2025
*   **Final Submission Deadline:** July 25, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** September 25, 2025

## Paper Publication and Presenter Registration

*   Papers will be accepted for regular or poster presentations.
*   At least one author MUST register for the conference by the time the camera-ready paper is submitted.
*   At least one author is expected to attend the conference and present the paper.

For more details on specific tracks, please refer to [Track Details](https://vlsid.org/track-details/).
[Submit your paper](https://softconf.com/vlsi/vlsid2026/login/)

callForPapers:
# WEBIST 2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Web Information Systems and Technologies (WEBIST) aims to bring together researchers, engineers, and practitioners interested in the technological advances and business applications of web-based information systems.

### Conference Tracks:

1.  **Internet Technology**
2.  **Web Intelligence and Semantic Web**
3.  **Social Network Analytics**
4.  **HCI in Mobile Systems and Web Interfaces**

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work in the form of a **complete paper** (Regular Paper or Position Paper) or an **abstract**.

*   **Regular Papers:** Represent completed and validated research.
*   **Position Papers:** Portray a short report of work in progress or an arguable opinion about an issue.
*   **Abstracts:** Presented but not published in the proceedings.

### Submission Guidelines:

*   Papers must be in English, carefully checked for grammar and spelling.
*   Submissions should indicate the nature of their contribution and applicability.
*   **Double-blind paper evaluation method:** Papers must be submitted WITHOUT any reference to the authors, including personal details, acknowledgments, or any other identifying information.
*   Only original papers should be submitted. Authors must read INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism.
*   Papers must be submitted through the online submission platform **PRIMORIS**.
*   Follow the instructions and templates found under [Guidelines](https://www.scitepress.org/Guidelines.aspx?y=2025) and [Templates](https://www.scitepress.org/Templates.aspx?y=2025).

## Publications

*   All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings, available in the [SCITEPRESS Digital Library](https://www.scitepress.org/PublishedPapers/2025).
*   Papers receive a DOI (Digital Object Identifier) and are submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science/Conference Proceedings Citation Index.
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.
*   It is planned to publish a short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers with Springer in a LNBIP Series book.

## Important Dates

*   **Conference Dates:** October 21 - 23, 2025

### Regular Papers:
*   **Paper Submission:** June 6, 2025 (expired)
*   **Authors Notification:** July 17, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** July 31, 2025

### Position Papers / Regular Papers:
*   **Paper Submission:** July 3, 2025 (expired)
*   **Authors Notification:** July 31, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** September 5, 2025

### Late-Breaking:
*   **Paper Submission:** July 24, 2025
*   **Authors Notification:** September 3, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** September 11, 2025

### Abstracts Track:
*   **Abstract Submission:** July 31, 2025
*   **Authors Notification:** September 8, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** September 17, 2025

*(Note: All dates refer to AOE time, i.e., "Anywhere on Earth")*

## Secretariat

WEBIST Secretariat
Address: Avenida de S. Francisco Xavier, Lote 7 Cv. C, 2900-616 Setúbal - Portugal
Tel.: +351 265 520 184
Fax: +351 265 520 186
e-mail: [webist.secretariat@insticc.org](mailto:webist.secretariat@insticc.org)
Web: [https://webist.scitevents.org](https://webist.scitevents.org)

## Venue

The conference will take place at the **Barceló Marbella hotel** in Marbella, Spain.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: Workshop on Computational Optimization (CO)

The Workshop on Computational Optimization (CO) is a thematic session within the Conference on Computer Science and Intelligence Systems (FedCSIS 2025), taking place in **Kraków, Poland, from September 14-17, 2025**.

### Aim and Scope

This workshop aims to stimulate communication between researchers working on different fields of optimization and practitioners who need reliable and efficient computational optimization methods. We invite original contributions related to both theoretical and practical aspects of optimization methods.

### Topics of Interest

The list of topics includes, but is not limited to:

*   Combinatorial and continuous global optimization
*   Unconstrained and constrained optimization
*   Multiobjective and robust optimization
*   Optimization in dynamic and/or noisy environments
*   Optimization on graphs
*   Large-scale optimization, in parallel and distributed computational environments
*   Meta-heuristics for optimization, nature-inspired approaches and any other derivative-free methods
*   Exact/heuristic hybrid methods, involving natural computing techniques and other global and local optimization methods
*   Numerical and heuristic methods for modeling

### Applications of Interest

The applications of interest are included in the list below, but are not limited to:

*   Classical operational research problems (knapsack, traveling salesman, etc.)
*   Computational biology and distance geometry
*   Data mining and knowledge discovery
*   Human motion simulations; crowd simulations
*   Industrial applications
*   Optimization in statistics, econometrics, finance, physics, chemistry, biology, medicine, and engineering
*   Environment modeling and optimization

### Submission Rules

*   Authors should submit their papers as Postscript, PDF or MSWord files.
*   The total length of a paper should not exceed **12 pages IEEE style** (including tables, figures and references). More pages can be added, for an additional fee.
*   IEEE style templates are available [here](/for_authors/instructions).
*   Papers will be refereed and accepted on the basis of their scientific merit and relevance to the Topical Area.
*   Preprints containing accepted papers will be published online.
*   Only papers presented at the conference will be published in Conference Proceedings and submitted for inclusion in the IEEE Xplore® database.
*   Conference proceedings will be published in a volume with ISBN, ISSN and DOI numbers and posted at the conference WWW site.
*   Conference proceedings will be submitted for indexation.
*   Organizers reserve the right to move accepted papers between FedCSIS Sessions.

### Important Dates

*   **Thematic Session proposal submission:** ~~26.11.2025~~ (Past)
*   **Paper submission (no extensions):** ~~25.05.2025~~ (Past)
*   **Position paper submission:** ~~10.06.2025~~ (Past)
*   **Author notification:** 8.07.2025
*   **Final paper submission, registration:** 15.07.2025
*   **Early registration discount:** 6.08.2025
*   **Conference date:** September 14-17.09.2025

### Submission Platform

CFP in EasyChair system: [https://easychair.org/cfp/fedcsis2025](https://easychair.org/cfp/fedcsis2025)

### Publication Opportunities

Extended versions of selected papers presented during the conference will be published as a volume in the **Studies in Computational Intelligence Springer series**.

callForPapers:
# IEEE/WIC/ACM International Conference on Web Intelligence (WI) 2025: Call for Papers

The **24th IEEE/WIC International Conference on Web Intelligence and Intelligent Agent Technology (WI-IAT'25)** provides a premier international forum to bring together researchers and practitioners from diverse fields for presentation of original research results, as well as exchange and dissemination of innovative and practical development experiences on Web intelligence and intelligent agent technology research and applications. The conference will take place from **November 15-18, 2025**, in **London, United Kingdom**, and will be held in a **hybrid mode** (both Online and Offline). The theme of WI-IAT '25 is: **“Web Intelligence = AI in the Connected World”**.

## Topics and Tracks

WI-IAT '25 welcomes research and application paper submissions in core thematic pillars, demanding WI innovative and disruptive solutions. Relevant topics include, but are not limited to:

*   **Track 1: Web of People**
*   **Track 2: Web of Data**
*   **Track 3: Web of Things**
*   **Track 4: Web of Trust**
*   **Track 5: Web of Agents**
*   **Special Track:** Web in Industry, Society, Education, Health and Smart Living, and the Web of Everything
*   **Special Track:** FAccT, LLM and AIGC

## Important Dates (Anywhere on Earth)

*   **Workshop/Special session Proposal Deadline:** 15 July 2025
*   **Full Paper Submission Deadline:** 25 July 2025
*   **Final Paper Acceptance Notification:** 25 August 2025
*   **Accepted Paper Registration Deadline and Camera-Ready Submission Deadline:** 15 September 2025
*   **Workshops and Special Sessions:** 15 November 2025
*   **The WI-IAT Main Conference:** 16-18 November 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Main Conference Paper Submission:** Submit via CyberChair at `https://wi-lab.com/cyberchair/2025/wi25/scripts/submit.php?subarea=WI`
*   **Workshops and Special Sessions Proposal Submission:** Submit via CyberChair at `https://wi-lab.com/cyberchair/2025/wi25/scripts/submit.php?subarea=ProW`
*   **Workshops and Special Sessions Paper Submission:** Decision by Each WS/SS
*   **Format:** Papers must be submitted in standard IEEE Conference Proceedings format.
*   **Page Limits:**
    *   Long paper: max **8 pages**
    *   Workshops paper: max **6 pages**
    *   Short paper: max **5 pages** (extendable up to a maximum of 2 pages)
*   **Templates:** Available at `https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html`.
*   **Review Process:** Submitted papers will undergo a peer review process, coordinated by the International Program Committee.
*   **Submission Anonymity:** All submissions to the WI-IAT'25 are **single blind** (i.e., the author names and affiliations should be present in the submitted manuscript).

## Publication Opportunities

*   Accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore subject to meeting IEEE Xplore’s scope and quality requirements.
*   Selected WI-IAT'25 papers will be further invited for expansion and publication in the **Web Intelligence Journal** and other international journals, including:
    *   *Brain Informatics* (Publisher: Springer Nature)
    *   *Natural Language Processing Journal* (Publisher: Elsevier) - [Towards Generative Modeling for Multimodal Deep Learning](https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/natural-language-processing-journal/about/call-for-papers#towards-generative-modeling-for-multimodal-deep-learning)
    *   *World Wide Web Journal* (Publisher: Springer Nature)
    *   *Cognitive Computation* (Publisher: Springer Nature)

## Keynote Speakers

*   **Professor Nadia Bianchi-Berthouze** (University College London, UK)
*   **Professor Georg Gottlob** (University of Calabria, Italy)
*   **Professor Yukio Ohsawa** (The University of Tokyo, Japan) - *Title: Web of Minds: Evolution of Common Senses in Societies with Diversity*

## Web Intelligence Academy (WIA)

The Web Intelligence Academy (WIA) promotes the advancement of science, engineering, and technology by recognizing and honoring leading intellectuals, scholars, researchers, and practitioners who have made significant, cumulative contributions to the field of Web Intelligence (WI).
